Title: Intern - Data Reduction (Software)
FullDescriptions:
Overview
At Aerojet Rocketdyne, our people further the exploration of space and help keep America safe! We develop and manufacture rocket engines in Redmond, Washington that are used on a variety of spacecraft. This summer 2020 intern opportunity will support the test lab data analysis group in the successful creation, modification, and improvement of software tools used to collect and organize rocket engine hot fire test results. Tasks will include developing software that will teach fundamentals of real time systems, multithreaded synchronization, software/hardware interfacing and/or large, high-speed data acquisition, machine learning, including data analysis, patterns and anomaly detection.
Essential Job Functions (Including % of Time for Each)
Under supervision, the Intern will:

70% - Write software to create tools to control rocket thrusters firings and collect and display rocket data.

20% - Learn how rocket thrusters are tested, from initial test requirements to implementing testing software and hardware.

10% - Create a presentation of the items learned during the internship.
Requirements
Students must be actively pursuing a Bachelor’s or advanced degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering with Software Experience. Must have ability/experience working in a team environment and excellent written and verbal skills.

US Citizenship required. Must also be able to satisfy federal government requirements for access to government information, and having dual citizenship may preclude you from being able to meet this requirement.

Work Environment and Physical Requirements:
Employees in these positions must possess mobility to work in a standard office setting and to use standard office equipment, including a computer; stamina to sit or stand and maintain attention to detail despite interruptions; may occasionally lift/carry/push/pull up to 25 pounds; may require occasional walking, climbing, stooping, crouching, and/or bending; and vision to read printed materials and a computer screen, and hearing and speech to communicate in person and over the telephone. May require the ability to travel by air or auto. May require the use of personal protective equipment such as safety glasses, safety shoes, and shop coat. These positions may be expected to work varying shifts and hours to ensure successful operation of activities in the organization.

Title: Intern - Data Scientist
FullDescriptions:
Description
Our Mission
At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:
Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.
We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.
Your Career
We are looking for a brilliant Data Scientist that wants to make a career out of using machine learning to address security problems. Previous intern projects include building a novel ML algorithm in Hadoop, setting up a pipeline that classifies over 1M webpages a year, building a classifier to detect malicious Javascript pages, a classifier to identify web applications and upgrading production systems to use deep learning models instead of traditional ML models. A high percentage of data science interns join the Palo Alto Networks team full time.
Our Summer Internship Program from May-August or June-September provides you:
1:1 mentorship
Fun and engaging events that inspire your intellectual curiosity
The opportunity to expand your knowledge and work on challenging projects
Connections to other recent grads, and employees across the company as well as our leaders
Your Impact
Learn to apply Machine Learning in a production environment
You will be exposed to research related to security and malware.
Work on large Hadoop and/or Spark clusters on petabytes of data
Your Experience
Be an excellent programmer; experience with distributed systems like Hadoop or Spark a big plus
Have a strong working knowledge of machine learning algorithms that may include Naïve Bayes, Decision Trees, SVM, Logistic Regression, Deep Learning, and Boosting
Be comfortable working independently, be able to produce something impressive in one summer, have the ability to come up with novel solutions to difficult problems
Requirements – To apply, you must be pursuing a 4-year Undergraduate Degree with a GPA of 3.0 or above, a 2-year Master’s Degree or a Doctorate degree and returning to school in the fall. You must have the authorization to work within the United States.
The Team
To stay ahead of the curve, it’s critical to know where the curve is, and how to anticipate the changes we may be facing. For the fastest growing cybersecurity company, the curve is the evolution of cyberattacks, and the products and services that proactively address them. As a predictive enterprise environment, we analyze petabytes of data that pass through our walls daily and we hire the most talented minds in data science to build creative predictive analytics and data science solutions for our cybersecurity solutions.
Our Commitment
We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.
We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.
Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.

Title: Intern - IT Data Science
FullDescriptions:
Description
Our Mission
At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:

Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.
We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.
Your Career
Our AI & Analytics group is responsible for working with business owners/stakeholders to solve difficult business problems which will have a direct impact on the metrics defined to showcase the progress. As a team we like to understand how to inject raw data into our clusters from multiple sources, build ETL framework on the top of these data sources and finally design & implement ML/AI framework on the top of the raw data to generate business insights which is presented to our end users through various Apps/portals.
Past projects have ranged from segmentation to forecasting problems involving NLP. The typical work will involve building ETL on raw data to implementing ML framework and conveying insights from the algorithmic output to stakeholders.
Our Summer Internship Program from May-August or June-September provides you:
1:1 mentorship
Fun and engaging events that inspire your intellectual curiosity
Opportunities to expand your knowledge and work on challenging projects
Connections to other interns, recent grads, and employees across the company as well as our leaders
Your Impact
Closely work with business owners to understand the challenges in solving practical problems
Unique culture to understand how to build data science pipelines and features are different from simple analytics and visualization.
Unique opportunity to closely work with Data scientists to learn how they think about requirements on features and data processing to build and serve various models
Work with quality peers to lean on their best practices
Work with cutting edge technologies and frameworks in AI/ML space
Your Experience
Have experience with Python
Good understanding of ML/AI algorithms
Think out of the box
Willing to solve non-academic problems
Good communication skills
Requirements – To apply, you must be pursuing a 4-year Undergraduate Degree, a 2-year Master’s Degree or a Doctorate degree and returning to school in the fall. You must have the authorization to work within the United States.

*Please note that we will not sponsor applicants for work visas for this position*
The Team
To stay ahead of the curve, it’s critical to know where the curve is, and how to anticipate the changes we may be facing. For the fastest growing cybersecurity company, the curve is the evolution of cyberattacks, and the products and services that proactively address them. As a predictive enterprise environment, we analyze petabytes of data that pass through our walls daily and we hire the most talented minds in data science to build creative predictive analytics and data science solutions for our cybersecurity solutions.
Our Commitment
We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.
We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.
Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.

Title: Intern - Software Engineer (Bachelor's Degree) - Multiple Locations
Qualifications:
Must have a High School diploma or equivalent
Pursuing a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, SW Engineering, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field, graduating December 2020 or later
Minimum GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0 (or equivalent scale)
FullDescriptions:
Job Description

As a Software Engineer, you could work in the following roles:
Front End Development
Backend End Development
Full Stack Development
API Developer
Mobile Development
Data Analyst
QA
Specific assignments will depend on upon your skills sets, interest, location and team needs.
Software Engineer Interns will be placed in one of the Technology Organization teams. Here is a list and brief descriptions:
Network Processing: At its core, Visa is a payments network that connects consumers and merchants with financial institutions. The team is building the long-term architecture on architecture on open platforms and commodity hardware, as well as opening our technology platforms to enable industry collaboration and innovation through co- development.

Issuer Processing: Debit Processing Services (DPS), our Issuer Processing platform for North America, processes over half of all Visa Debit transactions and is the largest single prepaid processing platform for Visa prepaid transactions in the U.S. The team also partners with third-party companies outside of the U.S. to deliver value-added services through Visa-owned assets.

Merchant + Acquirer Processing: Merchant and Acquirer Processing (MAP) is focused on executing the Visa Merchant Strategy, building deeper merchant and acquirer relationships and increasing Total Merchant Value by developing solutions that address complex and emerging merchant and acquirer needs.

Digital and Developer Platform: Develop, deliver, and manage end-to-end technology products, services, capabilities, and solutions while collaborating with a global community of client, merchant, and partner developers to promote the growth of digital commerce and mobilization of payments in emerging and developed markets

Data Product Development: Develops and manages end-to-end technology solutions that create value from our enterprise data through internal and client-focused information-based services, business intelligence and insights, and data-driven product innovation.

Data Platform: We deliver secure, high-quality and easy-to-use Visa core data assets as a service, together with reliable and scalable data platform as a service, that enable Visa internal partners to rapidly and efficiently innovate data-driven business products and services to lead the digital payment industry

Cybersecurity: Cybersecurity provides enterprise-wide, risk-based security and continuity programs, and continually evolves security and continuity capabilities to meet changing internal and external threat landscapes.

Corporate IT: Build, operate and maintain the IT systems and infrastructure necessary to enable a highly connected and collaborative workforce that helps power Visa’s business.

Technology Planning and Business Operations: Provides a structured approach to synchronize, align and unite technology delivery capabilities with business management strategies for improved Technology + Operations organizational performance, execution and risk control.

Operations + Infrastructure: For Visa to deliver on the vision of the best way to pay and be paid for everyone, everywhere, O&I must provide best-in-class infrastructure services that are secure, scalable, continuously available, and run on software-defined infrastructures.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications
Must have a High School diploma or equivalent
Pursuing a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, SW Engineering, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field, graduating December 2020 or later
Minimum GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0 (or equivalent scale)
Preferred Qualifications
Proficiency in at least one programming language or technology including, but not limited to:
Java/J2EE, C/C++, C#, .NET, python, PHP, Ruby on Rails, XML, Javascript, HTML, CSS, Objective-C, OOD, GoLang, Docker
Familiar with: JSON, REST APIs, MongoDB, AngularJS, ExpressJS, NodeJS, React
Big Data technologies: Hadoop, Spark, R, NoSQL
The ability to tackle challenges and address problems head-on
Strong ability to collaborate
Highly driven, inventive and results oriented
Additional Information

Work Hours This position requires the incumbent to be available during core business hours.
Travel Requirements This position requires the incumbent to travel for work 0% of the time.
Mental/Physical Requirements This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers, and reach with hands and arms.
EEO Statement Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Title: Intern, CET Academic Affairs
FullDescriptions:
Status: Part-time; 10-15 hours/week

Job location: Washington, DC

Application Deadline: Application review will begin September 27, 2019

Start Date: October 2019

Supervisor: Data Analyst and Academic Coordinator

____________________________________________________________________________________

Description of the Organization

CET Academic Programs is a study abroad organization that has been developing and delivering innovative educational programs abroad since 1982. Originally "China Educational Tours," CET began operations in Beijing, and today offers a varied portfolio of semester, summer, and short-term customized programs for college, high school, pre-college, and gap year students around the world. Known for strong academics, professional program management, and supportive student services, CET strives to integrate students into their host communities, adopt environmentally conscientious practices, and promote diversity and inclusion across all programs.

Description of the Position

CET seeks an Academic Affairs Intern to assist with academic administration and data collection and management. Interns will primarily support tasks related to academic policies and processes, and will contribute to data collection, cleaning, and analysis. The ideal candidate will be detail-oriented, have experience (or interest) in data analysis and visualization, and be proficient in Excel.

Internships at CET provide an opportunity to gain hands-on experience in the field of study abroad and learn from a staff of dedicated professionals. Interns gain a behind-the-scenes view of how study abroad program providers operate, and in-depth knowledge of office operations and international program administration. This internship in particular will offer interns practical training in data analysis and visualization.

Internships are for a minimum of 3 months. Pending availability and exemplary work, interns may continue for a longer term and should indicate the length of tenure interested in their cover letter.

Responsibilities

Academic Affairs


Assist with maintaining academic documentation across all programs
Handle the fulfillment of alumni transcript requests
Scan and file transcripts as they are processed
Maintain and improve CET's transcript storage system

Data Cleaning & Analysis


Analyze and visualize data gathered from program evaluations using Excel formulas and graphing tools
Clean data to prepare it for analysis
Code students' free response answers to evaluations
Create new visualizations that showcase longitudinal trends
Additional research projects, as needed

Office Management and Staff Support


Serve as a front desk representative of CET and ATA, welcoming guests and visitors
Answer CET phone lines and direct calls to appropriate staff
Monitor the CET email accounts
Sort and distribute mail
Assist staff in other departments with projects, as needed

Requirements


Superior organizational skills and attention to detail
Mid-to-high proficiency in Microsoft Excel
Some experience cleaning, analyzing, and visualizing data preferred
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong time management skills: ability to set and manage conflicting priorities, work efficiently in a fast-paced environment, and complete multiple projects under time constraints
Cultural sensitivity and experience working with students of diverse backgrounds
Ability to take initiative and use good judgement when solving problems
Patience, flexibility, a positive attitude and a sense of humor

Salaries/Benefits

The salary for this position is $14.00/hour.

To Apply

Our company is committed to diversity, and we work hard to maintain a welcoming, non-discriminatory office culture. We welcome qualified applicants of all backgrounds to apply to our openings. It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other protected characteristic under applicable law.

This position is for employment within the United States. Please note that our company does not sponsor U.S. employment visas.

Qualified candidates should submit the following:

Résumé.
Formal cover letter that outlines the position to which you are applying, your qualifications and experience, where you first heard about the position, and the length of tenure interested.

Applications missing any of these components will not be considered.

Title: Intern, Data Science
Qualifications:
Must be at least 18 and enrolled in college or non-traditional education, such as coding boot camps or industry-related vocational classes
A mix of previous internship, school project, volunteer and leadership experience is also important
Responsibilities:
Experience with data mining algorithms and techniques: GLMs, CART/CHAID, Random Forests, Gradient Boosting, Cluster Analysis, Recommender systems, Time Series Analysis, Survival Analysis, Text Mining, etc.
Proficiency with Python or R, SQL and familiarity with working in big data environments like Hadoop, Hive and Spark
The ideal candidate is a strong data scientist who thinks outside the box, is naturally curious, highly collaborative, and has a passion for tackling complex data-centric problems
FullDescriptions:
Autodesk customers make sense of the world through rich streams of data that might include 3D scans of buildings, fluid dynamic simulations, daily notes on the construction site, trends on product usage and more. As a Summer 2020 Data Science intern, you will get to apply your knowledge in data engineering, work with the latest machine learning models, and make an impact by helping our customers create a better, safer, more sustainable world.

Possible Locations
SF Bay Area
Portland
Boston
Boulder/Denver
Novi

Responsibilities
Experience with data mining algorithms and techniques: GLMs, CART/CHAID, Random Forests, Gradient Boosting, Cluster Analysis, Recommender systems, Time Series Analysis, Survival Analysis, Text Mining, etc.
Proficiency with Python or R, SQL and familiarity with working in big data environments like Hadoop, Hive and Spark
The ideal candidate is a strong data scientist who thinks outside the box, is naturally curious, highly collaborative, and has a passion for tackling complex data-centric problems

Minimum Qualifications
Must be at least 18 and enrolled in college or non-traditional education, such as coding boot camps or industry-related vocational classes
A mix of previous internship, school project, volunteer and leadership experience is also important

Preferred Qualifications
Pursuing a Masters or PhD in Statistics, Math, Computer Science, Information Science, Data Science, Analytics, Machine Learning, Physical Sciences, or a related field

About the US Intern Program
The U.S. program runs from May through August for 12 weeks. Interns have the opportunity to work alongside peers from universities all over the country and participate in intern events such as tech talks, design nights, mentoring, baseball games, bowling, local attractions and more.

US recruiting begins in the Fall and concludes end of March.

About Autodesk
With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It's disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital scientists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.

Americas-United States of America-Massachusetts-Boston, Americas-United States of America-California-San Rafael, Americas-United States of America-Michigan-Novi, Americas-United States of America-Oregon-Portland
At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.
To all recruitment agencies: Autodesk does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Autodesk will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Autodesk, Inc.

Title: Intern: Data Science
FullDescriptions:
The Data Science and Engineering team builds Asana's core data pipelines and tools, and partners with teams throughout the company to drive key product and business decisions with metrics, experiments, and predictive models. As a Data Scientist at Asana, you'll help us ask the right questions and answer them rigorously. You'll work closely with our Product and Business teams to understand their goals and proactively inform their direction with data. You'll keep taking on new responsibilities as you grow—from defining core metrics to building machine learning models and keeping the data flowing in our pipelines.

What you'll achieve
-------------------


Design and analyze experiments to measure the impact of new product features
Investigate high-level questions such as "What are the collaborative patterns of the most successful teams using Asana?"
Add new metrics and aggregations to our data warehouse to make new classes of questions answerable
Build models to predict the growth trajectory of different customer segments
Experience growth and development by beingpaired with a mentor ( https://blog.gitprime.com/mentor-manager-approach-employee-motivation/ ) who will support and guide you through opportunities to stretch and learn.
Ability to craft your career path, ultimately finding the teams and projects that you're passionate about where you can most help humanity thrive.

About you
---------


Strong technical background in computer science, statistics, math, information science, or another quantitative field
Fluency in at least one modern language useful for data processing (e.g. Python, Scala)
Proficiency with relational data modeling and SQL
Expertise in statistical methods and experimental design and analysis
Pursuing a Bachelors, Masters, or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related technical discipline
Experience with distributed data processing systems (e.g. Spark, Redshift)
Background in advanced statistical modeling (e.g. GLM, mixed effects) and/or machine learning

About us

Asana is a leading work management platform, helping more than 70,000 organizations and millions of users across 195 countries organize and manage all of their work, including AB-InBev, Airbnb, KLM Air France, NASA, Overstock.com, Uber, Viessmann Group, and Vox Media. Asana has been named a Top 5 Best Place to Work by FORTUNE three years in a row, and one of Glassdoor's and Inc.'s Best Places to Work. Headquartered in San Francisco with offices in New York, Dublin, Sydney, Vancouver, and Reykjavík, Asana is always looking for curious, collaborative people to be a part of our inclusive culture and help us achieve our mission.

Our goal is to ensure that Asana upholds an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued, whether they are applying for an open position or working at the company. We welcome applicants of all educational backgrounds, gender identities and expressions, sexual orientations, religions, ethnicities, ages, citizenships, socioeconomic statuses, disabilities, and veteran statuses, and we'd love to learn about what you can add to our team.

Learn more about Data Science and Engineering at Asana:

Our Asana Engineering blog ( https://blog.asana.com/category/eng/ )
The Asana Engineering Guide to Intern Mentorship ( https://blog.asana.com/2019/05/engineering-guide-to-intern-mentorship/ )
Our summer 2018 internship program in review ( https://blog.asana.com/2018/09/2018-summer-intern-class/ )
Why I joined Asana: Rishika Dhody, Data Scientist ( https://blog.asana.com/2019/07/rishika-dhody/ )

Title: Internship & New Graduate Program 2020
FullDescriptions:
ABOUT US
Lark is the world's largest A.I. healthcare provider, servicing more than a million patients suffering from, or at risk of, chronic disease with A.I. Nurses. We're on a mission to improve people's health and happiness through our digital health coach. We are the only A.I. nurse ever to become fully medically reimbursed to 100% replace a live nurse because we achieved equivalent health outcomes to live healthcare professionals - which allows for infinitely scalable healthcare. Since launch Lark has continued to receive awards and accolades for both our product, and our leadership.

✦Apple's Top 10 Apps in the World
✧Business Insider's most innovative companies in the world along with Uber and Snapchat
✦Forbes-recognized CEO, listed as #1 in Top Ten Women in Tech

We are looking for a talented interns to join our growing team in Mountain View, CA, where you'll help build and scale the intelligent engine that is interpreting the world's health sensor data and empowering people to live fitter and happier lives.

Exciting opportunities with the team for internships and graduate roles below:

Data Analyst - Join an exciting team that is working on generating valuable insights based on user behavior.

On the Data team you will:

Support the team's ongoing efforts around data-driven decisions
Make sense of mass amounts of user behavior
Ensure ongoing collaboration between engineering, product, and data

Mobile Engineer - This team focusing on accessibility and increasing the quality of Lark's product! Bonus points if you love native mobile applications.

On the Mobile team you will:

Brainstorm solutions around product features
Own projects around the usability and quality improvements
Help optimize the product on both iOS and Android platforms

Backend Engineer - This exciting team is doing work around effective solutions for API scalability.

On the Backend team you will:

Ship robust, scalable code
Help develop API efficiencies
Increase reliability and usability of Lark's product
Exciting ownership of projects

Product - Work with a team working in nuanced behavior technologies. This role is likely to focus on tackling difficult UX issues.

On the Product team you will:

Develop User Insights and contribute to our behavior-changing technology
Create suggestions for improvement based on user data
Develop technology systems that support the product.
Work with content developers to add features or fix issues with the product.
Respond to product feedback requests from partners and users

Business Operations - Help Lark develop our business strategy, and jump in to help create streamlined, optimized operational efficiencies. This team requires analytical skills.

On the Business Operations team you will:

Support the team's ongoing strategic and market analysis efforts
Collaborate between departments internally to create smooth lines of communication
Draft proposals around efficiency improvements
Work with the team to implement optimizations

Why Lark?

Here's some information about the exciting projects our prior interns completed:


Rewriting our app from Objective-C to react native
Building core backend features (internal notification system, push notification logic)
Performance engineering/optimizations on backend
Contributing to development of a new, refactored backend

JOIN US
Our team works with cutting edge tools and technology related to Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. We are using NLP to process millions of meals, and accelerometer data to compute activity and sleep amounts from users' phones. Our chat AI is the most sophisticated digital health engagement tool in the world. Join us and make it even better!

Lark is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Lark does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

Title: Internship – Multiple Locations – Data Science
FullDescriptions:
Expedia
What You’ll do:
You will use statistics, distributions and confidence intervals to make confident decisions based on data
You will manipulate large data sets for business insights and drive solutions
You will also communicate complex analytical topics in a clean & simple way to multiple partners and senior leadership (both internal & external)
Who You are:
You are currently pursuing a Master’s or PhD degree in quantitative fields such as:
Computer Science (Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, Data Mining, Data Science)
Mathematics
Statistics
Operations Research
Graduating in December 2020 or Spring 2021
3.0 or above minimum cumulative G.P.A with prior internship, related projects or leadership experience
You have proven theoretical understanding of supervised and unsupervised machine learning algorithms like Regression, Naïve Bayes, Decision Trees, Random Forests, Boosted Decision Trees, SVMs, Neural Networks, etc.
We would like to see experience with statistical computing environments such as R, scikit-learn, SparkML, Python (pandas), SAS etc.
You should have strong knowledge and experience in database technologies, including SQL and other relational databases, no-SQL, and Time Series databases
You have an understanding of distributed file systems, scalable datastores, distributed computing and related technologies (Spark, Hadoop, etc.); implementation experience of MapReduce techniques, in-memory data processing, etc.
You have familiarity with cloud computing, AWS specifically, in a distributed computing context.
Your internship will include:
Dedicated support from your manager and mentor for the summer
Social, community and learning events
Relocation assistance, if eligible
Hotel discounts
Some exciting projects our interns have worked on in this team have been:
Recently, our interns built a policy recommender for hotel per diem, involving price prediction, client flexibility in outcome and geographic layout.
They also built and refined hotel rate selection algorithms to balance Egencia, Egencia client and traveler needs.
You’ve Applied, Now What?
We will review your application and if you are considered a fit, we will invite you to take an online assessment. Those who pass the assessment will be invited for a final interview.
Intern Program Dates: To ensure a consistent experience, we offer two different start dates. These dates accommodate varying school’s schedules.
Group 1: May 26 – August 14
Group 2: June 15 – September 4
Why Join Us?
Expedia Group recognizes our success is dependent on the success of our people. We are the world's travel platform, made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business. Our brands recognize the power of travel to break down barriers and make people's lives better – that responsibility encourages us to be the place where extraordinary people want to do their best work, and to provide them to tools to do so.
Whether you're applying to work in engineering or customer support, marketing or lodging supply, at Expedia Group we act as one team, working towards a common goal; to bring the world within reach. We relentlessly strive for better, but not at the cost of the customer. We act with humility and optimism, respecting ideas big and small. We value diversity and voices of all volumes. We are a global organization but keep our feet on the ground so we can act fast and stay simple. Our teams also have the chance to give back on a local level and make a difference through our corporate social responsibility program, Expedia Cares.
If you have a hunger to make a difference with one of the most loved consumer brands in the world and to work in the dynamic travel industry, then this is the job for you.
About Us:
Our family of travel brands includes: Brand Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Egencia®, trivago®, HomeAway®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Wotif®, lastminute.com.au®, ebookers®, CheapTickets®, Hotwire®, Classic Vacations®, Expedia® Media Solutions, CarRentals.com™, Expedia Local Expert®, Expedia® CruiseShipCenters®, SilverRail Technologies, Inc., ALICE and Traveldoo®.
More About Us:
We are excited to move to our new Seattle Campus later this year. The campus features onsite wellness and market hall with amazing food options on 40 acres of waterfront property. Check out the campus and latest news on https://lifeatexpedia.com/seattle-campus
Expedia is committed to creating an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. This employer participates in E-Verify. The employer will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) with information from each new employee's I-9 to confirm work authorization.

Title: Internship Data Scientist, Product Analytics
FullDescriptions:
Who we are
At Criteo, we are building the advertising platform of choice for the open Internet, an ecosystem that favors neutrality, transparency and inclusiveness. With more than 1.4 billion active shoppers and $600 billion in annual commerce sales, we deliver performance at scale. Founded in a Paris start-up incubator, Criteo now carries out our entrepreneurial spirit across 30+ global offices. Do you want to have an impact on more than half of the world’s internet users? Join us and be part of something big.

We are innovative, passionate and result-driven. We are an interdisciplinary team, leveraging the strengths of engineers and scientists.
The Data Science - Product Analytics team uses cutting edge technology, advanced statistics and machine learning to understand the most complex business problems at Criteo. We are committed to designing and building technical solutions to drive Criteo’s development and keep up with a fast-evolving product landscape.
We serve as trusted partners to leadership and work closely with PMs, R&D, Finance or Business teams.

Inside Data Science - Product Analytics:
Find new ways to optimize the bidding strategy
Optimize our capability to recognize users across all their devices and their interactions in the open-internet
Define, drive and analyze results of A/B tests to assess whether online performance is in line with offline simulations
Provide data-driven insights to ensure Criteo remains one step ahead of competitive threats
Identify and size development opportunities for new products
What will you do?
Mine large data sets and turn them into understandable and actionable insights
Build scalable analytic solutions using state of the art tools based on large and granular datasets
Design and execute a stream of analysis and tests to measure the impact of your solutions
Master our internal analytic datasets and reporting tools
Who are you?
Last year of Master’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, Economics,etc.)
Internship of a minimum of 6 months
Outstanding analytical skills and creative thinking
Fluency in the core toolkit of Data Science:
R/Python; SQL/Hive
Manipulating large-scale data sets
Building data pipelines
Descriptive and predictive modelling
Implementing visualizations, dashboards, and reports
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, pro-active and independent
Fun to work with!
At Criteo, we dare to be different. We believe that diversity fuels innovation and creates an energy that can be seen and felt all over Criteo. We champion different perspectives and are committed to creating a workplace where all Criteos are heard, feel a sense of belonging, and are treated with respect and dignity.

At Criteo, we dare to be different. We believe that diversity fuels innovation and creates an energy that can be seen and felt all over Criteo. We champion different perspectives and are committed to creating a workplace where all Criteos are heard and feel a sense of belonging.

Consequently, Criteo may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants. Your information will be accessible to the different Criteo entities across the world. By clicking the "Apply" button you expressly give your consent.

Title: Internship Opportunities for PhD Students: Data & Applied Sciences
Qualifications:
Currently pursuing a PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Applied Sciences like Biostatistics, Physics, Chemistry, Computational Neurology and or other quant-focused field with at least one semester/quarter remaining after internship.
Some Engineering experience and or project course work using large data systems on SQL, Hadoop, etc.
Proficiency using one or more programming or scripting language to work with data such as: Python, Perl, or C#.
Some experience and or project course work performing data analysis and applying statistics working with tools such as: Excel, R, MATLAB, AMPL, or SAS.
Some experience and or project course work with product and service telemetry systems.

Passion to learn from your peers, manager, and other stakeholders in the Data Science domain.

Strong interpersonal and communications skills.

FullDescriptions:
Data Scientists at Microsoft help to improve the quality of experiences on our devices and services. We are looking for highly motivated and passionate Data Scientists to apply rigorous scientific methodology and algorithms to data in order to improve Microsoft’s devices, operating systems, and services. As a Data Scientist, you will provide unique insight into business and customer scenarios that cut across organizational boundaries and lead the growth of a data-driven culture within Microsoft.

Do you want to work on a meaningful and impactful project and make a difference?
Are you willing to learn from others and open to new ideas?
Do you want to support others to succeed and operate in a highly-collaborative and global environment?
If this sounds like you, Microsoft would like to invite you to come join us as you are, where you can find more than just a job.
Read on to learn more about opportunities and apply online!
Responsibilities
As a Data Scientist intern, you will formulate approaches to solve problems using well-defined algorithms and data sources. You will incorporate an understanding of product functionality and customer perspective to provide context for those problems. You will use data exploration techniques to discover new questions or opportunities within your problem area and propose applicability and limitations of the data. Successful Data Scientists will interpret the results of their analysis, validate their approach, and learn to monitor, analyze, and iterate to continuously improve.

You will engage with peer stakeholders to produce clear, compelling, actionable insights that influence product and service improvements that will impact millions of customers. As a Data Scientist, you will also engage in the peer review process and act on feedback while learning innovative methods, algorithms, and tools to increase the impact and applicability of your results.
Qualifications
Currently pursuing a PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Applied Sciences like Biostatistics, Physics, Chemistry, Computational Neurology and or other quant-focused field with at least one semester/quarter remaining after internship.
Some Engineering experience and or project course work using large data systems on SQL, Hadoop, etc.
Proficiency using one or more programming or scripting language to work with data such as: Python, Perl, or C#.
Some experience and or project course work performing data analysis and applying statistics working with tools such as: Excel, R, MATLAB, AMPL, or SAS.
Some experience and or project course work with product and service telemetry systems.
Some A/B Testing or experimentation (this can be from conducting real life science experiments, hypothesis testing in stats etc.) Not required but ideal.
Some experience or course work applying basic ML to a type of data and or used algorithms to conduct experiments on data. Machine Learning strongly encouraged.
Passion to learn from your peers, manager, and other stakeholders in the Data Science domain.
Ability to interact with peers and stakeholders to drive product and business impact.
Strong interpersonal and communications skills.

Title: IWC Student Advisor (144X) [238]
FullDescriptions:
POSITION TITLE: IWC Student Advisor
JOB CODE: 144X

DIVISION: Academic Division/Teaching & Learning
SALARY SCHEDULE: Teacher

DEPARTMENT: Federal Programs
WORK DAYS: 238

REPORTS TO: Supervisor, International Welcome Center
PAY GRADE: CZ00 - Based on CIT (5, 6 or 7)

FLSA: Exempt
PAY FREQUENCY: Monthly

PRIMARY FUNCTION: Performs all aspects of the student intake process for all middle school and high school level ESOL, international and immigrant students and their families in accordance with District ESOL and Title III requirements.

REQUIREMENTS:
1.
Educational Level: Master Degree required

2.
Certification/License Required: Valid Teaching Certificate requirement, ESOL Endorsement preferred

3.
Experience: 5 years minimum teaching or school counseling experience required; experience with EL populations preferred

4.
Physical Activities: Routine physical activities that are required to fulfill job responsibilities

5.
Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities: Written and oral communication, bilingual preferred

The Board of Education and the Superintendent may accept alternatives to some of the above requirements.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES:
1.
Demonstrates prompt and regular attendance.

2.
Advises ESOL, international and immigrant students and their families about grade placement, academic profile and educational opportunities.

3.
Screens English proficiency of middle and high school PHLOTE students for ESOL program placement and/or IEL services; arranges transportation for IEL students from home school to IEL center.

4.
Reviews and evaluates documents such as international transcripts, educational history, and international exchange program applications to ensure a complete and accurate student profile for grade and course placement in accordance with federal, state and local requirements.

5.
Assists in the coordination of ESOL and international student intake staff for the student intake process.

6.
Collaborates with ESOL Supervisor, District ESOL Consultants, local school counselors and staff, content supervisors, policy, other departments and outside agencies to ensure accurate placement and support of EL and immigrant students, and international exchange students.

7.
Conducts interviews of PHLOTE families and students, secures social and academic background on students, and provides information and guidance regarding grade level and course credit requirements for graduation.

8.
Welcomes PHLOTE families, provides information and connects middle and high school ELs and immigrant students and their families with Parent Resource Facilitators, community contacts, agencies, and resources for self-improvement in terms of job skills and literacy and computer classes so they can be active participants in the education of their children.

9.
Coordinates communication with private schools in the district about available ESOL services and collection of data for the Private School Title III Service Annual Report and organizes the responses into a report.

10.
Ensures that logistics requirements are met in setting up Title III Professional Development Courses (both ESOL Endorsement and mini workshops), such as registration requirements, online needs, locations, instructors, time, syllabi, etc.; managing cohorts; and helping teacher candidates with submitting documentation of course completion and certification to RESA, CCSD Human Resources and the Professional Learning Division.

11.
Assists consultants and the Research and Data Analyst in the planning, development, and administration of needs assessment surveys on professional development, parental engagement, and EL reports and record keeping to all schools in the district as well as in the collection and organization of raw data into spreadsheets for analysis.

12.
Performs other duties as assigned by appropriate administrator.

Estimated Start Date *09/16/2019

Title: Jr. Sales Engineer
Qualifications:
Minimum 3+ years of client facing experience in an analytics development capacity (BI Analyst, BI Developer, Visualization Developer, Data Analyst) with an Enterprise Analytics vendor, Professional Services firm, an internal strategy/analytics group of an F100, or similar environment.
Demonstrated ability to develop simple solutions to the most complex problems and recommend the best solution to the business and technical teams.
Strong communication & presentation skills with the ability to explain technical concepts and analytics-driven findings to business people, and to explain business processes, concepts, challenges to engineers.
Working to expert knowledge of SQL and JavaScript syntax, tools and development patterns
Ability to work in a fast paced and rapidly changing environment with a hands-on mentality toward assigned tasks and responsibilities.
Possess a high-level of attention to accuracy and detail.
Ability to interact and influence people within different areas of the organization.
Ability to work independently and perform multiple tasks.
Ability to handle confidential information.
Responsibilities:
Implement existing and develop new automation tools to accelerate delivery of production ready Proof of Concepts.
Develop and maintain API integrations which support a variety of embedded analytics user experiences.
Contribute to and evolve software SDKs and platform automations based on existing development standards and practices.
Keep current on GoodData product releases and new features and maintain knowledge of broader technology landscape and developments related to GoodData
Serve as technical liaison with internal stakeholders (e.g. Product Management, Product Marketing, and Professional Services) to include documenting and delivering product feedback and new requirements from the field
Be available for travel 15% of the time.
Desire to grow into a customer focus technical sales person
FullDescriptions:
Company Description
Rated 32nd Most Successful SaaS Company in the world by Montclare, GoodData is on a mission to fundamentally change how analytics are used and adopted throughout the organization. With more than 50 percent of the Fortune 500 using GoodData, millions of end users and a massively scalable and secure Enterprise Insights Platform, GoodData works with customers to drive a business outcome focus allowing data to finally drive meaningful change for the business.
Today, some of the most well-known brands are using the GoodData Enterprise Insights Platform to disrupt their industries, improve productivity and make business-critical decisions, to create revenue-generating Smart Business Applications. According to Forrester, insights-driven businesses will steal $1.2 Trillion/year from traditional market players by 2020. This is the transformation GoodData is enabling globally.
GoodData is headquartered in San Francisco and backed by top-tier investors like Andreessen Horowitz, General Catalyst Partners, Intel Capital, TOTVS and others. For more information visit our website and follow GoodData on Twitter and LinkedIn.
GoodData is looking for a passionate and proactive Technical Consultant. The ideal candidate will understand the technical challenges across the overall analytics landscape and relish the opportunity to accelerate the evaluation and implementation of GoodData to leading Enterprises and ISVs. The Implementation Consultant's primary responsibility is to partner with the Account Executives and Sr. Sales Engineers to implement GoodData Analytics platform in an efficient and repeatable process using SDKs and APIs to demonstrate the agility, extensibility and scalability of the GoodData platform.

Responsibilities:
Implement existing and develop new automation tools to accelerate delivery of production ready Proof of Concepts.
Develop and maintain API integrations which support a variety of embedded analytics user experiences.
Contribute to and evolve software SDKs and platform automations based on existing development standards and practices.
Keep current on GoodData product releases and new features and maintain knowledge of broader technology landscape and developments related to GoodData
Serve as technical liaison with internal stakeholders (e.g. Product Management, Product Marketing, and Professional Services) to include documenting and delivering product feedback and new requirements from the field
Be available for travel 15% of the time.
Desire to grow into a customer focus technical sales person

Qualifications:
Minimum 3+ years of client facing experience in an analytics development capacity (BI Analyst, BI Developer, Visualization Developer, Data Analyst) with an Enterprise Analytics vendor, Professional Services firm, an internal strategy/analytics group of an F100, or similar environment.
Demonstrated ability to develop simple solutions to the most complex problems and recommend the best solution to the business and technical teams.
Strong communication & presentation skills with the ability to explain technical concepts and analytics-driven findings to business people, and to explain business processes, concepts, challenges to engineers.
Working to expert knowledge of SQL and JavaScript syntax, tools and development patterns
Ability to work in a fast paced and rapidly changing environment with a hands-on mentality toward assigned tasks and responsibilities.
Possess a high-level of attention to accuracy and detail.
Ability to interact and influence people within different areas of the organization.
Ability to work independently and perform multiple tasks.
Ability to handle confidential information.

About GoodData
At GoodData, our mission is to build groundbreaking tools that revolutionize how data drives business. GoodData leads the way in helping companies gain true insights from all of the data available to them, empowering our customers to make faster, smarter actions that deliver better business results.
We are a company built on innovation and dedicated to excellence, but our people are our greatest asset. At GoodData you’re more than part of a team, you’re a member of a family. We seek out innovators who crave an open environment where they can be creative, ambitious and have a real impact. And we work to build a culture where talents can grow, develop and shine.
Our formula for success is the right product and the right people at the right time. How do you fit into our equation?
We are committed to creating a diverse work environment and proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
No relocation assistance is offered for this opportunity at this time, and local candidates will be given priority consideration.
Agency Recruiters Take Note:
Please do not spam us with unsolicited candidate resumes. Unless you have a fully executed agreement with us, we will consider them a gift. Do not send resumes to any of the executives.

Title: LAHSA Internship Program
Skills:
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Strong research and analytical skills.
Exceptional organizational and administrative abilities.
Innovation, critical thinking and creative problem solving.
Demonstrated maturity to work in a professional and fast paced environment.
Proficiency using the MS Office Suite.
FullDescriptions:
Overview
One of the best ways to learn the about the work in policies, programs and services around for people experiencing homelessness is through an internship program. LAHSA is looking for bright, self-motivated, energetic individuals who are interested in learning the dynamics of working in a government agency. Through this program, students are involved in meaningful, productive work while energizing our organization with fresh ideas. While students can gain credit hours to apply towards their education and licensing, internships are also a great recruiting tool that allows LAHSA to train potential future employees.

Our internship program runs year-round depending upon availability of projects, resources and need. Both paid and un-paid internships are available. Paid internships will be advertised and recruited individually, with scope and stipend listed within the employment classification.

LAHSA strives to keep the local community connected with the work taking place throughout the continuum. This is accomplished through community-based events, policy advocacy, correspondence and everyday involvement with the Los Angeles Continuum of Care (CoC). As an intern you may provide support to staff with special events, policy and research, program design, homeless programs and services, and special projects related to the mission of reducing homelessness. The goal is to establish a workable and mutually beneficial learning environment.

The internship program is designed to help students develop knowledge and understanding of the common principles, functions and practices related to working in a public agency. Although unpaid, interns receive important benefits like working directly with staff, elected officials, and community leaders on issues and events related homelessness in additional to gaining valuable skills and experience in the professional work environment. Interns may also qualify for educational credit from their college or university.

Session Duration Deadline to Apply Hours Per Week
A January - April November 10 10 - 20
B May - August March 10 10 - 20
C September - December June 10 10 - 20

Department Descriptions

Access & Engagement
The Access & Engagement Department provides outreach services and emergency assistance to people who are homeless or at risk of experiencing homelessness in the City and County of Los Angeles. The Access & Engagement department includes our Homeless Engagement Teams (HETs) which respond to requests from a variety of sources (i.e., Los Angeles City Mayor's Office, City Council Districts, and Los Angeles County Supervisor Districts and County Departments) and has staff co-located across the County.

Our HETs conduct outreach at any location where people experiencing homelessness reside including streets, alleys, parks and riverbeds. Outreach is primarily directed with identifying homeless people who might not use services, due to lack of awareness or active avoidance, and who otherwise might be ignored or underserved.

Communications
The Communications Department is responsible for the official messaging from the Los Angeles Homeless Services Authority (LAHSA). Five key functions include: Internal communications, external communications, social media, speaker training and communications to providers. The department manages all media inquiries, press releases, media events, public relations, website management, social media, tracking LAHSA and homelessness in the news, development and production of all printed materials. Using traditional methods of communication (e.g. press releases, media events, printed materials) in combination with new media tools (e.g. internet, e-mail, social media) the department supports LAHSA's mission in all communications.

Finance
The Finance Department is responsible for managing all LAHSA financial reporting and compliance requirements. These activities include the review and processing of over 100 monthly requests for funding from the Housing Urban Development (HUD), Health and Human Services (HHS), County and City funders; review and processing of monthly service provider requests for payment for approximately 300 provider contracts; annual financial closeouts for all funding agreements and service provider contracts; management of fiscal compliance on-site monitoring of 300 agency-sponsored programs; oversight and payment of all LAHSA administrative expenses, including payroll; oversight of LAHSA's annual financial audit; and preparation and submission of LAHSA's budgets to both the City and County of Los Angeles.

Human Resources and Administration
The Human Resources and Administration Department is responsible for providing an organizational framework to recruit, compensate, professionally develop, support and retain LAHSA's diverse workforce while ensuring an environment that optimizes productivity, efficiency, and effectiveness. This includes benefits administration, employee relations, regulatory and State and Federal labor law compliance. The administrative functions of the department include directing and managing internal administration, facilities operations and vendor relations, fleet management, and management and monitoring of meeting compliance for the Commission and its sub-Committees. The department, under the direction of the Chief Operating Officer, ensures that operations are efficient and effective for both LAHSA personnel and the Board of Commissioners.

Information Technology (IT)
The Information Technology Department oversees the management, development, networking and maintenance of all LAHSA IT systems, server infrastructure, software, data storage and telecommunications. The IT department is also responsible for the design and upkeep of the LAHSA websites as well as the development of custom in-house applications in support of LAHSA's operations.

Policy & Systems
The Policy & Systems Department cultivates and supports systematic initiatives that end homelessness through efficient policy development and effective engagement of community partners. The Policy and Systems department is also responsible for conducting the HUD-mandated biannual Homeless Count, which is an enumeration of the Continuum of Care (CoC)'s homeless population. Additionally, this department, in conjunction with the Programs department, compiles a significant portion of the annual Notice of Funding Availability (NOFA) application, through which the CoC receives over $105 mm in federal McKinney-Vento funding for homeless services.
Units in this department include: Policy & Legislative Affairs, Systems Coordination, Community Engagement.
Unit Core Functions:
Policy & Legislative Affairs: Analyze, develop, and coordinate policies that ensure homelessness is rare, brief, and non-reoccurring Coordinated Entry System (CES) Policy Development, Legislative/Policy Analysis, Governance.
Systems Coordination: Drives, integrates, and coordinates system resources to ensure an efficient delivery of services that end people's experience of homelessness, oversees the functions and performance of the Coordinated Entry System (CES), assesses existing gaps through strategic planning and development ensuring collaborative integration with existing non-LAHSA systems.
Community Engagement: Builds ongoing, permanent relationships with and between community partners to harness Los Angeles' ability to collectively end homelessness. Also oversees and executes annual Greater Los Angeles Homeless Count, coordinates, educates, and communicates on homelessness via information sessions and updates at community and public meetings. Provides for the development and maintenance of relationships with homeless coalitions, persons with lived experience, neighborhood councils, faith-based, advocates, local governments, and other civic groups

Procurement & Performance Management
The Procurement & Performance Management Department is responsible for procurement and funding administration, contract compliance, tracking agency performance through program outcomes and day-to-day contract management. Collectively, these functions entail issuing Request for Proposal (RFP)s and evaluating proposals, conducting agency site and desk monitoring, as well as extensively corresponding with agency partners regarding their LAHSA contracts. Additionally, this department tracks agency and programs' outcomes through the Homeless Management Information System (HMIS) database, and is responsible for submitting this data to HUD. The Procurement & Performance Management department also, in conjunction with the Policy and Systems department, compiles a significant portion of the annual Notice of Funding Availability (NOFA) application, through which the CoC receives over $105 mm in federal McKinney-Vento funding for homeless services.
Unit Functions:
Procurement Unit: Manages Request for Statement of Qualifications (RFSQ) process, develops Requests for Proposals (RFP), Request for Bids, Requests for Information/Interest, and manages all procurement processes for LAHSA homeless housing and related services programs.
Purchasing, Contracts & Grants Unit: Provides guidance on purchasing policies, and develops unified processes, tools and training designed to optimize LAHSA's use and administration of Public Funds. Prepares Contract & Grant Agreement Templates for legal counsel approval. Prepares, transmits and supports funded agencies in executing all LAHSA subrecipient agreements, leads the LAHSA Integrated Agency Support Team (IAST) process.
Performance Management Unit: Monitors program-level Contract Management activities, including spend down and outcomes performance, monthly interface with funded programs and Technical Assistance plans when necessary.
System Components Unit: Manages the System Components oversight of system components, e.g.: Rapid Re-Housing (RRH), Permanent Supportive Housing (PSH), Navigation, etc., and leads regular learning communities for providers by component type. Communicates best practices and guidance to agencies, ongoing management of Scope of Required Services for each funded component.
Quality & Special Projects Unit: Processes and resolves grievances, assess and ensures LAHSA is Americans with Disability Act (ADA) compliant through quality assurance. Responsible for ongoing project management and new program implementation.

Data Management
The Data Management Department is responsible for the governance and analysis of data collected in the Homeless Management Information System (HMIS) and through the Homeless Count. The department also provides direction and support on data-related initiatives, business intelligence, data automation and reporting to assist in the development and implementation of strategic initiatives to ensure effective and efficient systems of care for all people experiencing homelessness in LA City and County.
There are three units within this department: Performance Analysis and Reporting (PAR), Data and Research, and Homeless Management Information System (HMIS).
Unit Core Functions:
Performance Analysis and Reporting Unit: The Performance Analysis and Reporting Unit meets all programmatic reporting requirements and creates tools for ongoing program and system performance evaluation, including strategic initiatives, like dashboards. The team also assists in the development of RFPs and collaborates with internal and external experts to determine performance targets. PAR contributes to a wide range of efforts in the organization, touching virtually every department and business unit.
Data and Research Unit: The unit guides research to support policy priorities and analysis of the annual homeless count and housing inventory. Data and Research also manages the ongoing research and evaluation agenda and research partnerships, spatial and systemic analysis, particularly through use of GIS mapping, performance analysis and reporting.
Homeless Management Information System (HMIS) Unit: The unit, which is comprised of Data Analyst, Training & Technical Support, and Report Development Teams, is multifaceted, managing all aspects of operating the LA Continuum of Care (CoC) HMIS, including system configuration, monitoring the integrity and quality of HMIS data, providing training and technical oversight, and overseeing the development of HMIS report and business intelligence tools, from ideation to publication.

Essential Job Functions
Sample Job Functions:
Tasks and projects related to the assigned department.
Policy research and development.
Legal, contracts and procurement research and analysis.
Standard office and administrative functions.
Preparation of letters, reports and spreadsheets.
Work on ad-hoc committees, boards and other internal meetings.
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
Desired Skills:
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Strong research and analytical skills.
Exceptional organizational and administrative abilities.
Innovation, critical thinking and creative problem solving.
Demonstrated maturity to work in a professional and fast paced environment.
Proficiency using the MS Office Suite.
Training & Experience
Candidates must be enrolled in an educational program upon the start of your internship and have an interest in the following areas: public policy, finance, urban planning, data management and outcomes assessments, procurement and funding, public relations, client engagement, grievance and compliance, or a similar area of study or career path. Students must have a genuine concern for assisting our most vulnerable populations and be passionate about enriching people's lives. Candidates must reside or attend a school in Los Angeles County.

Title: Launch Performance Engineer - Robotics
FullDescriptions:
Undergraduate degree in engineering or related technical field2+ years’ experience working in the tech industry and/or some type of operational environmentFamiliarity with databases (SQL), data analysis/statistical tools (Excel, R, Python/Pandas), and scripting language (Bash or Python)Experience analyzing and visualizing complex data setsExperience with Six Sigma or another process improvement methodologyStrong written communication skills; ability to communicate complex system dynamics via clear and concise white papers for an executive-level audienceExperience leading medium-scale projects by defining and tracking project plans with participants from a variety of functional areas (operations, engineering, finance, etc.)
· · Developing software tools and models to aid the operational improvement process, such as KPI monitoring, operational dashboards, web visualizations, and troubleshooting tools
· · Willingness to travel up to 40% domestically and internationally


Recently acquired byAmazon Robotics, Canvas Technology is using spatial AI to provide end-to-end autonomous delivery of goods. By using state-of-the-art cameras and other sensors, the system perceives its surroundings with unrivaled vision and fidelity. The system combines a mix of high-performance sensors with simultaneous localization and mapping software that builds and continuously updates maps in real-time, completely automatically. It has the capability to ‘see’ and identify different objects, people, vehicles, and places as it moves and react to moving people and vehicles in an intelligent way.

The Launch Performance Engineer is a new role at Canvas created specifically to deal with the complexity that accompanies launching new technology across the Amazon network. This role will help gather data, perform tests and optimize our products for the different environments we serve. The role is expected to wear multiple hats – data analyst, project engineer, systems engineer, field technician and customer advocate.

Launch Performance Engineers are the end-to-end system experts in how the Canvas system works. They work directly with Operations teams who use the system to define best practices to maximize output and productivity. They identify gaps in system behavior and use this knowledge to gather data from software and web tools to correctly categorize and describe issues and then drive long-term solutions into the product development roadmap.

A successful candidate is comfortable working under ambiguous circumstances on-site with both Canvas Field Technicians and site Operations teams to troubleshoot and optimize system behavior, settings and hardware configurations. Additionally; this role partners with Hardware and Software developers to define and test new functionality. They have experience with data extraction, manipulation, analysis and visualization and communication.

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.

Masters degree in engineering or MBA is desirable4+ years’ experience in Fulfillment, Manufacturing, Logistics or ConsultingProject Management experienceExperience with web frameworks and technologies (MVC Frameworks, JavaScript, HTML, JSON, RESTful APIs) are preferred
#canvas #canvastech #canvastechnology

Title: Lead Data Scientist

Who are we? Raybeam Inc. is a consulting company focused building engineering and data solutions spanning business intelligence, brand and direct marketing, customer engagement for over twenty years in Silicon Valley and beyond. We have offices near Boston and San Francisco and support a strong list of clients including Google, Facebook, Microsoft, eBay, Disney and Hilton Worldwide.

What do we do? We provide technology solutions by architecting and developing enterprise systems using a variety of programming languages, tools and platforms. This can range from building data warehouses, to web applications to implementing reporting platforms. We work in small teams, own the projects that we work on, and have direct input into the business decisions of our clients.

What we’d like to see in you:

Experience in, design and build innovative data solutions, from discovery to delivery for clients and external stakeholders
Translate business problems to an analytics problem, recommending and applying the most appropriate methods to yield insights and results
Leading sessions and meetings to drive analytics roadmap, long-term strategy with quarterly milestones and outlook
Provide mentorship and guidance to teams of analyst; inspire innovative thinking in the analytics space
Requirements:

5-8 years of industry experience leading analytics projects
Experience with customer and user tracking on web and mobile app
Experience in applied analytics in space of sales, finance, marketing, or product engineering; track record of success
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure, AWS, IBM Cloud to use/deploy analytics resources
Strong working knowledge of SQL and architecting relational databases. NoSQL is a plus
Proficient in at least one or other language for applied to statistics, data analysis, or machine learning - Python, R, Matlab, SPSS
What do you get from working for Raybeam?

The opportunity to work for a variety of Fortune 500 companies.
Excellent resume builder due to the exposure to a variety of technologies and experiences.
The chance to have input into business decisions of our clients.
A fun, supportive work environment that promotes camaraderie and growth.
The chance to travel and network with important figures in the industry.
The opportunity to learn technologies that you’ve always wanted but never had the chance.
We have fantastic benefits including competitive pay, fully paid health insurance (including vision), free daily lunch, 401k contribution, long term disability insurance, flexible schedule, annual company outing, generous vacation/sick time, holidays and more!

Title: Learning Coordinator- LMS Administrator
Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree Preferred; Minimum of 1-3 years of experience working with learning content and Learning Management Systems (uploading, testing, and supporting content in multiple formats) or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Responsibilities:
Curiosity – Seeking understanding and willingly testing assumptions from a place of childlike wonder. Brings wonder to what is possible within and outside the world of Learning.
Clarity – Having a clear heart and striving to be easily understood. Actively engaging in healthy conflict to increase and/or seek understanding. Ensures that all learning activities are in support of the COMPASS. Creates incremental tools and processes that are easily understood and help others to see the path forward.
Grit – Daily discipline with a rigorous commitment to long-term goals while being fully accountable. Willingness to actively engage with continuous improvement efforts, applying the tools at traction, learning from failures and continuing to climb alongside others. Models the use of Designed Partnerships, knows when to renegotiate and/or ask for help.
Grace – Holding ourselves and others great while being patient, understanding and supporting others to take full responsibility for their lives. Demonstrates continuous improvement behaviors by modeling where we are going. Has empathy for where they and others currently are. Demonstrates the wisdom of knowing the difference between Caretaking and Grace.
Gratitude – Expressing thanks and appreciation from the heart. Acknowledging ourselves and others. Takes time to pause and appreciate the journey to this point. Captures specific examples to celebrate, share and promote incremental wins in the journey moving forward.
Love – Unconditionally and actively caring for and being in service of yourself and others. Willing to have courageous conversations and call others forth in a way that inspires them and us to step into our collective greatness.
Education: Bachelor’s Degree Preferred; Minimum of 1-3 years of experience working with learning content and Learning Management Systems (uploading, testing, and supporting content in multiple formats) or equivalent combination of education and experience.

FullDescriptions:
Tuthill Corporation is a privately held, global manufacturer of industrial goods specializing in rotating equipment such as pumps, meters, vacuum systems and blowers. Tuthill’s legacy began in 1892 when James B. Tuthill started a business to manufacture and sell common brick to Chicago construction companies. Today, the corporate office is located in Burr Ridge, IL and houses a range of roles that actively support and guide Tuthill's manufacturing lines of business. Tuthill has remained a family-owned business and now has its fifth generation of leadership in place.
