Title: New College Grad - Software Engineer (Bachelor's Degree) - Multiple Locations
Qualifications:
Minimum of 6 months of work experience or a Bachelor's Degree
Minimum GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0 (or equivalent scale)
FullDescriptions:
Job Description

As a Software Engineer, you could work in the following roles:
Front End Development
Backend End Development
Full Stack Development
API Developer
Mobile Development
Data Analyst
QA
Specific assignments will depend on upon your skills sets, interest, location and team needs.
Software Engineers will be placed in one of the Technology Organization teams. Here is a list and brief descriptions:
Network Processing: At its core, Visa is a payments network that connects consumers and merchants with financial institutions. The team is building the long-term architecture on architecture on open platforms and commodity hardware, as well as opening our technology platforms to enable industry collaboration and innovation through co- development.

Issuer Processing: Debit Processing Services (DPS), our Issuer Processing platform for North America, processes over half of all Visa Debit transactions and is the largest single prepaid processing platform for Visa prepaid transactions in the U.S. The team also partners with third-party companies outside of the U.S. to deliver value-added services through Visa-owned assets.

Merchant + Acquirer Processing: Merchant and Acquirer Processing (MAP) is focused on executing the Visa Merchant Strategy, building deeper merchant and acquirer relationships and increasing Total Merchant Value by developing solutions that address complex and emerging merchant and acquirer needs.

Digital and Developer Platform: Develop, deliver, and manage end-to-end technology products, services, capabilities, and solutions while collaborating with a global community of client, merchant, and partner developers to promote the growth of digital commerce and mobilization of payments in emerging and developed markets

Data Product Development: Develops and manages end-to-end technology solutions that create value from our enterprise data through internal and client-focused information-based services, business intelligence and insights, and data-driven product innovation.

Data Platform: We deliver secure, high-quality and easy-to-use Visa core data assets as a service, together with reliable and scalable data platform as a service, that enable Visa internal partners to rapidly and efficiently innovate data-driven business products and services to lead the digital payment industry

Cybersecurity: Cybersecurity provides enterprise-wide, risk-based security and continuity programs, and continually evolves security and continuity capabilities to meet changing internal and external threat landscapes.

Corporate IT: Build, operate and maintain the IT systems and infrastructure necessary to enable a highly connected and collaborative workforce that helps power Visa’s business.

Technology Planning and Business Operations: Provides a structured approach to synchronize, align and unite technology delivery capabilities with business management strategies for improved Technology + Operations organizational performance, execution and risk control.

Operations + Infrastructure: For Visa to deliver on the vision of the best way to pay and be paid for everyone, everywhere, O&I must provide best-in-class infrastructure services that are secure, scalable, continuously available, and run on software-defined infrastructures.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications
Minimum of 6 months of work experience or a Bachelor's Degree
Minimum GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0 (or equivalent scale)
Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field, graduating between December 2018 - August 2020
Proficiency in at least one programming language or technology including, but not limited:
Java/J2EE, C/C++, C#, .NET, python, PHP, Ruby on Rails, XML, Javascript, HTML, CSS, Objective-C, OOD, GoLang, Docker
Familiar with: JSON, REST APIs, MongoDB, AngularJS, ExpressJS, NodeJS, React
Big Data technologies: Hadoop, Spark, R, NoSQL
The ability to tackle challenges and address problems head-on
Strong ability to collaborate
Highly driven, inventive and results oriented
Additional Information

Work Hours This position requires the incumbent to be available during core business hours.
Travel Requirements This position requires the incumbent to travel for work 0% of the time.
Mental/Physical Requirements This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers, and reach with hands and arms.
EEO Statement Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Title: Outcomes and Evaluations Clinical Manager
Qualifications: Master’s degree experience in related clinical field (e.g., psychology, sociology, public health, social work, etc) required.
Education: Master’s degree experience in related clinical field (e.g., psychology, sociology, public health, social work, etc) required.
Requirement: Master’s degree experience in related clinical field (e.g., psychology, sociology, public health, social work, etc) required.
FullDescriptions:
Under supervision of the O&E Director, the O&E Clinical Manager is responsible for supervising the O&E Data Analyst(s), Research Specialist(s), and Research Assistant II’s to ensure effective database management and reporting (electronic and paper). In addition, this position will collaborate with programs to evaluate, develop, and implement outcomes based on agency, program, and county requirements. This resource will provide oversight to the creation of logic models and evaluate programs per agency and contractual requirements. This resource will also work closely with Clinical Programs and the Quality Assurance department. In addition, this resource will support the O&E Director to build relationships and collaborate with external entities (e.g., Universities) for data sharing, research projects, conferences, and publications.


Essential Duties

Supervision and training

1. Supervise staff that support analysis and reporting functions of the department to ensure accuracy of data from a variety of data sources (e.g., Electronic Health Record, HR, Training, etc);

2. Supervise Research Specialist to conduct analysis and evaluation, write annual reports, and develop new program logic models;

3. Develop, maintain and train staff on the Reports Procedure Manual and Training curriculum.

Database Management and Statistical Analysis

1. Oversee documentation of business processes and requirements;

2. Exhibit high level of analytical thinking and database management;

3. Knowledge of and application of a wide range of statistical analysis;

4. Coordinate with IT on data extracts and data quality.

Data Visualization and Reporting

1. Oversee the delivery of data in an actionable and appealing way to users;

2. Advise, consult, develop, and provide technical support and training to staff in visualization of data;

3. Collaborate with clinical programs and external entities to meet data visualization and reporting needs;

4. Make large and/or complex data sets more accessible, understandable, and usable;

5. Develop training curriculum and train staff on report processes;

6. Lead ad-hoc report requests, support routine agency-wide and regional reports, and oversee analysis required for RFPs

7. Oversee quality of internal/external reports

8. Partner with clinical programs and other departments to interpret results, monitor progress and develop CQI plans

Collaboration

1. Collaborate with the O&E Administrative Manager

2. Liaison with internal departments on county-required reporting and RFP-responses

3. Collaborate with Learning and Development, IT, Human Resources, and Quality Assurance teams on implementing and sustaining O&E related Continuous Quality Improvement projects


Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

All employees are responsible for keeping job requirements up to date. This can include but are not limited to certifications, licensure, and maintaining a clear criminal record.


Education Requirements
Master’s degree experience in related clinical field (e.g., psychology, sociology, public health, social work, etc) required.


Experience Requirements
Minimum of 2 years of program evaluation and 2 years’ experience with research group; or 4 years program evaluation required.
Experience communicating results in publications and/or professional conferences required.
Experience with data visualization (Tableau) preferred.


Other Specific Requirements
Must pass Department of Justice (DOJ), Federal Bureau of Investigations (FBI), and Child Abuse Index Check (CAIC) background clearance.
Valid California Driver's license with two years of experience driving and clean driving record may be required.


Work Environment/Conditions

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee may be required to use hands to handle or feel objects, tools or controls; reach with hands and arms; and taste or smell. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.

In addition this position requires sitting, standing, walking, climbing, and kneeling.


Employee Statement of Understanding

I have read and understand the job description for my position. I am able to perform all of the essential functions of this position.

I agree to successfully complete all required training indicated for this position. I agree to keep all of my required certifications and licenses current and up to date and provide proper documentation of the same to the Human Resources Department. I agree to comply with all Agency policies and procedures. I agree to comply with the agency compliance plan and all laws, rules, regulations and standards of conduct relating to my position. As an employee, I understand my duty to report any suspected violations of the law or the standards of conduct to my immediate supervisor. As an employee, I will strive to uphold the mission and vision of the organization. All employees are required to adhere to the values in all their interactions with youth and families and fellow employees.

Title: Performance Analytics Manager
FullDescriptions:
Global Growth Performance Analytics Manager
Looking for a company that inspires passion, courage and imagination, where you can be part of the team shaping the future of global commerce? Want to shape how millions of people buy, sell, connect, and share around the world? If you’re interested in joining a purpose driven community that is dedicated to creating an ambitious and inclusive workplace, join eBay – a company you can be proud to be a part of.
We look for inquisitive senior analyst, a lifelong learner with ample experience on matrix organizations, data driven decision making, marketing analytics and e-commerce business willing to take a high visibility role at the very core of our Marketing Initiative. If this is you, read on!
You will partner with data analysts, key marketers, finance officers and regional leaders to help grow eBay. You will work in a team of motivated, highly skilled analysts and data scientists working in a fast-paced, multidisciplinary, international environment focused on growing our business via Marketing and Customer Intelligence.
Responsibilities:
Central role at PIMA to set up internal forecasting, investment & planning processes leading to best decision making quality on GG portfolio. Engage with and nurture key leaders of Global Growth.
PIMA POC with Finance and Regional leaders: conduct forecasting and performance tracking sessions, full ownership of reports and interpretation of results: narrative/vernacular, manage & close feedback loops, set up strong results-driven partnerships.
Data democracy protector: manage dashboards lifecycle, attribution roadmap (changes in attribution systems, restatements, so they serve best all end users in the company).
PIMA thought leader: build strong voice from your own creativity, digestion of inputs absorbed via your central position and privileged partnerhips. Direct participation (challenge, propose and commit) on PIMA channel teams prioritization and strategic decision making
Develop and maintain performance forecasting and reporting tools, revenue management tools to support a lean and effective marketing tracking and investment process.
Experience working with multiple teams to drive Business decisions and have good attention to detail.
Requirements:
+4 years of experience as a business/data analyst, preferably in Marketing Analytics, preferably on B2C industry leader on positions with high visibility and showing results as a change agent.
Ability to transcend day to day tasks to see and pursue long term opportunities. Change agent ready to challenge and inform long term strategies through collaboration with multiple stakeholders, influencing, effective ground work and ruthless prioritization.
Degree in business or preferably a STEM discipline. Master degree or postgraduate education a big plus.
Adept at problem solving using both textbook methods and novel viewpoints. Conscious risk taker, opportunity driven, motivated by innovative approaches out of our comfort zone.
Able to spot and pursue opportunities as well as to translate high-level directions into practical projects and lead/drive their completion with minimal supervision.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, influencing skills.
Apt to customer advocacy, transcending financial short term figures for the benefit of our present and future customers.

Title: Physician Outreach Liaison
FullDescriptions:
Work Schedule/Days: Day / Monday - Friday
Employment Type: Full-Time
Location: Office Park (1699)
Requisition #: 35082


JOB SUMMARY
The Physician Outreach Liaison supports Physician Outreach department. Represents and promotes Children’s Healthcare of Atlanta clinical services and programs to increase volume growth and referring physician base and improve customer relationships with key and potentially new referring physicians. Children’s Physician Outreach Program is designed to create a more consistent experience for our community physicians and their staff members to build and maintain collaborative interactions and open communication. Within the program, designated physician liaisons are the primary contact for physicians, practice managers and staff within specific regions throughout Georgia. These liaisons are available to address questions, concerns and issues, and they provide information about the Children’s services and programs. From identifying and addressing barriers to access, to arranging requested in-services, the liaisons are available to meet physicians' ongoing needs. Our ultimate goal is to foster positive relationships between Children’s, the medical staff and community physicians.

EDUCATION
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Healthcare Administration, a clinical discipline, or related healthcare field
CERTIFICATION SUMMARY
Valid Georgia driver’s license
Must have personal transportation (automobile in good working condition) and auto insurance
EXPERIENCE*
Experience in database management
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS*
8+ years pharma/biotech experience selling clinically to specialty physicians in assigned region.
Clinical background is a plus.
Experience with CRM data management system.
3 years of experience in sales, marketing, or marketing communications
Experience in healthcare or consumer products
KNOWLEDGE SKILLS & ABILITIES*
Knowledge of resources, market, and business data and ability to apply in the development, implementation, measurement, and evaluation of relationship development/sales/outreach programs
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple complex responsibilities and perform business and market analysis, strategic planning, and program management with documented outcomes
Exceptional verbal and written communications
Strong business acumen and interpersonal skills
Team player, consensus builder, and persuasive presenter
Must be proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and other related software programs
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES*
Functions as a primary contact for pediatric and adult specialty physicians within the assigned geographic territory including, but not limited to, Henry Dekalb, and Gwinnett counties.
Interfaces with physicians/staffs to improve communication and increase understanding of referring physician needs and expectations.
Conducts personal visits 3.5 to four days per week, maintaining a practice visit index of 1.0.
Develops a sales plan for physicians/practices within the assigned territory with identified objectives and strategies.
Supports marketing plan and implementation and collaborates with Marketing and Communications to ensure that communication vehicles (e.g., collaterals, forms, physician portal) are in support of the results-oriented sales plan.
Identifies issues and concerns by referring physicians and communicates back to the appropriate individual, department, or area.
Facilitates issue resolution between physicians and Children’s Healthcare of Atlanta, working toward improved processes and communications.
Records and reports daily activity, referral patterns, client interactions, communication preferences, issues and resolutions, budget, market intelligence, cross-selling opportunities, and positive/negative variances in volumes for identified clinical products.
Maintains content for all physician/practice profiles, capturing critical data and updating Credentialing when necessary to ensure accurate and timely information is provided for purposes of communicating back to referring physicians.
Serves as content expert for other members of the Physician Outreach team depending on particular area of clinical expertise, partnering in the development of other outreach strategies and messaging.
Serves as a backup for other Physician Outreach team members during approved absences to ensure continuity of communication between Children’s Healthcare of Atlanta and the physician community.
Supports the Director, Physician Outreach and Service Line Administrators to identify and implement sales programs for new and/or refreshed clinical products and work with Information Systems & Technology, Patient Access, Medical Records, Service Line Administrators, Credentialing, Transfer Center, and other departments and individuals as needed.
Collaborates with Data Analyst to create monthly and quarterly reports identifying trends, issues, and resolutions.
Works with Data Analyst and other team members to make recommendations for process improvements and develops/reports return on investment measures on specific blitz programs or overall metrics.
Participates in education, training, planning, and regular sales training programs as required.
Oversees preparations, implementation, and follow-up for identified professional organization meetings and trade shows in order to cultivate physician relationships.
Attends continuing medical education dinners and physician town hall meetings in assigned geographic territory.
Coordinates continuing medical education in-services for physicians and staff per request by the practice.
SYSTEM RESPONSIBILITIES*
Safety: Practices proper safety techniques in accordance with hospital and departmental policies and procedures. Responsible for the reporting of employee/patient/visitor injuries or accidents, or other safety issues to the supervisor and in the occurrence notification system.

Compliance: Monitors and ensures compliance with all regulatory requirements, organizational standards, and policies and procedures related to area of responsibility. Identifies potential risk areas within area of responsibility and supports problem resolution process. Maintains records of compliance activities and reports compliance activities to the Compliance Office.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all job duties performed by the personnel so classified.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS*
Ability to lift up to 15 lbs independently not to exceed 50 lbs without assistance
Bending/Stooping - Occasionally (activity or condition exists up to 1/3 of time)
Climbing - Occasionally (activity or condition exists up to 1/3 of time)
Hearing/Speaking - Effective communication with employees, supervisors/managers and staff. Effective communications with patients and visitors, as required.
Lifting - Occasionally (activity or condition exists up to 1/3 of time)
Pushing/Pulling - Occasionally (activity or condition exists up to 1/3 of time)
Sitting - Frequently (activity or condition exists from 1/3 to 2/3 of time)
Standing - Occasionally (activity or condition exists up to 1/3 of time)
Walking - Occasionally (activity or condition exists up to 1/3 of time)
WORKING CONDITIONS*
Some potential for exposure to blood and body fluids
About Us:
Children’s Healthcare of Atlanta has been 100 percent committed to kids for more than 100 years. A not-for-profit organization, Children’s is dedicated to making kids better today and healthier tomorrow.
With 3 hospitals, 27 neighborhood locations and a total of 638 beds, Children’s is the largest healthcare provider for children in Georgia and one of the largest pediatric clinical care providers in the country. Children’s offers access to more than 70 pediatric specialties and programs and is ranked among the top children’s hospitals in the country by U.S. News & World Report.
Children’s has been ranked on Fortune magazine’s list of “100 Best Companies to Work For” for fourteen consecutive years and named one of the “100 Best Companies” by Working Mother magazine. We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefit package that supports our mission, vision and values. We are proud to offer an array of programs and services to our employees that have distinguished us as a best place to work in the country. Connect to our mission of making kids better today and healthier tomorrow.
Have questions about the recruitment process? Check out What to Expect.
Address: 1699 Tullie Circle, Atlanta, GA 30329
Function: Professional - Physician Relations

Job Description
Program Design:
The program prepares participants for roles of increasing responsibility through a combination of rotational assignments, structured learning, formalized feedback, and mentoring. Program participants will have the opportunity to interact with senior procurement leaders and participate in various key procurement initiatives.

Program participants have four 6-month rotation assignments during the two year program. As part of the rotational program, candidates may rotate through locations in CA, MA, PA, NC, etc.. Geographic flexibility is required both during and upon completion of the program.

Rotation examples include:
Sourcing Data Analyst
Procurement Excellence Program Lead

Title: Product Data & Analytics Associate
FullDescriptions:
Product Data & Insights Associate
About Ruggable:
Ruggable is a fast-growing Los Angeles-based e-commerce company currently disrupting the $5.0B rug market. Our patented 2-Piece Rug System has a removable top layer that can be washed in a home washing machine, offering a stylish and convenient solution for families, pet owners, and busy individuals. We are a small, entrepreneurial team with big ambitions. We have a strong brand, established traction, and a great team fueling our growth. This is an opportunity to participate in a rapidly growing e-commerce startup on its Core Product team.
Our Values:
Be Appreciative – Treat each other, our space, and our community with the utmost respect. Listen to each other, hear our customers.
Be Fierce – Uncover the best ways to do things, then make them even better. Dare to ask questions.
Attitude is Everything – Join the no extra-stress express. Even when it's hard, remember there is always a way, we will find it.
One Team One Dream – We are in this together. Be transparent, be open, be supportive, be a champion for our customers.
Embrace the Journey – Success is built from iteration. Be nimble, share drafts, welcome feedback.
Take Ownership – No matter the initiative, champion and stay accountable for your time, your work, and your actions.

The Role:
The Product Data & Insights Associate will be the powerhouse for all things related to analytics on the Product team. This role needs a highly quantitative, detail-oriented self-starter who has a passion for working in a fast-paced environment with structured and unstructured datasets. You will be responsible for building – and continuously improving – dashboards and reports that: provide relevant KPIs on customer/product feedback, conduct standardized analyses for recurring surveys regarding designs, and monitor market trends through competitive benchmarking. You will also feel comfortable recommending capture of new data sources (and explaining their value) as well as translating the output from all these tools into actionable steps to drive our business forward – this could be anything from the speed of our printers to the naming of our rugs.

Key Responsibilities (dependent on candidate interest / business need at time of hire):
Build and maintain automated reporting dashboards and analyses that stakeholders will use daily – but also perform ad hoc analysis as necessary
Manage various data sources – clean and messy alike – and package them together in an intelligible way
Turn data into impactful insight and then help develop the frameworks, models, tools, and processes to ensure they influence key decision makers
Provide recommendations for continuous improvement of our analytics capabilities (e.g. helping understand new sources of useful data or recommending and integrating new tools/platforms)
Lead and inspire other members of the Product team with an analytical approach to questions

Qualifications:
Required:
2+ years of hands-on experience working in an analytics role within an organization (ideally a high-growth startup) or on data-heavy projects in management consulting or investment banking
Proven track record of turning raw data into meaningful analysis, presenting to business stakeholders, and driving value for the business
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets
Knowledge of SQL with relational databases including data extraction and manipulation
Knowledge of programming languages for data analysis (R, JavaScript, etc.)
Experience with Tableau/Looker or similar business intelligence/data visualization tools
Good business acumen and ability to focus on "what matters"
Good project management and organizational skills
Bachelor's degree or equivalent
Preferred, but not necessary:
Experience with CPG/Retail, especially with textiles, carpeting, or apparel
Advanced degree in a data-related field
Additional Details:
Location: Gardena, CA (~20 min from downtown Los Angeles)
Job Type: Full-time
Compensation: Competitive, based on experience
Timeline: Q4 2019
Contact: Email jordan.marzouk@ruggable.com with resume.

Title: Product Manager
FullDescriptions:
As Product Manager on the autoniq® Product Team, you will play a key role in driving successful product launches, growth and customer satisfaction. Your role is a cross-functional one, requiring you to wear many hats, including data analyst, business analyst, user research and subject matter expert. Your efforts will be integral to all phases of product development as we look better understand our customer base, optimize our products and increase overall revenue for autoniq. You will be results-oriented and always looking to deliver business value. You will be hands-on, data-driven, willing to devise solutions to remove obstacles and implement high-quality products in a timely manner. The Product Manager will report to the Senior Product Manager and use data to help define and implement company-wide initiatives.
Job Description
Responsibilities:
Assist Senior Product Manager and the autoniq business in gaining a strong understanding of our customer data through segmentation that will drive optimal product development, marketing and support processes
Use KPI reports for autoniq around customer data and product features in order to help make key priority business decisions based on the overall product vision and strategy
Responsible for the daily Agile product development lifecycle by writing, grooming, and managing the upcoming Epics/Stories for sprints related to all product initiatives as assigned by the manager
Manage JIRA board by ensuring there is a healthy backlog in front of the engineering team
Work as a liaison between engineers and business relative to product efforts
Work with Dev Ops and Customer Support to be the first product/engineering line of defense for production support issues
Work with engineers to assist in issue resolution and to help resolve blockers
Create and maintain collective documentation for the autoniq product, including but not limited to:
Document business requirements where needed and assist UX/UI in documenting changes to overall autoniq application for internal documentation. This may also be used to supplement marketing.
Create quality and thorough release notes
Assist engineers in the release ceremonies of KAR Auction Services
Build deep understanding of autoniq product to help identify business impacts and technology impacts for incoming requests.
Conduct user research surveys, case studies and client interviews to help define the needs/wants of our client base in order to help drive the vision of autoniq, resulting in increased revenue and customer growth and retention
#CB

Title: Product Manager
FullDescriptions:
Zipwhip is a Seattle-based SaaS (Software-as-a-Service) company providing text messaging to businesses across North America through cloud-based software and a best-in-class API solution. One of the 10 fastest-growing companies in Seattle ( https://www.zipwhip.com/blog/zipwhip-named-on-inc-5000-list-2018-and-is-one-of-the-fastest-growing-companies-in-seattle/ ) as ranked by Inc., Zipwhip invented the technology that enables businesses to text using their existing landline, VoIP or toll-free phone number and communicate with consumers the modern way.

Zipwhip is aggressively investing in our people, product offerings and processes. We are backed by Goldman Sachs, Microsoft Ventures, OpenView, Voyager Capital and a host of other investors, and are seeing rapid growth in both employees and revenue. Zipwhip is the only business-texting provider with direct connections to all Tier 1 and 2 wireless operators in the U.S., and we've delivered billions of texts to consumers nationwide.

Zipwhip employees come to work every day (to one of Seattle's coolest offices ( https://www.geekwire.com/2018/geekwire-awards-2018-time-vote-geekiest-office-space-seattle/ )) inspired and ready to live out our DIRECT values: Determination, Innovation, Respect, Enthusiasm, Collaboration and Trust. If you want to be part of an organization where highly motivated thinkers are empowered to change the way we communicate with the world around us, then we'd like to hear from you.

What we're looking for:
We are looking for a creative problem-solver that is interested in working on a product that is transforming the way businesses communicate with their customers. This job is right for you if...


You get excited about tackling big, complicated, and often ambiguous problems
You understand that human behavior is complex and changing behavior is a lot harder than building features
You love products, trying new things, asking yourself why did they build it that way
You sweat the small stuff but keep your eye on the big picture
You are comfortable collaborating cross-functionally
You've got good UX instincts - you won't need to do your own design but you'll need to work effectively with your designer and researcher peers
You enjoy thinking analytically - you won't be expected to write SQL queries but you'll need to work effectively with your data analyst peer

What's the job really?


Become an expert and evangelist for how text messaging can transform businesses
Lead cross-functional teams of UX, Design, Analytics, Customer success, Marketing to deliver features from conception to launch
A/B test everything (including our own instincts and assumptions)
Build iteratively, and ship quickly - it keeps us humble
Be hands on, analyze customer and competitive data, and write product specifications with a clear hypothesis and measurable success metrics - it keeps us grounded
Be responsible for communicating all aspects of your product to the entire company

What you bring to the table:

2+ years of customer facing product management
You have experience building products for businesses both large and small
Bachelor's degree. MBA preferred - or equivalent experience

What we offer:

A fun, lively startup culture and one of Seattle's coolest offices. ( https://www.geekwire.com/2018/geekwire-awards-2018-time-vote-geekiest-office-space-seattle/ )
Core values-based leadership.
A culture of employee engagement-lively weekly company updates as 1 example.
Competitive salary and stock options.
Complimentary access to a fitness center.
Stipend for transportation and cell phone usage.
Full benefits package including parental leave, a matching 401k program, PTO, and medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance.
Complimentary snacks, complimentary beverages, a subsidized cafeteria with lunch made fresh every day, and free lunch on Fridays catered by local chefs.
Complimentary shuttle access to office from King Street Station, Ferry Terminal and Yesler/Occidental.

Zipwhip values a diverse team.

We are an equal opportunity employer. In accordance with applicable law, we prohibit discrimination against any applicant or employee based on any legally-recognized basis, including, but not limited to: race, color, national origin or ancestry, citizenship status, creed, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, veteran status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.

We are an E-verify participating employer.

Title: Product Manager
Responsibilities: Regularly review live ops strategy and performance, and present results and recommendations to stakeholders.Make data-driven decisions and deliver against established success KPIs, while ensuring continuous improvement; Work with data analyst to define metrics and develop dashboards to measure engagement, retention and monetization success.Orchestrate the interdisciplinary dependencies involved in creating live game updates (design, engineering, art, QA) and economy systems.Take ownership and be accountable of monetization design, strategy and execution; envision in-game content and business model recommendations; set requirements and create specifications for monetization features; drive and operate the resulting initiatives. Analyze the competitive landscape, and benchmark Toys for Bob monetization against competitors.Own the relationship with marketing, community, public relations (PR), editorial, and web to develop and execute strategies in support of content releases and ongoing player engagement.Drive data analyst to evaluate the health of the business and to explore new business opportunities. Assimilate feedback from players, competitive research, market trends, and quantitative data to propose and make recommendations that impact game content and product vision.
Requirement: Strong competence in analyzing data and drawing actionable business insight
FullDescriptions:
Product Manager - Toys for Bob
Novato, CA
We are currently looking for a Product Manager to design and execute live operations for PC and console games.
You will be responsible for envisioning, developing and evolving economic designs, new features and content with a focus on developing fun game systems that optimize player engagement, retention and conversion. You will work closely with the game development teams, and game analytics to translate the results of data analysis into compelling designs that compliment and further elevate game experiences.
Ideally, you will have experience defining and operating online game business models and have a deep understanding of player interactions with those models, both at the individual and community levels. You will be comfortable with all levels of ownership, from hands on design to providing high-level guidance and feedback. With an expert knowledge of games, and an ability to thrive in a challenging and evolving environment, you will help define our games’ roadmap to further drive our success.
ResponsibilitiesRegularly review live ops strategy and performance, and present results and recommendations to stakeholders.Make data-driven decisions and deliver against established success KPIs, while ensuring continuous improvement; Work with data analyst to define metrics and develop dashboards to measure engagement, retention and monetization success.Orchestrate the interdisciplinary dependencies involved in creating live game updates (design, engineering, art, QA) and economy systems.Take ownership and be accountable of monetization design, strategy and execution; envision in-game content and business model recommendations; set requirements and create specifications for monetization features; drive and operate the resulting initiatives. Analyze the competitive landscape, and benchmark Toys for Bob monetization against competitors.Own the relationship with marketing, community, public relations (PR), editorial, and web to develop and execute strategies in support of content releases and ongoing player engagement.Drive data analyst to evaluate the health of the business and to explore new business opportunities. Assimilate feedback from players, competitive research, market trends, and quantitative data to propose and make recommendations that impact game content and product vision.
•Develop testing methodologies, analyze data, and partner with research teams to optimize price points and model the impact of new game features. •Review design docs and metagame design specs with an eye towards business strategiesMeasure and manage daily product performance, and own reporting responsibilities to Leadership.
Requirements
•Undergraduate degree level education in business or related field•A minimum of 5 years’ experience in a business role supporting large-scale live gameStrong competence in analyzing data and drawing actionable business insight
•Proven experience taking business initiatives from conception to launch•Outstanding communications, project management, and relationship-building skills; able to communicate effectively with developers and business leaders alike
•Proven ability to work well in a team environment and manage multiple complex projects with diverse groups•Proven ability to exert influence without authorityComfortable with uncertainty
PlusesMBA
•Combination of game development and game publishing experience•Experience running free to play live games
Toys for Bob is a band of inventors, makers, and magicians who have been developing whimsical AAA console games for over 25 years. We play in a former military hangar that’s been converted into a colorful, tiki-themed, dog-friendly paradise just 20 minutes north of the San Francisco Golden Gate bridge.Best known for inventing the “Toys to Life” genre with Skylanders, we are a team of out-of-the-box thinkers who are driven to create memorable new experiences that inspire joy through levity and play. If you love games, are great at what you do, and don’t take yourself too seriously, we’d love for you to be part of the family!

Title: Product Manager – Reporting and Analytics
Responsibilities:
Determine customer needs for reporting and analytics across the platform and translate those into features, ultimately creating demonstrable value and benefits for those customers through integrated reporting tools, data visualizations, embedded analytics, business process automation, and data driven decision support for our end users.
Quickly learn and understand our current reporting and analytics capabilities and how they are leveraged for our current product line solutions.
Be able to synthesize and prioritize product line needs and gaps into platform requirements and user stories.
Champion the needs of the platform, product line teams, and key stakeholders throughout the development process, ensuring that what is delivered meets the original goals and KPIs.
Understand the balance between business functionality and technical requirements, ensuring that Onit's reporting and analytics tools will be able to support customer needs both now and as our customer base grows.
Own the reporting and analytics roadmap and backlog, keeping both up-to-date and in line with our overall product and corporate strategies.
Toe-the-line between business and technical stakeholders, explaining relevant information to each audience so that it is well understood.
Requirement:
Bachelor's Degree in computer science or information systems, or similar.
2+ years of product management experience in a technology company.
5+ years of experience as a report developer, data analyst, software developer/engineer, or in a similar role.
Competency with the entire SDLC/PDLC using Agile/Scrum methodologies for SaaS products and/or platforms.
Experience in developing enterprise business reports, dashboards, and data visualizations that are end-user friendly and executive ready using one or more of the following tools: Tableau, Business Objects, QlikSense, GoodData, PowerBI, Pentaho, MicroStrategy, etc.
Ability to translate complex business and technical issues into clear requirements.
Strong collaborative leadership, time management, and problem-solving skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
An ability to travel to customers or other office sites.
A willingness to work in or re-locate to our Houston, TX office. Relocation assistance will be provided for the right candidate.
FullDescriptions:
Data is everything. Businesses and users expect to have their data available in order to make critical decisions without having to be a data scientist in order to analyze it. Onit is looking for a Product Manager – Reporting and Analytics who will be responsible for evolving our reporting and analytics capabilities across our platform and product lines. The Onit Apptitude SaaS platform allows customers to build mission critical workflow applications and is the backbone that supports our Enterprise Legal Management (ELM) and Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM) product lines. We are looking for the right Product Manager who can work with our product line teams, our development teams, and other key stakeholders to produce and own a roadmap to allow our customers to realize the value of their data through best in class reporting and analytics functionality.

Responsibilities:
The Product Manager – Reporting and Analytics will:
Determine customer needs for reporting and analytics across the platform and translate those into features, ultimately creating demonstrable value and benefits for those customers through integrated reporting tools, data visualizations, embedded analytics, business process automation, and data driven decision support for our end users.
Quickly learn and understand our current reporting and analytics capabilities and how they are leveraged for our current product line solutions.
Be able to synthesize and prioritize product line needs and gaps into platform requirements and user stories.
Champion the needs of the platform, product line teams, and key stakeholders throughout the development process, ensuring that what is delivered meets the original goals and KPIs.
Understand the balance between business functionality and technical requirements, ensuring that Onit's reporting and analytics tools will be able to support customer needs both now and as our customer base grows.
Own the reporting and analytics roadmap and backlog, keeping both up-to-date and in line with our overall product and corporate strategies.
Toe-the-line between business and technical stakeholders, explaining relevant information to each audience so that it is well understood.

Requirements:
The ideal Product Manager – Reporting and Analytics will have the following skills or experience:
Bachelor's Degree in computer science or information systems, or similar.
2+ years of product management experience in a technology company.
5+ years of experience as a report developer, data analyst, software developer/engineer, or in a similar role.
Competency with the entire SDLC/PDLC using Agile/Scrum methodologies for SaaS products and/or platforms.
Experience in developing enterprise business reports, dashboards, and data visualizations that are end-user friendly and executive ready using one or more of the following tools: Tableau, Business Objects, QlikSense, GoodData, PowerBI, Pentaho, MicroStrategy, etc.
Ability to translate complex business and technical issues into clear requirements.
Strong collaborative leadership, time management, and problem-solving skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
An ability to travel to customers or other office sites.
A willingness to work in or re-locate to our Houston, TX office. Relocation assistance will be provided for the right candidate.

FullDescriptions:
Description
About us
Bringing True Hospitality to the world.
We want to welcome you to a world of bringing True Hospitality to everyone. When you join us at IHG®, you become part of our global family. A welcoming culture of warmth, honesty, and a passion for providing True Hospitality.
We pride ourselves on letting your personality and passions shine, recognizing the individual contribution you make and supporting your ambition to learn and create your own career path. In making a difference to our guests and owners, colleagues and communities, every day is a chance to create great and unique experiences, in your own way.
With over 370,000 colleagues in nearly 100 countries sharing our values, there’s countless opportunities at your fingertips.
We’re growing; grow with us as a Manager, Loyalty Product Operations – Program Abuse

Your day to day
Manager, Loyalty Product Operations – Program Abuse position is counted upon to be the forefront of understanding varied IHG business data and systems in order to develop effective countermeasures and mitigiation. This position will conceptualize and implement effective approaches to detect, prevent, analyze, understand and counter fraudulent activities within the systems, process or through reporting/monitoring; including fraud occurring across multiple business units.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Manage the daily contacts from multiple departments throughout the organization regarding new or existing cases of fraud for analysis, actions and documentation of schemes and trends.
Work with various data teams and business stakeholders to monitor fraudulent activity that impacts Loyalty Program, Partnerships, Global Promotions, Business Rewards, Member Acquisitions and various other programs across IHG.
Manage relationship and monthly status calls with Criminal Intelligence Team, providing feedback on cases, actualizing risk and loss, and other tactical guidance.
Lead, develop maintain and improve reports using advanced SQL knowledge to quantify risk, loss, mitigation and recovery of fraud schemes
Interpret data and deliver recommendations based on findings in collaboration with Legal, Program, and Criminal Investigation Teams and other relevant stakeholders.
Generate Ad Hoc Reports as requested by management
What we need from you
Education
Bachelor's or Master's Degree in a relevant field of work or an equivalent combination of education and work related experience.
Experience
3-5 years progressive work-related experience with demonstrated proficiency in multiple disciplines/processes related to the position including Loyalty Programs and Partnerships, Database and System Development, Analytics and Statistics.
Technical Skills and Knowledge
CFE or willingness to obtain a CFE
Current Aglie Certification (CSM, CSPO, etc) or obtaining preferred
Highly motivated and independent worker who is not shy at tackling tasks they do not immediately understand.
Strong analytic, oral and written communication skills.
Must have professional phone skills, a proactive mindset and be able to articulate technical problems effectively.
Able to work to project deadlines both effectively and efficiently
Intermediate to advanced experience with Tableau, SQL or other analytic software tools preferred
Technical expertise regarding data modeling, database design development and machine learning preferred
Advanced skills in Excel
Ability to present complex information in an understandable and compelling manner
Previous data analyst experience required
Strong internal and external customer service and professionalism skills with the ability to work in a flexible environment and adapt to change
Must have a passion for data and analytics and a basic to intermediate understanding of Advanced Data Modeling and Machine Learning.
What we offer
We’ll reward all your hard work with a great salary and benefits – including great room discount and superb training.
Join us and you’ll become part of the global IHG family – and like all families, all our individual team members share some winning characteristics. As a team, we work better together – we trust and support each other, we do the right thing and we welcome different perspectives. You need to show us you care, that you notice the little things that make a difference to guests as well as always looking for ways to improve - click here to find out more about us.
IHG is an equal opportunity employer. Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans

Title: Professional Research Assistant
Qualifications: Minimum of Bachelor's degree or equivalent in biological or health-related Field.Minimum of 2 years of experience adhering to research or clinical protocols.Available to work on Monday-Friday as early as 7:00 am on rare occasions when needed.Valid driver's license, reliable personal transportation and the ability to travel overnight for investigator meetings.Experience with conducting the Informed Consent Process.COMIRB and HIPAA requirement for researchers must be met during week 1 of employment.Must abide by hospital, University, local, state, and national regulations regarding human subject research.
FullDescriptions:
University of Colorado School of Medicine

University of Colorado | CU Anschutz Medical Campus
School of Medicine, Department of Pediatrics
Section of Infectious Disease
Professional Research Assistant
Position #765778 – Requisition #17208

* Applications are accepted electronically ONLY at www.cu.edu/cu-careers *

The University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus seeks individuals with demonstrated commitment to creating an inclusive learning and working environment. We value the ability to engage effectively with students, faculty and staff of diverse backgrounds.

The Department of Pediatrics, Section of Infectious Disease has an opening for a full-time (unclassified) Professional Research Assistant position.

The University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus is a public education, clinical and research facility serving 4,500 students, and a world-class medical destination at the forefront of life-changing science, medicine, and healthcare. CU Anschutz offers more than 42 highly rated degree programs through 6 schools and colleges, and receives over $500 million in research awards each year. We are the single largest health professions education provider in Colorado, awarding nearly 1,450 degrees annually. Powered by our award-winning faculty, renowned researchers and a reputation for academic excellence, the CU Anschutz Medical Campus drives innovation from the classroom to the laboratory to the delivery of unparalleled patient care. Read CU Anschutz Quick Facts here.

PLEASE NOTE: Candidates may be responsible for travel expenses related to the interview process and any relocation expenses, if applicable.

Nature of Work:
This is a 100% FTE position for a PRA in the Pediatric Infectious Diseases Department at the University of Colorado Denver Anschutz Medical Campus. This full-time position will assist in conducting clinical trials and research projects at Children's Hospital Colorado and University of Colorado Denver.

Areas of Responsibility:
Clinical ResearchServing as a clinical research coordinator for industry sponsored and investigator-initiated research projects.Performing clinical trial subject screening, recruitment, interviews, and follow-up visits, study paperwork, communications with Industry Sponsors, monitoring visits, study data entry, and overall study management.Developing study team SOPs for study procedures.Research Regulatory ManagementAssisting with all regulatory activities required to implement and maintain the clinical research endeavors.
Other Research Activities
Assisting the study data analyst with Access database development, building queries and reports.Preparing reports to assist administrative assistant with billing, study accounting, and subject payment.

Examples of Work Performed:Collaborate with principal investigators, investigators, and other hospital personnel to enroll clinical trial patients.Screen and assist in assessment of patients' eligibility in multiple ongoing prospective clinical research study protocols.Complete the entire consent process, including approaching patients and explaining study procedures and consent forms, answering questions concerning the studies, and obtaining signatures for informed consent and assent from patients and caregivers.Perform and/or coordinate study visit events.Instruct clinical staff on their study roles.Ensure accurate completion of data collection forms.Perform accurate data entry and query resolution.Perform follow-up interviews, both in person and via telephone.Some unskilled clinical care duties, including laboratory work.Study database maintenance.Other duties necessary to completion of research studies.Comply with the hospital and IRB policies and procedures for conducting good clinical trials.Collecting, processing and storing samples for research.Medication compliance tracking and coordinating protocol procedures.Assist the PI in collecting and reporting all patient reported adverse drug reactions and other serious adverse events.Patient education and follow-up per protocol guidelines.Routine meetings with monitors to reconcile data management issues.Participation in investigator's meetings.Preparing and submitting compliance documentation for the institutional review boards.Submission to the Human Research Subjects Portal for UCHRSS review and approval.Abstracting data from patient charts and electronic medical records.Research administrative tasks such as incentive mailing and tracking, data entry into web-based systems; updating local tracking database to reflect patient status. Participation in study meetings and trainings.Other study projects as necessary.
This position works primarily Monday through Friday day hours. Occasional weeknights and weekends are required. Occasional overnight travel for visits or training is required


Salary and Benefits:
Salary is negotiable and commensurate with skills and experience.
The University of Colorado offers a full benefits package. Information on University benefits programs, including eligibility, is located at Employee Services.

University of Colorado Denver | Anschutz Medical Campus is dedicated to ensuring a safe and secure environment for our faculty, staff, students and visitors. To assist in achieving that goal, we conduct background checks for all new employees prior to their employment.

The Immigration Reform and Control Act requires that verification of employment eligibility be documented for all new employees by the end of the third day of work. Alternative formats of this ad are available upon request for persons with disabilities.

Your total compensation goes beyond the number on your paycheck. The University of Colorado provides generous leave, health plans and retirement contributions that add to your bottom line.

Benefits: https://www.cu.edu/employee-services/benefits.
Total Compensation Calculator: https://www.cu.edu/employee-services/total-compensation


Benefits: https://www.cu.edu/employee-services/benefits.
Total Compensation Calculator: https://www.cu.edu/employee-services/total-compensation (for questions, please contact Kristin Pena at Kristin.Pena@childrenscolorado.org)

Diversity and Equity:
Please click here for information on disability accommodations: http://www.ucdenver.edu/about/departments/HR/jobs/Pages/JobsatCUDenver.aspx

The University of Colorado Denver | Anschutz Medical Campus is committed to recruiting and supporting a diverse student body, faculty and administrative staff. The university strives to promote a culture of inclusiveness, respect, communication and understanding. We encourage applications from women, ethnic minorities, persons with disabilities and all veterans. The University of Colorado is committed to diversity and equality in education and employment.


Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:Minimum of Bachelor's degree or equivalent in biological or health-related Field.Minimum of 2 years of experience adhering to research or clinical protocols.Available to work on Monday-Friday as early as 7:00 am on rare occasions when needed.Valid driver's license, reliable personal transportation and the ability to travel overnight for investigator meetings.Experience with conducting the Informed Consent Process.COMIRB and HIPAA requirement for researchers must be met during week 1 of employment.Must abide by hospital, University, local, state, and national regulations regarding human subject research.

Preferred Qualifications:Experience working on clinical trialsExperience working with children with respiratory illnessesComputer experience, with an Electronic Medical Records system

Competencies:Ability to implement and closely follow research protocols.Ability to communicate clearly the study procedures to parents and children.Some knowledge of medical terminology, particularly relating to symptoms of infectious diseases.Data collection skills, including interview administration.Organizational skills to document and process research study results.This is a position requiring research experience and an interest in clinical research.

Conditions of Employment:Must successfully pass a 10-panel drug test through Children's Hospital ColoradoMust be willing and able to pass a national criminal and sex-offender background check


Special Instructions to Applicants: Questions should be directed to Paige Miller at Paige.Miller@childrenscolorado.org


Application Materials Required: Cover Letter, Resume/CV, List of References

Application Materials Instructions: * Applications are accepted electronically ONLY at www.cu.edu/cu-careers * Review of applications will begin immediately and will continue until the position is closed.


Applications are accepted electronically at CU Careers, refer to requisition ID: 17208


When applying, applicants must include:

A letter of application which specifically addresses the job requirements and outlines qualifications
A current Resume/CV
The names, addresses, daytime telephone numbers and e-mail addresses for three professional references, either attached to your resume/CV or uploaded as a separate document
Please be advised that the University does check references as part of the employment process.


Please do not submit any of your application material (via email) to the job posting contact.

Title: Program Integrity – Senior Consultant (Dental Claims Investigator)
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Healthcare, Business, Computer Science, Mathematics a related field or equivalent experience.
2+ years of Dental Forensic, Investigative, and/or Discovery industry related experience
2+ years in a technical or functional role
Dental records review and claims analysis experience.
Strong analytical & investigative skills.
Ability to comprehend dental policy and criteria to clearly articulate health information.
Experience with all dental coding (CDT, CPT, HCPCS, DRG, ICD-10, & Revenue Codes).
Excellent oral and written communication skills and an ability to communicate effectively with all levels of the organization.
Intuitive nature to identify investigational leads regarding fraud, waste or abuse.
Ability to work independently and as part of a productive team.
Ability to handle multiple and conflicting priorities.
Working knowledge of dental review and dental chart audits.
Proficient in Microsoft products, specifically Excel.
Proven leadership skills demonstrating strong judgment, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities.
FullDescriptions:
Are you an analytical, data-driven professional? Are you interested in a role that uses leading edge analytics and offers an opportunity to provide front line support to solve our clients’ most challenging problems associated with health care Payment Integrity / Fraud, Waste and Abuse detection and prevention? If so, the Forensic Analytics practice is the place for you!
As a data analyst, you will be expected to apply your specialized knowledge of data acquisition, management, analysis, and interpretation directly to dental claims, eligibility, policy, etc., data, providing actionable insights that Deloitte, our clients, decision-makers, and others can use. It’s a great career choice for those who want to apply healthcare expertise in a novel and innovative way.
Forensic Analytics is a fast-growth practice within Deloitte Risk and Financial Advisory that centers around several of the hottest areas of business today – analytics, forensic analysis, and litigation support – and the specialized skills that make careers in these areas both fascinating and in high-demand. Our Analytics team makes extensive use of data, statistical and quantitative analysis, rules-based methods, and explanatory and predictive modeling to bring insights to client issues. Our work increasingly employs specialized competencies, such as advanced analytics, visualization, and geospatial techniques.
Work you’ll do

Provide domain experience in review of dental plan policy
Guide the development and review of new dental rules
Maintain a deep, working understanding of ADA dental procedures codes and standard dental claim processing policies as defined by our dental client
Conducting investigations into dental cases to identify potential fraud, waste, abuse, and improper payments.
Performing and interpreting dental billing patterns to identify potential fraud, waste, abuse, and improper payments.
 Responsible for the analysis of provider and member claims data, and non-clinical review of dental records pertaining to claims audits and fraud, waste and abuse investigations.
 Assignments are generally of low to moderate complexity and focused primarily on documentation supporting code billed and documentation requirements, but may also involve other areas such as:
o compliance with applicable laws and regulations,
o regulatory reporting requirements
 Conduct investigations into dental cases to identify potential fraud, waste, abuse, and improper payments.
Perform and interpret provider billing patterns to identify potential fraud, waste, abuse, and improper payments.
Conduct background research on provider and associated partners.
Collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Analyze information submitted on the dental claims to determine amount and nature of billable services.
Identify trends and possible concerns related to potential inappropriate submission of claims by providers or facilities.
Review and analyze claims and dental charts submitted by the provider or facility to determine appropriateness of billing and documentation.
Document findings for each claim line with appropriate claims payment calculation in a findings spreadsheet.
Summarize findings in a written report which will be provided to management, Plan, and in certain circumstances court proceedings.
Interpret provider policy to validate appropriate payment was made.
Prepare and present complex written and verbal materials (reports, findings and presentations).
Conduct interviews with dental providers to validate services rendered.
Contribute to a strong client relationship through interactions with client personnel on investigation-related issues.
Contribute to new business proposals and client pursuits.
Manage own personal and professional development; seek opportunities for professional growth and expansion of consulting skills and experience.
Network and negotiate to identify and sell potential new services or expand existing engagements by leveraging client relationships.
Generate marketplace eminence through the creation of intellectual property across a host of mediums including but not limited to: articles, whitepapers, webcasts and other audio-visual presentations.
Work under supervision of the Claims Integrity, Manager with moderate latitude for initiative and independent judgment.

The team
As a member of our Forensic Analytics practice in the Senior Consultant role, you will work on projects that will allow you to collaborate with clients, and other analysts and investigators. As part of these projects, you’ll be provided the opportunity to demonstrate your technical, project management and leadership skills in an environment that provides for outstanding growth and advancement. Position may necessitate intermittent travel and requires flexibility with the client service projects.

Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Healthcare, Business, Computer Science, Mathematics a related field or equivalent experience.
2+ years of Dental Forensic, Investigative, and/or Discovery industry related experience
2+ years in a technical or functional role
Dental records review and claims analysis experience.
Strong analytical & investigative skills.
Ability to comprehend dental policy and criteria to clearly articulate health information.
Experience with all dental coding (CDT, CPT, HCPCS, DRG, ICD-10, & Revenue Codes).
Excellent oral and written communication skills and an ability to communicate effectively with all levels of the organization.
Intuitive nature to identify investigational leads regarding fraud, waste or abuse.
Ability to work independently and as part of a productive team.
Ability to handle multiple and conflicting priorities.
Working knowledge of dental review and dental chart audits.
Proficient in Microsoft products, specifically Excel.
Proven leadership skills demonstrating strong judgment, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities.
 Pre-sales, proposal, and RFP experience.
Experience reviewing dental claims, charts, and x-rays.
Experience reviewing and interpreting dental policy.
Extensive knowledge of dental procedure codes, dental claims processing, and provider relations, as well as the ability to understand the cascading impact of claims processing policy changes on key performance indicators, claim costs, and overall financial health of the organization.
 Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.
Preferred
Certified Fraud Examiner is a plus but not required
Certified Professional Coder (CPC) or equivalent a plus

Benefits
At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you.

Deloitte’s culture
Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. Learn more about Life at Deloitte.

Corporate citizenship
Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. Recruiter tips

Title: Program Manager, Operations
FullDescriptions:
Convoy, one of the fastest growing startups in the U.S., is transforming the $800 billion trucking industry. Convoy offers the world's largest companies the best option for moving their freight through its network of thousands of technology-connected trucking companies. Shippers get instant quotes, real-time GPS tracking on all shipments, and actionable business analytics to improve their supply chain. Trucking companies get access to free tools and resources that allow them to find loads they want, drive fuller trucks, and get paid quickly. Convoy is growing quickly and hiring in every area. Come join a company that is literally moving the world forward!

Founded in 2015, Convoy is backed by this century's leading disruptors, including the founders and CEOs of Amazon, Salesforce, eBay, Linkedin, Expedia, Dropbox, KKR, Starbucks, and others.

About you:
As a program manager on the operations team, you will drive programs that scale Convoy’s operations while driving improvements in service and efficiency. You will tackle broad, ambiguous questions that have an impact across Convoy’s operations teams and, often, the entire company, our customers, and our carriers. You think strategically and can own a problem end to end. Key areas of investment could include: organizational design and growth planning, piloting new customer-facing programs, and testing new operational models.
You will take ownership of:
Strategy - You will identify key questions that will determine the validity and success of a program and drive to resolution through alignment with stakeholders.
Planning & Execution - You will own end-to-end planning and execution of programs. You will be required to develop a broad understanding of the business in order to drive effective paths to scale for successful programs.
Metrics & Experimentation - You will define the metrics and goals that drive program success and will be required to design and measure effective experiments.
Cross functional partnership - You will work closely with our product, operations, and other teams to identify and execute on long term innovation for our customers.
You will have the following skills and experience:
Bachelor’s degree required, MBA a plus
4+ years of experience in consulting, BI, strategy, or data analyst roles
Experience building and scaling strategic and cross-functional programs from the ground up
Ability to break down high-level business problems into concrete analytical solutions
Strong analytical skills – good at creating and analyzing business information, creating dashboards, tracking key business metrics; exceptional Excel skills; SQL proficiency a plus
Exceptional communication skills; ability to empathize with stakeholder needs and drive alignment across multiple teams.
Superior organizational and time management skills; ability to prioritize workload and manage multiple projects and tasks
Convoy is an equal-opportunity employer and we are actively seeking a diverse team. If you’re a collaborative team player who wants to have an outsized impact with a small, tight-knit team, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Program Specialist VI
FullDescriptions:
The Program Specialist provides key research, analytical and reporting function for the Data Analytic team of Medicaid/CHIP program to support case management, identification of anomalies relating to clients, providers, service utilization, payment methodologies, and compliance with Medicaid/CHIP contract requirements. The position is supervised by the Director of Data Analytics Unit within CADS. The Program Specialist performs highly advanced Medicaid/CHIP program research activities under minimal direction with extensive latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. The Program Specialist develops and implements research and analytical procedures using advanced statistical techniques to assess the validity of methods and/or procedures for appropriate application. The Program Specialist coordinates project design, planning, statistical analysis, and/or reporting; writes advanced scripts and code for computer based statistics applications; develops or assists with the development of interactive dashboard visualizations of data; plans and/or conducts highly advanced research and program evaluation on the agency’s Medicaid/CHIP programs. The Program Specialist provides consultation and assistance to Medicaid/CHIP staff in developing strategies for more effective reporting of Medicaid related data. The Program Specialist also prepares a variety of reports or other deliverables containing analyses of Medicaid services data, methods, procedures, and relevant sources to the administration and understanding of Medicaid/CHIP program and issues. The Program Specialist develops, implements, and maintains utilization and compliance data dashboards in consultation with Medicaid/CHIP program staff in order to monitor Medicaid/CHIP contract compliance and detect anomalies. The Program Specialist performs other duties necessary to achieve the mission of HHSC.


Essential Job Functions:
Attends work on a regular and predictable schedule in accordance with agency leave policy and performs other duties as assigned.


EJF 1. Prepares a variety of written, oral and graphical deliverables containing analyses of Medicaid/CHIP data, methods, procedures, and relevant sources to the Medicaid/CHIP administration and policy analysts to provide data analytics, data trends, and improve Medicaid & CHIP Services Department's contract management. Develops and maintains interactive data dashboards in collaboration with, and for use by, Medicaid/CHIP program staff. Time Spent: 35%


EJF 2. Designs and implements analytical studies; assesses validity of statistical methods for appropriate application; plans and/or conducts highly advanced data analytics on Medicaid/CHIP programs and contracts such as Medicaid/CHIP Managed Care and Medicaid fee-for-service; and applies advanced statistical and/or spatial data analyses techniques to Medicaid/CHIP data. The Data Analyst VI also provides consultation and assistance to Medicaid/CHIP staff to develop strategies for more effective contract monitoring and identification of anomalies relating to service utilization, providers, payment methodologies, and compliance with Medicaid/CHIP contract requirements, reporting of data and analyses. Writes advanced scripts and code for computer based statistics applications. Time Spent: 30%


EJF 3. Prepares a variety of reports, studies, and other deliverables containing analyses of Medicaid/CHIP data, methods, procedures, and relevant sources to enhance Medicaid/CHIP contract management and detect data trends. Time Spent 30%


EJF 4. Travel will be required. Time Spent 5%



Knowledge Skills Abilities:
Skill in using Tableau visualization software or similar applications

Knowledge of dashboard design best practices

Knowledge of scientific research methods, statistical techniques, mathematics, geographical concepts and their application to data analytics.

Knowledge of patient level health and demographic data (e.g., Census, Vital, Medicaid, and CHIP data).

Knowledge of medical records systems or clinical coding practices.

Knowledge of Internet and World Wide Web.

Knowledge of computer programming principles, spreadsheet macros, and database design.

Knowledge of geocoding and Geographical Information Systems (GIS) methods.

Skill in using SAS, SPSS, or other statistical software.

Skill in using ACCESS, SQL, Business Objects or other database management software.

Skill in using EXCEL or other spreadsheet software.

Skill in graphical, tabular and geographical presentation of data.

Skill in verbal and written communications.

Ability to manage, manipulate, and analyze complex databases.

Ability to plan, organize, and conduct data analytic projects.

Ability to work in a team and to communicate effectively.

Ability to develop and interpret statistical data charts, maps, and tables.

Ability to interpret and publish data analytic findings.

Ability to exercise independent judgment and show initiative.

Ability to maintain detailed and organized documentation of data analytic projects.


Registration or Licensure Requirements:


Initial Selection Criteria:
Four years college in social and behavioral sciences, natural sciences, or related degrees. Three years or more work and experience with collection, analysis, and dissemination of health and human services data and/or large datasets preferred. Previous experience in developing Tableau dashboards preferred.


Additional Information:
Requisition # 426968

Note: Military occupation(s) that relate to the initial selection criteria and registration or licensure requirements for this position may include: 35F, IT, 23, 02111, 8E000. For more information see the Texas State Auditor’s Military Crosswalk at http://www.hr.sao.state.tx.us/Compensation/JobDescriptions.aspx.
