Title: Project Manager III – Portfolio Management Office, Information Services
FullDescriptions:
Job Description

The IS Portfolio Management Office is a team that leads the IS Portfolio management processes and the implementation of the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe). The Project Manager is responsible for the management of enterprise efforts that roll up to the Lean Portfolio Management areas of operations and governance. The Project Manager will be responsible for communicating and presenting information related to the IS portfolio. The Project Manager will participate in efforts related to the implementation of the Scaled Agile Framework, to include the Lean Agile Center of Excellence, as well as IS Strategy. The Project Manager will work with I
Responsibilities
Manage IS portfolio related efforts
Manage enterprise third party services and systems (3PSS) requests through Kanban stages
Collaborate with IS Owners during the 3PSS request Kanban process
Manage the implementation of IS Strategy efforts
Participate in the Lean Agile Center of Excellence group for implementing SAFe
Manage the Lean Portfolio Management competency areas of operations and governance
Support the Data Analyst in the PMO with collection of information related to portfolio operations and governance
Work in collaboration with Business Owners and Product Managers and their requests for Epic level funding
Prepare and present IS Portfolio operations and governance data to a variety of stakeholders
Collaborate with the IS Strategy Senior Program in the execution of IS Strategy
Track and report on metrics related to the IS Portfolio operations and governance processes

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree or higher in the area of business or information systems
5-7 years of Project Management or Scrum Master experience
Ability to define problems, establish facts and draw valid actionable conclusions
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (formulas and pivot tables)
Working knowledge of Lean-Agile and/or Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) practices
Assertive personality, interpersonal and leadership skills
Understanding of portfolio management fundamentals
Desired Qualifications
Familiar with Scaled Agile Framework transformations
Experience leading efforts independently
Excellent oral and written communication skills with a broad audience
Ability to collaborate and integrate across all levels of the organization
Ability to work independently
Additional Information

Expeditors offers excellent benefits
Paid Vacation, Holiday, Sick Time
Health Plan: Medical, Prescription Drug, Dental and Vision
Life and Long Term Disability Insurance
401(k) Retirement Savings Plan
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Training and Personnel Development Program
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
Successful candidates must pass a background check.

Title: QA Engineer
FullDescriptions:
Job Description Summary
The QA Data Analyst is responsible for overseeing all aspects of Quality Assurance testing, overall system quality and providing second level application technical support. Job Duties

Interpreting requirements and design to come up with end to end test plans/scenarios and overall test strategy.
Converting functional requirements into test cases and correspondingly in executable test scripts.
Collaborate with Project Managers, Sales, Product, Operations, development and other Stakeholders to validate whether we are building the right product.
Deliver recovery plans, create release documentation, and collaborate with stakeholders on creating timely deliverables.
Create and maintain functional tests for web applications using Cucumber and Selenium
Create and maintain REST API integration tests using SOPUI or Postman
Conduct system performance testing to ensure system reliability, capacity, and scalability.
Analyze test results and coordinate with development teams for defect fixes.
Provide technical assistance to improve system performance, capacity, reliability and scalability.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, related technical field.
Advocate appropriate level of product quality.
Interfaces with clients to ensure thorough end to end testing
Resolves or escalates second level help desk tickets
Keep up-to-date of development technology, testing tools and business domain.
Working understanding of SQL databases and a bility to write SQL statements to add/retrieve data (Query Analyzer)
Customer service oriented, great team player and collaborator, good communicator Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in CIS, MIS, or related field
7+ years of experience with QA and/or application development
Solid understanding of database technologies
Solid understanding of QA tools including automation and load testing
Solid understanding of the software development lifecycle
Experience in navigating across cross-functional teams
Effective verbal and written communications are critical

Title: Quality Assurance - Regulatory & Technical Services Manager
FullDescriptions:
Sysco Associate Apply - Click Here
Company: Sysco Corporate
Location: US-TX-Houston
Zip Code: 77077
Minimum Level of Education: Bachelor's Degree
Minimum Years of Experience: 5
Position Type:
Travel Percentage: 0
More information about this job:
OVERVIEW:
We offer our associates the opportunity to grow personally and professionally, to contribute to the success of a dynamic organization, and to serve others in a manner that exceeds their expectations. We're looking for talented, hard-working individuals to join our team. Come grow with us and let us show you why we’re at the heart of food and service.

Position Summary:

The Manager, Quality Assurance (QA) – Regulatory & Technical Services (RTS) is responsible for collaborating with internal (field and corporate) and external stakeholders (suppliers, customers, regulators) in all levels of management to execute Market Actions (ie. Recalls, Withdrawals, Public Health Advisories) across multiple countries, predominately the U.S and Canada. The Manager, QA – RTS is also ensures Sysco regulatory compliance by remaining informed of changes to various federal, state and local regulations for which Sysco our suppliers and customers are subject to. Additionally, the Manger, QA – RTS also supports OPCOs during interactions (ie. inspections, audits, etc.) with regulators at the OPCO level. The Manager, QA – RTS also manages the various data/IT systems deployed by the QA Team to document actions, assess enterprise risk as well as track supplier and internal associate performance. This role is also responsible for managing and writing procedures which impact our suppliers, customers and enterprise wide operating procedures. As a manager level position, this role is required to directly manage multiple processes and/or individuals both directly and indirectly on a daily basis. This may include giving regular feedback to direct reports through daily communications and performance reviews.

Responsibilities

Lead and manage Market Actions (Recalls, Withdrawals, Advisories, etc.) for Sysco Corporation
Lead, manage and execute Market Action Activities with external (suppliers, customers, regulators, etc.) and internal (field and corporate) stakeholders to ensure timely, accurate communication and removal of products from the market.
Ensure and verify all associated records, communications and tasks are completed accurately and in a timely manner. This includes Corporate and OPCO records/tasks.
Administer financial processes surrounding Market Actions, including payment of third party provider and billing back to suppliers for incurred costs. (~$3-4MM/year in transactions)
Facilitate and manage interactions between regulators (ie. federal, local and international) and Sysco concerning Market Action Activities to ensure compliance with applicable recall and other associated regulations (i.e. Reportable Food Registry Reporting, Effectiveness Checks, etc.)
Manage and collaborate with third party contractor as well as appropriate stakeholders (i.e. internal functional groups, customers, regulators, etc.) to design strategies to continuously improve the Market Action Communication Process.
Maintain Sysco Quality Assurance Data Systems
Manage relationship and performance of third party solution providers regarding system performance and enhancements as well as general support for routine processes executed by their company.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders (ie. OPCOs, BT, Merchandising, Finance, etc.) as well as external stakeholders (ie. suppliers, customers and regulators) on the utilization, maintenance and optimization of the various systems utilized by QA, including but not limited to: a) BellTower Technologies Instant Recall, b) RizePoint (IAP, IFA, FI, and other internal and external programs), c) Sysco Brand Product Specification Database, d) Product Discrepancy Notice System, e) Safety Data Sheet System, f) Tableau Dashboards, etc.
Collaborate with various stakeholders to develop, analyze, generate and report data from the various QA Data Systems to make informed business decisions, conduct enterprise and supplier risk assessments, determine associate performance, and to facilitate continuous improvement across the enterprise.
Manage Policies and Procedures as they relate to Sysco Quality Assurance Programs and Data Systems
Serve as subject matter expert and counsel to OPCOs concerning the creation, updating, maintenance and execution of the Sysco HACCP Plans.
Collaborate with appropriate internal stakeholders to create, update, maintain, deploy and execute enterprise wide policies, procedures and programs.
Responsible for Document Control processes for Sysco Corporate QA Programs
Create, update, deploy and execute training for relevant QA Data Systems and programs, policies and procedures managed by RTS.
Ensure Regulatory Compliance
Manage and ensure all required food safety regulatory licenses and registrations (I.e. FDA Bioterrorism Act, USDA Meat and Poultry Handlers, CFIA Safe Food for Canadians Licenses, etc.) are accurate and current.
Serve as Sysco’s subject matter expert to internal associates, suppliers, customers and trade groups for all food safety, labeling and product specific regulatory requirements.
Stay apprised of all new or changes to existing food safety/labeling regulations on an international, federal, state and local level. Asses and determine Sysco’s impact for all new or changes to existing food safety/labeling regulations. Strategize and champion necessary changes, both internally and externally to ensure Sysco is compliant with all new or changes to existing regulation. To ensure compliance the RTS Manger may have to conduct, but not limited to, the follow activities: analysis of regulatory requirements, impact and gap analysis, stakeholder analysis, creating/updating policies and procedures, project planning and management, change management, communication planning, program deployment, compliance verification activities, etc.
Provide support to all OPCOs, both in the U.S. and internationally, during regulatory activities conducted at their local OPCO. Manage, advise and draft responses to regulatory non-compliances identified at OPCOs during inspections/audits. Collaborate with OPCO Management to ensure appropriate corrective actions are taken to mitigate any regulatory compliances and prevent their reoccurrences in the future.
Maintain Internal and External Food Safety Relations
Establish and maintain on-going relationships with customers (both national and local accounts) and respond to issues as required.
Assist the Sales and Marketing group in providing Sysco QA informational material and presentations to customers and other external stakeholders on a regular basis.
Represent, advocate, manage and maintain Sysco’s relationship with regulatory authorities and strategic industry trade groups to stay informed of regulatory and best practice changes as well as to promote Sysco’s interest on relevant matters.
Represent Sysco QA at various conferences and trade associations by potentially serving on committees and working groups as well as presenting on various topics.
General Management
Supervise and build a team of both direct and indirect reports, including but not limited to a) Direct Reports: Recall Coordinator(s), Data Analyst, b) Indirect Reports: Third Party Solution Providers, Food Safety Program Mangers, BT Liaisons
Manage the various processes and stakeholders covered in the aforementioned sections.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Food Science, Animal Science or Biological Science from four-year College strongly preferred or equivalent experience in Food Safety/Regulatory to offset degree.
Five to seven years’ experience in regulatory affairs and knowledge of USDA/FDA/CFIA regulations as they relate to food manufacturing and distribution. Expert understanding of Food Safety regulations, laws, and best practices including those from FDA, USDA, CFIA and other provincial/state/ local entities.
Three plus years accountability for compliance of federal/state/provincial/local regulatory laws. Proven ability ensuring safety and quality of products.
Three plus years’ experience leading a team as well as development and management of standardized Food Safety policies and procedures. Excellent investigative and analytical skills, project management knowledge or skills.
Technical acuity and confidence to act.
Time management and prioritization skills, ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with capacity to engage internal and external at all levels. Prior recall experience/knowledge preferred.
Knowledge of product traceability.
HACCP, PCQI, Seafood HACCP, FSVP certification preferred. Knowledge of food microbiology, Food Safety, and food defense.
Travel is required 10% of time (average travel is 1.5 - 3 out of 5 days per week).

Skills and Abilities:

SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES:
Intrinsic Capabilities: The successful candidate will have a high-level of integrity and accountability, specifically the ability to speak and act with complete honesty and trustworthiness. Successful candidates must be capable of working independently and adept at identification of business and Food Safety risk priorities and executing against them in a collaborative manner with others on the QA team, Operating Company personnel, and suppliers. He /She will be flexible and adaptable to promptly adjust to new circumstances. In addition, this person will demonstrate active curiosity with a strong focus around proactively soliciting and acting on received feedback. This person will have a high level of maturity and be able to read an audience and adapt their communication and influencing style quickly and appropriately. This person will have high energy and thrive on solving complex challenges. He/She will be able to handle multiple assignments and stakeholders simultaneously, often with competing priorities. This person will be required to lead and manage a team of 1-3 team members.
Setting Vision, Strategy and Direction: The successful candidate will have detailed knowledge and insights into the business, including QA data systems knowledge and productivity metrics that ultimately drive results. This person will have the ability to think and act in a forward-looking manner. He/She will be relentlessly focused on execution.
Developing and Leveraging Relationships: The successful candidate will have communication, customer service, relationship building and influencing skills. He /She will be open-minded, transparent and they will have good listening skills. This person will communicate ideas in a clear, practical and compelling manner. Further, they will balance data, personalities and conflicting interests when influencing others and recognize nuances in reading others. Finally, this person possesses a high level of integrity and character.
Team Participation: The successful candidate will be able to collaborate with a high degree of emotional intelligence who respects people. He / She will have an inclusive style; they will build trust, frank dialogue and respect, and foster teamwork. This person will be required to lead and manage a team of 1-3 team members.
Language Skills: The successful candidate will have the ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations in English. Candidate must demonstrate ability to write reports, business correspondence, policies and procedures, as well as effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of associates, senior leaders, customers, and suppliers.
Mathematical Skills: The successful candidate must demonstrate the ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals, as well as have ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to create and interpret graphs.
Reasoning Ability: The successful candidate must demonstrate the ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. The successful candidate must demonstrate ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.
Certificates, Licenses, and Registrations: Valid driver’s license. Certifications in Food Safety, HACCP, PCQI, Seafood HACCP
Other Skills and Abilities: Ability to use a personal computer and office communication equipment.

WORK ENVIRONMENT AND PHYSICAL DEMANDS
This position is located at the corporate office in Houston, TX. In order to fulfill management responsibilities, candidates must be able to travel to Sysco Operating Companies, regulatory meetings and industry conferences. The work requires the following physical activities: sitting, finger dexterity for activities such as data entry, speaking, hearing, visual acuity, and mobility between departments. Work may require bending, stooping, squatting, kneeling, and crouching; extensive telephone work; ability to receive detailed information through both verbal and written communication, ability to express or exchange ideas by means of the spoken word; ability to lift up to 50 lbs. Use of both hands is required. The work is performed primarily indoors. Occasionally some work may be performed for short periods in temperature controlled warehouse environments (freezer, cooler, and exterior environments).
The work environment characteristics and physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. Plant audits/inspections and working at remote in-transit warehouses and Sysco Operating Companies contain both moderate/loud noise and exposure to fumes and mechanical hazards.
NOTICE: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature of the environment and level of work being performed by this job. This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only tasks to be performed by the associate in this job. He or she will be required to follow any other instructions and to perform any other job related duties requested by his or her supervisor. This job description supersedes prior job descriptions.

Title: Quality Manager - External Reporting and Performance Improvement
FullDescriptions:
At Houston Methodist, the Manager External Reporting and Performance Improvement (PI) position is responsible for providing leadership and coordination of external benchmarking, clinical database and registry activities related to outcomes data collection, validation, aggregation and reporting to meet hospital, department and service line quality improvement initiatives, accreditation and regulatory requirements. Duties include disseminating results of benchmarking initiatives to leadership, medical staff service line and quality committees; and collaborating with leadership and medical staff to facilitate service line, departmental and unit based reporting and PI efforts.

The manager position responsibilities include managing the daily work activities of the work unit/department staff, ensuring quality, productivity, functional excellence and efficiency while assisting management in accomplishing strategic and operational objectives. In addition, this position provides guidance to staff and is responsible for staffing, budget compliance, contributing to staffing decisions such as hiring and terminating employment, coaching and counseling employees on work related performance, and assisting in the development and implementation of policies and procedures to ensure a safe and effective work environment. This position also implements training, monitoring and operations initiatives that assure compliance with ethical and legal business practices and accreditation/regulatory/ government regulations.

PATIENT AGE GROUP(S) AND POPULATION(S) SERVED
Refer to departmental "Scope of Service" and "Provision of Care" plans, as applicable, for description of primary age groups and populations served by this job for the respective HM entity.

HOUSTON METHODIST EXPERIENCE EXPECTATIONS
o Provide personalized care and service by consistently demonstrating our I CARE values:
INTEGRITY: We are honest and ethical in all we say and do.COMPASSION: We embrace the whole person including emotional, ethical, physical, and spiritual needs.ACCOUNTABILITY: We hold ourselves accountable for all our actions.RESPECT: We treat every individual as a person of worth, dignity, and value.EXCELLENCE: We strive to be the best at what we do and a model for others to emulate.
o Focuses on patient/customer safety
o Delivers personalized service using HM Service Standards
o Provides for exceptional patient/customer experiences by following our Standards of Practice of always using Positive Language (AIDET, Managing Up, Key Words)
o Intentionally rounds with patients/customers to ensure their needs are being met
o Involves patients (customers) in shift/handoff reports by enabling their participation in their plan of care as applicable to the given job

PRIMARY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Job responsibilities labeled EF capture those duties that are essential functions of the job.

PEOPLE - 30%
1. Performs management responsibilities of selection, scheduling, supervision, retention, and evaluation of employees in the Quality, Patient Safety and Performance Improvement department. Provides development and mentoring of staff. Meets or exceeds threshold goal for department turnover. Develops direct reports to perform these same functions. (EF)
2. Provides leadership and communication to maintain a competent and engaged employee group by conducting regular department meetings to review policies and procedures and operational matters, rounding on all employees, completing performance appraisals, conducting new hire feedback sessions, coaching/corrective counseling, and providing recognition/commendations to achieve desired outcomes. Provides timely guidance and feedback to help others strengthen specific knowledge/skill areas needed to accomplish a task or solve a problem. (EF)
3. Facilitates the promotion of teamwork within and between departments; participates and/or leads and facilitates department process improvements as needed. (EF)
4. Meets or exceeds threshold goal for department and/or system metrics on employee engagement indicators: action readiness score, tier level. (EF)
5. Coordinates and facilitates relationships between the various departments, committees, and taskforces involved in quality measurement initiatives. Assists managed care contracting with responses to payor quality surveys as needed. (EF)

SERVICE - 20%
1. Plans and organizes day-to-day Quality, Patient Safety, Performance Improvement department operations, schedule and activities. Sets priorities and functional standards, giving direction to staff as necessary to ensure the best possible delivery of service and high customer/patient satisfaction. (EF)
2. Drives department service standards and activities to impact department and/or system score for patient/customer-based satisfaction, through role modeling and fostering accountability. Serves and actively participates on various entity committees as a voice for the Quality, Patient Safety, Performance Improvement department. (EF)
3. Serves as a consultant and internal expert for the leadership related to external clinical quality and patient safety reporting requirements and regulatory requests for state and federal compliance audits. Mentors, coordinates, supervises and evaluates the work of all staff associated with external reporting functions. Reviews staff work product and productivity, identifying areas where personnel require additional training and/or automation to consistently meet data quality expectations of the job and supports recommended training activities.

QUALITY/SAFETY - 30%
1. Ensures a safe and effective working environment; monitors and/or revises the Performance Improvement department safety plan and/or any specific accreditation/ regulatory required safety guidelines. (EF)
2. Uses and optimizes information systems to enhance operations; supports entity-specific performance improvement and data management/analysis functions. (EF)
3. Employs a proactive approach in the optimization of safe outcomes by monitoring and improving the department workflow, using peer-to-peer accountability, and identifying solutions via collaboration. Adopts lean principles in driving process improvements. Role models situational awareness, using teachable moments to improve safety. (EF)
4. Monitors self and employee compliance with policies, procedures, and System HR Standards of Practice and performs associated actions upon non-compliance (i.e., focal point review requirements, disaster plan, inservices, influenza immunization, wage and hour, standard hours, timely termination submission, timely timecard approval, etc.). (EF)
5. Identifies quality improvement opportunities through analysis of facility and external benchmark data. Appropriately delegates and manages outcome for project assignments to qualified staff. Supports facility external benchmarking initiatives. (EF)
6. Reviews and assesses new data abstraction requirements; provides education regarding new guidelines and abstraction criteria to staff, department personnel and leadership of impacted clinical areas. Works with staff to identify sources of automated data to support new requirements and reduce abstraction workload. (EF)
7. Provides program oversight for hospital quality measures. Ensures that quality data submissions for regulatory agency deadlines are completed in a timely and accurate manner. Works with HIM personnel to ensure all required medical record documentation is submitted for external validation within allowable timeframes. (EF)
8. Serves as Quality Net Administrator and primary contact for all registries. Implements internal controls for database accuracy and collaborates with system hospitals for sharing of best practices and development of inter-rater reliability systems. Ensures that quality control checks are conducted, records are maintained and that corrective action is taken when problems are identified.

FINANCE - 10%
1. Assists in the development of department budget and ensures that the department operates in a cost effective manner. Manages/audits department expenses within approved budget parameters, ensuring that the Performance Improvement department meets the budgeted/flex revenue and/or expense targets on a monthly and annual basis. Develops staffing plans and schedules to meet department needs that reflect understanding of the importance of cost-effectiveness. (EF)
2. Implements department strategies to achieve financial target and staffing needs, developing others to do the same, through optimizing productivity, supply/resource efficiency, minimizing incidental overtime and overtime percentage, and other areas according to department specifications. (EF)

GROWTH/INNOVATION - 10%
1. Identifies and implements innovative solutions for practice or workflow changes to improve department operations or other department-specific measures by leading unit projects and/or other department/system directed activities. Supports change initiatives, maintaining effectiveness when experiencing major changes in work responsibilities or environment; adjusts effectively to work within new work structures, processes, requirements or cultures. (EF)
2. Proactively evaluates processes; recommends and implements action plan(s) for change. Participates in the development and implementation of new procedures and the review and revision of existing procedures. (EF)
3. Identifies opportunities and takes action to build strategic relationships between one¿s area and other areas, teams, departments, and units to achieve business goals. (EF)
4. Seeks opportunities to identify developmental needs of self and staff and takes appropriate action. Ensures own career discussions occur with appropriate management. Completes and updates the individual development plan (IDP) on an on-going basis. Conducts conversations with staff on their development and IDP. (EF)

This job description is not intended to be all inclusive; the employee will also perform other reasonably related business/job duties as assigned. Houston Methodist reserves the right to revise job duties and responsibilities as the need arises.

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS
o Master's degree in allied health, healthcare administration, business administration or a clinical discipline

EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS
o Three years of progressively responsible staff experience within hospital quality/ performance improvement/project management
o Two years of management experience preferred
o Two years of experience with decision support, clinical database development or research preferred

CERTIFICATIONS, LICENSES AND REGISTRATIONS REQUIRED
o Clinical Data Analyst certification through Vizient required within one year of assuming position
o Six Sigma certification, Certified Professional in Healthcare Quality (CPHQ), Project Management Professional (PMP) certification, or specialty certification in clinical discipline preferred

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED
o Demonstrates the skills and competencies necessary to safely perform the assigned job, determined through on-going skills, competency assessments, and performance evaluations
o Sufficient proficiency in speaking, reading, and writing the English language necessary to perform the essential functions of this job, especially with regard to activities impacting patient or employee safety or security
o Ability to effectively communicate through a variety of channels with patients, physicians, family members and co-workers in a manner consistent with a customer service focus and application of positive language principles; engages the recipient(s) and helps them understand and retain the message
o Demonstrates the ability to interact with others in a way that gives them confidence in one's intentions and those of the organization
o Ability to use appropriate interpersonal styles and techniques to gain acceptance of ideas or plans; modifying one¿s own behavior to accommodate tasks, situations and individuals involved
o Demonstrates leadership qualities and critical thinking through self-direction initiative and effective interpersonal skills and oral/written communication skills
o Ability to identify and understand issues, problems and opportunities, comparing data from different sources to draw conclusions; using effective approaches for choosing a course of action or developing appropriate solutions; taking action that is consistent with available facts, constraints and probable consequences
o Ability to work effectively in a fast paced environment
o Demonstrates flexibility and adaptability in the workplace
o Demonstrates experience in understanding and executing performance improvement concepts and activities
o Ability to manage and manipulate large scale longitudinal data sets covering multiple populations
o Advanced skill in use of spreadsheet and relational database software
o Strong presentation skills and ability to facilitate work teams
o Skill in use of clinical and operational outcomes and comparative performance benchmark databases

SUPPLEMENTAL REQUIREMENTS

Business professional Yes

On-Call* No (for Non-Exempt or Exempt jobs)

Note that employees may be required to be on-call during emergencies (i.e. Disaster, Severe Weather Event, etc.) regardless of selection above.

Travel**
May require travel within No
Houston Metropolitan area

May require travel outside No
of Houston Metropolitan area

**Travel specifications may vary by department.

Title: Report Developer

FullDescriptions:
Under the direction of the Reports Development Supervisor, the Report Developer will be responsible for the development, testing, implementation, and maintenance of ad-hoc and recurring reports as well as dashboards that utilize the underlying data stores for internal and external use.

Working with cross-functional teams, the Report Developer will participate to thoroughly analyze and clarify report requirements, make recommendations, and educate when necessary to meet business needs.

The Report Developer will also be required to assist the Data Analyst team in providing analytical support for report troubleshooting for end-users in the Los Angeles Continuum of Care (LA CoC).

Essential Job Functions
Develop or assist in the development, automation, and upgrading of queries, reports, and dashboards for internal and external users.
Assist in creating, designing, and formatting of technical specifications including descriptive text, process flows, and other information to describe required system and report changes for development and QA as needed.
Translate report requirements to implement the required reports and dashboards, created from potentially multiple data sources.
Design and implement technology best practices, guidelines and repeatable processes.
Provide support as required to ensure availability and performance of developed reports and dashboards for internal and external users.
Assist senior staff and team members in assessing and improving business operations and processes.
Assist in assembling complex ideas, issues and observations into useful explanations and clear direction for the team.
Provide training and assistance to end-users to support team members as necessary.
Provide technical assistance and cross training to other team members.
Participate with other teams to convert legacy reports.
Participate in meetings and business and data analysis activities with cross-functional teams to gather required reporting and dashboard requirements.
Must be able to perform duties with moderate to low supervision.
Other duties and special projects as assigned.
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
Intermediate or Advanced knowledge of T-SQL, SQL Server Data Tools, and SQL Server Management Studio.
Performance tuning experience related to reporting queries.
Intermediate or Advanced knowledge of relational database management systems.
Programming/Scripting experience and knowledge of data/system analysis, software development life cycle.
Knowledge of HMIS preferred, but not required.
Intermediate to advanced skills of Excel, including VBA.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work independently, be proactive, and exercise good judgment.
Flexibility to work with individuals with varying work styles.
Excellent time management and prioritization skills.
Open to new ideas and approaches.
Attention to detail.
Analytical thinker.
Training & Experience
Minimum 1-3 years of analyzing business requirements, creating custom reports in SQL and SSRS.
BA/BS in Computer Science or related field is strongly preferred; however an equivalent combination of applicable training and experience may be substituted for the education requirement.

Salary Range
$51,314 - $74,406

Appointments are typically made between the minimum and the midpoint of the range, depending on qualifications.

Applicants may make a reasonable accommodation request for this job by calling the Human Resources Department at (213) 683-3333; or via email at humanresources@lahsa.org; or in person @ 811 Wilshire Blvd., 6th Floor, Los Angeles, CA 90017.

Title: Research and Data Associate, Supervised Release Program
Research Assistant II
FullDescriptions:
We are seeking a full-time research data analyst to analyze medical data from multiple clinical research studies in the department of Anesthesia and Perioperative Care, with the goal to improve the health and perioperative care of surgical patients. Current projects include examining the effects of surgery and anesthesia on the brain, such as post-traumatic stress disorder and Alzheimer’s disease, as well as cardiothoracic outcomes. The incumbent would be an NCIRE employee part of an active and growing multidisciplinary health research program based at the San Francisco VA Medical Center in collaboration with the Center for Imaging of Neurodegenerative Diseases (CIND). This position is ideal for individuals seeking experience in a high caliber academic environment and advancing a career in medicine or clinical research.

Essential Functions:
Manage, edit, clean, merge and maintain study datasets in preparation
for data analysis
Conduct descriptive and trend analysis, build statistical models and test
study hypotheses using statistical software (e.g., SAS, STATA, SPSS,
STATA, or R)
Review statistical output for consistency and qualityPrepare tables and graphics of statistical results for inclusion in reports,
presentations, grant applications, and manuscripts for peer-reviewed
journals
Interpret and communicate statistical results to principal investigator and
other research and study staff
Maintain detailed documentation of work performedFollow VA and UCSF human subject protocols for informed consent,
subject enrollment, data collection and storage
Perform other related duties as assigned
B.A. or B.S. in a related subject (e.g., statistics, biology, psychology, or
epidemiology)
Experience conducting data analysis and building statistical modelsProficient in statistical and analytical software (e.g., SAS, STATA, SPSS,
STATA, or R)
Familiarity with parametric and nonparametric statistical methodsFamiliarity with statistical methods handling problematic data including
outliers, missing data, etc.
Excellent analytical and written/oral communication skillsOutstanding organizational and problem-solving aptitudeAble to work well with others including the principal investigator and
other research colleagues, study staff, medical students, residents and
post-doctoral fellows

Preferred skills
Advanced degree (e.g. MPH, PhD) in a related fieldKnowledge of medical terminology and healthcare proceduresExperience conducting clinical research

Title: RESEARCH CONSULTANT
FullDescriptions:
The Department of Environmental and Occupational Health Sciences, housed in the UW School of Public Health, is seeking a full-time entry level data analyst (Research Consultant) for PATHWAYS, an NIH-funded longitudinal study of prenatal and early-life exposures to chemical and non-chemical stressors and associations with child health and development. The Research Consultant will be a staff scientist in the PATHWAYS Data Center, based at the University of Washington, Seattle. Data Center scientists work closely with PATHWAYS investigators at various institutions, including Seattle Children’s Research Institute, the University of California, San Francisco, the University of Tennessee Health Science Center, and others. PATHWAYS is part of the Environmental Influences on Child Health Outcomes (ECHO) consortium (www.echochildren.org).


The ECHO PATHWAYS study is a complex epidemiological project involving five Co-Principal Investigators at four separate institutions, three distinct epidemiological cohorts which are following more than 3000 mother-child dyads, ten subcontracts, six geographical locations for sample collection, and a dual mission of achieving study-specific objectives and working with NIH and investigators around the country to shape and implement a national ECHO study protocol. The researcher will be expected to carry out high quality, accurate work in a multi-faceted research environment where command of quantitative details is essential. The ideal candidate will be organized, flexible, and self-motivated with a desire to learn, good communication skills, and the ability to work and thrive in a diverse, interdisciplinary academic research environment. Working under the direct supervision of a senior level scientist, the Research Consultant will perform the following duties:


Coordinate transfer of data from University of Washington to the central NIH repository. This task will involve organizing, compiling, documenting, transmitting, and tracking multiple large datasets.


Communicate with ECHO PATHWAYS scientists, as needed, to get guidance on data harmonization.


Conduct data quality assurance procedures on data sets generated by other data analysts to ensure accurate, analyzable data files.


Produce material to describe data and analytic results, such as tables, maps and figures.


Contribute to reports, peer reviewed manuscripts, publications, and presentations.

Attend and contribute to regular data team and project meetings.


As a UW employee, you will enjoy generous benefits and work/life programs. For detailed information on Benefits for this position, click here.


Requirements:


Bachelor’s degree in demography, epidemiology, health policy, statistics, biostatistics, geography, sociology or related field. Up to one year of experience working in public health related research; proficient with Microsoft office products including Excel and Word; experience with data collected in a research setting.


Preferred Experience includes:


Previous experience managing and analyzing complex datasets, two or more years of experience with R, SAS, Stata, and/or Python, familiarity with human subjects research, and an interest in public health research including maternal and child health research


Application Process:

The application process for UW positions may include completion of a variety of online assessments to obtain additional information that will be used in the evaluation process. These assessments may include Workforce Authorization, Cover Letter and/or others. Any assessments that you need to complete will appear on your screen as soon as you select “Apply to this position”. Once you begin an assessment, it must be completed at that time; if you do not complete the assessment you will be prompted to do so the next time you access your “My Jobs” page. If you select to take it later, it will appear on your "My Jobs" page to take when you are ready. Please note that your application will not be reviewed, and you will not be considered for this position until all required assessments have been completed.

Committed to attracting and retaining a diverse staff, the University of Washington will honor your experiences, perspectives and unique identity. Together, our community strives to create and maintain working and learning environments that are inclusive, equitable and welcoming.
The University of Washington is a leader in environmental stewardship & sustainability, and committed to becoming climate neutral.
The University of Washington is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer. To request disability accommodation in the application process, contact the Disability Services Office at 206-543-6450 / 206-543-6452 (tty) or dso@uw.edu.

Title: Research Data Intern
Qualifications:
Reviews audit reports after data has been entered and corrects any data entry errors.
Responds to inquiries concerning established databases and concerning policies and procedures pertaining to departmental operations.
Keeps abreast of policies and procedures pertaining to record maintenance.
Ensures confidentiality of records is maintained. Identifies issues/problems with database management policies/procedures and recommends possible solutions.
Provides direction or assistance to users of information.
Distributes reports generated from existing databases.
Management of IRB documents and study design forms
Performs related responsibilities as required.
FullDescriptions:
Description
Maintains and ensures the integrity and security of one or more databases. Reviews data to be entered into a database to ensure accuracy and integrity of data.
Project Overview:
The Research Data Intern will join a collaborative team that has multiple projects internationally and domestically. Specifically, our research is related to retinal disease and inflammatory (both infectious and noninfectious) eye diseases. Over the past 4 years our team has been working diligently to describe ocular findings and determine viral persistence in Ebola virus Disease (EVD) Survivors in Sierra Leone and Liberia. Other international projects include a pilot study with the Child Health and Mortality Prevention Surveillance Study with the Emory Global Health Institute in Kenya. We currently have future NIH funding to perform extended studies on EVD survivors.
Minimum Qualifications:
A high school diploma or equivalent. One year of clerical experience including experience with micro-computers or computer databases.
Tasks:
Reviews audit reports after data has been entered and corrects any data entry errors.
Responds to inquiries concerning established databases and concerning policies and procedures pertaining to departmental operations.
Keeps abreast of policies and procedures pertaining to record maintenance.
Ensures confidentiality of records is maintained. Identifies issues/problems with database management policies/procedures and recommends possible solutions.
Provides direction or assistance to users of information.
Distributes reports generated from existing databases.
Management of IRB documents and study design forms
Performs related responsibilities as required.

Title: Research Instructor
Qualifications:
An MS in biostatistics, bioinformatics, computer science, mathematics, computational biology, or a related field
Strong programming skills in a common statistical software package (e.g. SAS, R).
Strong programming skills in multiple languages including several of Java, C++, Scala, R, Perl, Python, Bash, C, or others
At least 3 years of experience as an analytic consultant/collaborator.
Evidence of independence/leadership on research teams.
FullDescriptions:
University of Colorado Denver l Anschutz Medical Campus
School of Medicine, Department of Surgery – Division of GI, Trauma, and Endocrine Surgery
Research Instructor
Position #00757248

The University of Colorado Denver l Anschutz Medical Campus seeks individuals with demonstrated commitment to creating an inclusive learning and working environment. We value the ability to engage effectively with students, faculty and staff of diverse backgrounds.


The University of Colorado Denver | Anschutz Medical Campus is a public research university serving more than 18,000 students. We award nearly 4,000 degrees each year, including more graduate and professional degrees than any other Colorado institution. With our solid academic reputation, award-winning faculty and renowned researchers, we offer more than 140 highly rated degree programs through 13 schools and colleges. The university receives over $400 million in research awards each year. In addition to the wide array of health-related programs and facilities offered at CU Anschutz in Aurora, Colo. a significant number of undergraduate and graduate degree programs are taught at CU Denver, our comprehensive campus in the heart of downtown Denver—one of America’s most vibrant urban centers. CU Denver is located steps from the Denver Center for Performing Arts and the LoDo District affording our students, faculty and staff access to a broad array of academic, professional, community, recreational and cultural outlets.

A national leader in health care and life sciences, CU Anschutz is the only comprehensive academic health sciences center in Colorado and the largest in the Rocky Mountain region. Located in Aurora, Colo., it is one of the newest education, research and patient care facilities in the world. With six schools and colleges, CU Anschutz trains the health sciences workforce of the future by blending education, research and clinical care all in one place. This strategic collaboration among diverse health care fields allows knowledge to travel directly from the research bench to the patient’s bedside. Read CU Anschutz Quick Facts here.

Position Emphasis:
This is a Health Services Research position in the Department of Surgery. The primary project will be independent analysis of the At-Risk Intervention and Mentoring (AIM) program at Denver Health, a hospital-based violence intervention program. The position will involve some data collection through interviewing patients, along with research design and analysis of collected data, and independent, unbiased assessment of program endpoints and effectiveness. The University of Colorado Denver will complete research within the Design and Implementation Research Framework to allow for iterative changes of the program based on this feedback, as well as providing reports to the Department of Justice as may be required.

This research instructor is expected to provide high-level, professional and scientifically rigorous design and analysis support. The research instructor will be expected to work independently with research groups and mentor and supervise more junior analysts, data managers, and medical students. They will serve as lead biostatistician and exhibit their team science contributions through submission of applied abstracts and perhaps lead on collaborative publications. The research instructor in this position will consult and collaborate with investigators on all aspects of the research process, including: design of new studies (sample size and analysis planning), data management, data pre-processing, complex programming, analysis implementation and data visualization, and dissemination of results. This individual is expected to co-author abstracts, oral and poster presentations, and scientific manuscripts. Experience with qualitative analysis and mixed-methods analysis is preferred.

Supervision Received:
The Research Instructor position will be supervised by the Research Director.

Supervision Exercised:
The Research Instructor may have supervisory responsibilities with graduate students, Professional Research Assistants (PRA), medical students, and residents.

Examples of Work Performed:
Patient interviews, analysis of program endpoints, design and implementation frameworks. Initially more data collection, progressing to increased responsibilities and supervision of PRAs as the program grows.

Salary and Benefits:
Salary is commensurate with skills and experience. The University of Colorado offers a full benefits package. Information on University benefits programs, including eligibility, is located at Employee Services.

The University of Colorado Denver is dedicated to ensuring a safe and secure environment for our faculty, staff, students and visitors. To assist in achieving that goal, we conduct background investigations for all prospective employees.
The Immigration Reform and Control Act requires that verification of employment eligibility be documented for all new employees by the end of the third day of work. Alternative formats of this ad are available upon request for persons with disabilities.
Your total compensation goes beyond the number on your paycheck. The University of Colorado provides generous leave, health plans and retirement contributions that add to your bottom line.

The University of Colorado Denver | Anschutz Medical Campus is committed to recruiting and supporting a diverse student body, faculty and administrative staff. The university strives to promote a culture of inclusiveness, respect, communication and understanding. We encourage applications from women, ethnic minorities, persons with disabilities and all veterans. The University of Colorado is committed to diversity and equality in education and employment.

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:
An MS in biostatistics, bioinformatics, computer science, mathematics, computational biology, or a related field
Strong programming skills in a common statistical software package (e.g. SAS, R).
Strong programming skills in multiple languages including several of Java, C++, Scala, R, Perl, Python, Bash, C, or others
At least 3 years of experience as an analytic consultant/collaborator.
Evidence of independence/leadership on research teams.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with data management and integration of data sources.
Experience writing reproducible data processing pipelines.
4+ years of post-graduate research experience as an analyst.
Experience serving as a data analyst or computational biologist on multiple projects.
Or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience that provides the individual with the required knowledge, skills and abilities.
Competencies:
Strong knowledge of statistical and/or computational biology principles relevant in medical research.
Ability to analyze and solve complex problems and apply quantitative analytical approaches.
Ability to investigate the properties of statistical/computational methodology through simulation or other means.
Strong programming skills in multiple languages including several of Java, C++, Scala, R, Perl, Python, Bash, C, or others
Strong programming skills in a common statistical software package (such as SAS, R).
An ability to work with high performance computing environments and cloud computing.
Good organizational skills across multiple projects, managing own work load, self-directed.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Positive attitude and the ability to work with a variety of biomedical investigators and colleagues.
Ability to contribute to the growth and development of Health Services Research in the Department of Surgery.
Demonstrated ability to successfully contribute to the analytic elements of multiple projects simultaneously.


Special Instructions to Applicants: Applications are accepted electronically ONLY at www.cu.edu/cu-careers. Review of applications will begin immediately, and will continue until the position is filled.


Application Materials Required: Cover Letter, Resume/CV, List of References

Application Materials Instructions: To apply, please visit: http://www.cu.edu/cu-careers and attach: 1. A letter of application which specifically addresses the job requirements and outlines qualifications 2. A current CV/resume 3. List of three to five professional references (we will notify you prior to contacting both on and off-list references)

FullDescriptions:
Company Description:
Based in Austin, TX, Buffalo Americas, Inc., is the North and South American sales and marketing division of Buffalo Inc., a global electronics manufacturer headquartered in Nagoya, Japan. Buffalo is a global leader in the design, development and manufacturing of network and direct attached storage and wired and wireless networking solutions. With four decades of engineering leadership in the networking and computer peripheral industry Buffalo has delivered many products to the market establishing industry standards. Buffalo Americas, Inc., is dedicated to providing business-to-business based solutions, and prides itself on customer service and delivering easy-to-use and reliable products and solutions.
Sales and Logistics Reports & Data Analyst Associate
Key Function: Data Gathering/Analyst and Report Compiler
The Support person’s duties will mainly consist of compiling data for both the sales and logistics teams to complete reports required on daily/weekly/monthly/annual basis. This role works in a highly matrixed structure between Sales/Logistics/Accounting. This role is a key role to providing timely and accurate reports to the various departments. The person must be proficient in excel, demonstrate analytical capabilities, desire to improve processes and expect to take on support duties not detailed in this job description.
The job is full-time for 40 hours a week. M-F and a non-exempt position

Title: Sales Operations Manager
FullDescriptions:
About GetUpside

GetUpside personalizes brick-and-mortar commerce to help communities thrive. As we connect more than 2 million drivers with over 10,000 businesses nearby, merchants make more profit, consumers get more purchasing power, and value is driven back to our communities. By analyzing historical customer data, Getupside creates personalized offers that profitably increase drive incremental transactions in real-time, generating a profit on every single transaction. We don't just prove it, we guarantee it.

Meet The Revenue Operations Team

The Revenue Operations team at GetUpside is a diverse group of talented, team-oriented individuals who are committed to our mission of helping merchants and communities thrive. Every day, we strive to maximize the value we provide to merchants by analyzing performance, building internal tools, and creating scalable processes. We value a supportive work environment where we can learn from our mistakes while we tackle the ever-changing challenges that come with supporting a fast-growing business.

We're aggressively growing the Revenue Operations Team to support our growth into new territories and spend categories. We're seeking a Sales Operations Manager that will play a critical role scaling our sales and account management tools and processes.

What will you do?


Act as the point of contact for the sales operations team
Assist in defining quarterly objectives and drive the team to hit key milestones to increase acquisition and activation
Create and maintain documentation on sales processes, policies, and relevant sales training materials and assist with onboarding new sales talent
Work with Finance, HR, and sales management to develop sales incentive programs and compensation planning in order to increase sales productivity
Lead Salesforce administration and project prioritization
Produce and review actionable and accurate sales reporting and BI tools for reps, managers,
and sales leaders
Own the end-to-end process of tracking the sales funnel and operational metrics and delivering regular insights to the business; define and deliver techniques to improve the funnel performance for sales management
Partner with sales reps and marketing to refine lead qualification process, analyze and report on campaign performances with reporting and dashboards.
Refine customer segmentation, assist with territory management, and help administer merchant engagement model

What do you need?


Bachelor's Degree in Business or other relevant field or equivalent professional experience
2-5 years of experience working as an investment banker, management consultant, or as a data analyst at a related enterprise software company (Retailed Preferred)
Experience building and/or managing a sales operations team
Strong analytical and quantitative skills, as well as attention to detail
Highly proficient in Salesforce
Ability to take analyze analysis and make them simple to understand and digest to multiple audience levels
Willingness to wear multiple hats and work in a fast-paced environment
Positivity and team-oriented attitude

Please note: Relocation assistance is not provided at this time.

We're an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Sales Operations Manager
FullDescriptions:
Job Purpose:
Every company is a company that Okta can make more secure and more productive. Our vision is to bring the benefits of Identity to every company.

To help us achieve this ambitious growth objective we are seeking a strategic thinker and cross-functional leader to support business strategy and analytics for Okta's Sales Development machine and create leverage for the business through insightful analysis, robust planning, and operational reporting.

The Sr. Analyst of Strategy and Analytics is a key partner to executive leadership and helps them to understand their performance, identifying opportunities for increased efficiency, and driving results through impeccable planning. Equal parts data analyst, product manager, strategy consultant, and industrial engineer this role will be an instrumental part of our strategy and operations team.

The ideal candidate brings a familiarity with B2B sales and demand gen, fluency working with data and quantitative reasoning, a drive to seek out and incorporate new ideas, excellent written and verbal communication skills, and most importantly, a passion for teamwork and collaboration. The ideal profile will have experience in a fast paced high growth environment with technology companies, SaaS or enterprise software.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Insights and Analysis: Tackle big challenging, strategic questions. Develop insightful fact-based analyses that guide decisions about all aspects of Okta's Sales Development engine.
Metrics and Reporting: Define and build the standard set of data products that make the business run, and get everyone speaking the same language. Make sure that every rep and every executive understands their performance and can access the data they need to optimize their motion.
Planning: "Plans are nothing, but planning is everything" said someone famous. In this spirit you'll assist with executing a planning process that enables optimal efficiency, balances priorities globally, and facilitates thoughtful decision making.

QUALIFICATIONS:

4+ years related work experience – sales operations, management consulting, data analytics, FP&A or related
Excellent written and verbal communication
Demonstrated ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams
Expert Excel data modeling and analysis skills
Expert Salesforce reporting skills
Experience with SQL and fluency working with large data sets / data warehousing a plus
Experience with Tableau is a plus
BA or BS in economics, math, computer science, finance or other quantitative discipline

Okta is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Sales Strategy and Operations Analytics Manager
FullDescriptions:
*************************************************************************************************
Alert! Delete this alert and replace the content below each header with the details for this job.
*************************************************************************************************

You can utilize the DoorDash Job Post Guide ( https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Fb5eww36aHircHPy4DBfrVv41id6I6-waufnPL6aLvI/edit ) for more information on how to draft your job description.

About the Team
--------------

DoorDash is looking for a talented Sales Strategy and Operations Analytics Manager to drive strategic analytics and insights for the sales and partner management teams. You'll be working with large complex data sets and cross-functionally to discover insights and turn them into actionable business recommendations.

About the Role
--------------

As our Sales Strategy and Operations Data Analyst, you'll be a proactive thought partner to the merchant teams, developing and delivering insights for the organization. In this highly analytical role, you will help build the core sales infrastructure and analytics foundation including goal setting, measuring performance of initiatives, lead targeting, territory carving, head count and compensation design, strategic planning and much more.

You're excited about this opportunity because you will…
--------------------------------------------------------------------


Strategize – Use data-driven decision-making to align our sales leadership on key metrics and drive higher productivity
Experiment – Launch and test initiatives across sales and partner management and measure their impact
Optimize – Create programmatic solutions with Python and SQL to improve manual processes in Sales and Merchant Services; determine areas of focus through ad-hoc analyses and create proposals for new processes
Analyze – Utilize statistical knowledge to deep dive into complex data sets and draw insights to help the business understand marketplace dynamics and proactively address challenges; create and own metric tracking in Tableau to convey insights to partners
Influence – Manage both a small team and cross-functional projects with our sales, partner management, operations, product, engineering, business operations and BD teams to improve the merchant experience and achieve targets

We're excited about you because you have…
------------------------------------------------------


4+ years of relevant sales ops and analytical experience; level of role based on experience
Experience in strategy and operations, consulting, or a high-growth startup is a plus
Proven track record of advanced data analysis and modeling skills, leading cross-functional initiatives and succeeding in a complex and fast moving environment
Excellent analytical thinker who can deliver actionable recommendations out of complex datasets; strong in SQL
Expert communication and interpersonal skills
Entrepreneurial – You have a bias towards action and are able to thrive in a fast-paced, constantly changing work environment
Naturally curious – You are highly analytical and always look for ways to improve the process and increase productivity
Gritty – You have the ability to think globally and strategically, then roll up your sleeves to execute
Relationship-builder – You are a thought-partner and build trust-based and cross-functional relationships to get things done
Problem solver – You love solving hard problems and can independently structure and draw insights from ambiguous challenges

Why You'll Love Working at DoorDash
-----------------------------------------


We are leaders - Leadership is not limited to our management team. It's something everyone at DoorDash embraces and embodies.
We are doers - We believe the only way to predict the future is to build it. Creating solutions that will lead our company and our industry is what we do -- on every project, every day.
We are learning - We're not afraid to dig in and uncover the truth, even if it's scary or inconvenient. Everyone here is continually learning on the job, no matter if we've been in a role for one year or one minute.
We are customer obsessed - Our mission is to grow and empower local economies. We are committed to our customers, merchants, and dashers and believe in connecting people with possibility.
We are all DoorDash - The magic of DoorDash is our people, together making our inspiring goals attainable and driving us to greater heights.
We offer great compensation packages and comprehensive health benefits.

About DoorDash
--------------

DoorDash is a technology company that connects customers with their favorite local and national businesses in over 4,000 cities and all 50 states across the United States and Canada. Founded in 2013, DoorDash empowers merchants to grow their businesses by offering on-demand delivery, data-driven insights, and better in-store efficiency, providing delightful experiences from door to door. By building the last-mile delivery infrastructure for local cities, DoorDash is bringing communities closer, one doorstep at a time. Read more on the DoorDash blog ( https://blog.doordash.com/ ) or at www.doordash.com ( http://www.doordash.com ).

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
-----------------------------------------

We're committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That's why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of the best and brightest from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Title: Senior Academic Coordinator, Mellon College of Science (MCS)
Qualifications:
Associate’s degree required; Bachelor’s degree preferred.
At least 3-5 years administrative experience.
Responsibilities:
Assisting the academic advisors in working with students in developing academic plans and career goals, including academic schedules, declaring additional majors and minors, and preparing applications for graduate school.
Providing detailed information concerning course descriptions, instructors, prerequisites, course sequencing.
Managing communication between the MCS program and other academic units and campus offices such as Admissions, Career Center, and Office of International Education.
Maintaining student information, monitoring student progress and identifying situations needing additional attention
Drafting and maintaining unit communications including policies, catalog copy, website content and announcements.
Assisting the academic advisors in developing the advising programs to address specific needs or student groups.
Coordinating with Associate Dean of Undergraduate Affairs to handle academic activities for the science college, including scheduling and orientation of freshmen, sending academic warnings, coordinating declaration of majors, aiding with student registration, processing forms, posting transfer credit, and organizing special events.
Taking minutes at meetings of the College Council, Undergraduate Curriculum Committee and Student Advisory Councils.
Participating on the Committee for Undergraduate Affairs. Following up as necessary or as requested on action items for these committees.
Troubleshooting problems and questions from students, faculty, and staff concerning college and/or university policies and procedures. Answering all routine and most non-routine questions and correct most problems/issues directly.
Facilitating and supporting social events for Faculty and Graduate Affairs as well as the MCS Student Advisory Council.
Supporting data analysis for Faculty Affairs including tenure/promotion cases, faculty course evaluations, Ad Hoc review committee meetings and the Ashkin/Moore Award.
Acting as in-house data analyst for the college. Collecting and verifying data from a wide variety of sources, including internal university and external sources. Also retrieving information from databases using Student Data Warehouse and other query languages. Analyzing statistical data and other information to detect trends and make recommendations.
FullDescriptions:
The Mellon College of Science (MCS) is home to four departments and many programs and research centers that cross disciplines. We approach scientific problems from fresh angles using creative interdisciplinary approaches while drawing on our departmental strengths in the core sciences. MCS faculty members are nationally and internationally recognized for their research in a variety of fields, including polymer science, cosmology, mathematical finance and neuroscience.

We are seeking a Senior Academic Coordinator for the Offices of Undergraduate Affairs. Reporting to the Associate Dean for Undergraduate Affairs, you will provide senior level support in developing, implementing, and overseeing the operations of the offices of Undergraduate Affairs as well as Faculty and Graduate Affairs in MCS. Additionally, you will be responsible for helping to develop programs, policies, and procedures for effective communications and administration of the MCS undergraduate and graduate programs.

Core Responsibilities Include:
Assisting the academic advisors in working with students in developing academic plans and career goals, including academic schedules, declaring additional majors and minors, and preparing applications for graduate school.
Providing detailed information concerning course descriptions, instructors, prerequisites, course sequencing.
Managing communication between the MCS program and other academic units and campus offices such as Admissions, Career Center, and Office of International Education.
Maintaining student information, monitoring student progress and identifying situations needing additional attention
Drafting and maintaining unit communications including policies, catalog copy, website content and announcements.
Assisting the academic advisors in developing the advising programs to address specific needs or student groups.
Coordinating with Associate Dean of Undergraduate Affairs to handle academic activities for the science college, including scheduling and orientation of freshmen, sending academic warnings, coordinating declaration of majors, aiding with student registration, processing forms, posting transfer credit, and organizing special events.
Taking minutes at meetings of the College Council, Undergraduate Curriculum Committee and Student Advisory Councils.
Participating on the Committee for Undergraduate Affairs. Following up as necessary or as requested on action items for these committees.
Troubleshooting problems and questions from students, faculty, and staff concerning college and/or university policies and procedures. Answering all routine and most non-routine questions and correct most problems/issues directly.
Facilitating and supporting social events for Faculty and Graduate Affairs as well as the MCS Student Advisory Council.
Supporting data analysis for Faculty Affairs including tenure/promotion cases, faculty course evaluations, Ad Hoc review committee meetings and the Ashkin/Moore Award.
Acting as in-house data analyst for the college. Collecting and verifying data from a wide variety of sources, including internal university and external sources. Also retrieving information from databases using Student Data Warehouse and other query languages. Analyzing statistical data and other information to detect trends and make recommendations.
Qualifications:
Associate’s degree required; Bachelor’s degree preferred.
At least 3-5 years administrative experience.
Flexibility, excellence, and passion are vital qualities within MCS. Inclusion, collaboration and cultural sensitivity are valued competencies at CMU. Therefore, we are in search of a team member who is able to effectively interact with a varied population of internal and external partners at a high level of integrity. We are looking for someone who shares our values and who will support the mission of the university through their work.

You should demonstrate:
Excellent organizational and planning skills with strong attention to detail.
Strong oral and written communication skills
Ability to effectively prioritize multiple tasks timely
Capability to keep and maintain accurate reports and records.
Excellent Analytical, reasoning, and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work in a culturally diverse environment and interact with campus community and external customers.
Strong computer skills, including proficiency with MS Office, Excel, and Adobe Creative Suite. Skill in building and maintaining websites.Ability to learn a variety of software applications.
Are you interested in this opportunity with us? Please apply.

More Information:
Please visit “Why Carnegie Mellon” to learn more about becoming part of an institution inspiring innovations that change the world.

A listing of employee benefits is available at: www.cmu.edu/jobs/benefits-at-a-glance/.

Carnegie Mellon University is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veteran.

Primary Location: United States-Pennsylvania-Pittsburgh

Time Type: Full Time

Organization: MCS DEAN'S OFFICE

Minimum Education Level: Bachelor's Degree or equivalent

Budgeted Base Pay: $14.00 - $25.76

Title: Senior Analytics Engineer, Product
FullDescriptions:
Los Gatos, California
Data Science and Engineering
Netflix is launching hundreds of titles for our 100+ million members to enjoy. The Product-Content Research and Analytics team provides insights and data to optimize the Netflix product so that members can find the content they love, and to inform the content strategy for how storytellers can most effectively connect with audiences around the world.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to answer analytical questions end-to-end that directly inform business outcomes. You will partner closely with our content and product teams to translate their curiosities into data-driven insights that change strategy and inform decision-making.
The ideal candidate:
Is passionate about organizing, analyzing, and visualizing large data sets at scale.
Is biased toward action. You iterate quickly and effectively, driving end-to-end projects with little guidance.
Is scrappy when necessary, but leans toward toward building robust, long-term solutions that scale.
Considers communication a strength, and is excited to educate stakeholders across teams and varying levels of technical expertise about data and tools.
Is creative, and enjoy shaping and extending asks from your partners, anticipating their future needs and providing new insights that they didn’t know to ask for.
Loves telling stories with data.
Must haves for this role:
5+ years experience as a data analyst, data scientist or in a similar role in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
Experience querying and manipulating petabytes of data for analysis and visualization using SQL, Hive, Spark, Presto, R, Python, etc.
Track record for building meaningful visualizations and tools that enable self-service for stakeholders and impact business decisions, especially in Tableau
Outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal - you can break down complex scientific findings into compelling stories for creative and content partners
Strong intuition with data, and previous work experience on metric development and featuring engineering.
Experience with ETL
Experience communicating with non-technical stakeholders, and translating loose business questions into actionable insights and high impact data products
Experience with visual / UI design a plus
