Title: Supply Chain Data Science Intern
FullDescriptions:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started.
Facebook is seeking a Supply Chain Data Science intern to join its Sourcing Operations Engineering (SOE) team. The role will work cross-functionally to define problem statements, work within the data space, and translate the findings to business key stakeholders. As an intern, you will be responsible for utilizing both qualitative and quantitative skills to drive business growth while flexing your creativity. Our team is seeking someone who is willing to take ownership of their work, while taking initiative to define and execute. This intern position is located in our Menlo Park office.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Your primary goal will be focused on successfully launching a project (including metrics to measure success) related to improving systems, tools or a process within the supply chain and sourcing team – this is the impact you will have
15-20% of your time will be focused on specific learning objectives which will be developed once the assignment begins – you will walk away with far more knowledge then when you arrive at Facebook
80-85% of your time will be focused on executing the day-to-day business, getting steeped in operations and execution related work – the best learning comes from doing the work that full-time professionals do
Work cross-functionally to define problem statement, collect data, build analytical models and make recommendations to provide a competitive advantage for the business
Define, implement and measure performance goals and metrics at the Product and Commodity level
Perform financial, statistical, and qualitative data analysis of markets and suppliers
Translate data into executable and effective market intelligence reports
Use market research and competitive intelligence to identify insights that can be used to drive key decisions across the organization (market share, growth projections and trends, and market forces)
Lead and support various ad hoc projects, as needed, in support of Facebook’s Infrastructure strategy
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a BA/BS in technical or business-related degrees
Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Demonstrated experience working cross-functionally utilizing communications
Proven track record in analysis and problem solving
Demonstrated working in high volume and task prioritization
Experience working independently with precision and speed
Has a background working in a technical sourcing organization supporting the launch of new products, day-to-day manufacturing and supply chain operations
Knowledge of Compute and Storage Systems, Networking and/or Data Center Operations
Experience in Data Science, Statistical modeling, Machine learning, Regression analysis, Monte Carlo simulation
Experience in SQL, HTML, Excel, Tableau, Hadoop, Python
Hands-on project management experience
Hands-on experience analyzing and interpreting data, drawing conclusions, defining recommended actions, and reporting results across stakeholders
Quantitative and analytical experience and experience using of decision-making tools, including predictive analytics, statistical modeling and sensitivity analysis
Experience in Sourcing Management or Supply Chain Management positions in electronics and market-based commodity products
Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Title: Supply Chain Leadership Development Program
FullDescriptions:
Job Description

McCain Foods is seeking recent or upcoming graduates with a Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Finance, Business or related disciplines to join the North American Supply Chain organization and be part of a Supply Chain Leadership Development Program. We are looking for well rounded, driven, highly analytical problem solvers with a track record of achieving results, who also have a passion to become future leaders at McCain.

The Supply Chain Leadership Development Program is intended to develop supply chain contributors into future supply chain leaders within McCain North America. The Program, for new hires, will offer candidates with limited experience and exposure to supply chain the ability to quickly gain a keen understanding of critical supply chain functions. The program focuses on rotational assignments designed to develop and broaden supply chain skills.

POSITION OVERVIEW
Participants will be provided with three rotational assignments which could include any of the following roles:

Supply Planner
Demand Planner
Deployment Planner
Supply Chain Analyst/Data Analyst
Logistics Coordinator
Customer Service Coordinator
During each of the three rotational assignments, participants will take on full-time responsibility of their functional role, while also completing the Leadership development curriculum and activities. Throughout time in the program, participants will foster technical and leadership skills through specific training, mentoring and professional development opportunities.

After the completion of the program, the employee will be assigned to a specific role, which may be a role which held during the rotational period. At this time, the employee would also be eligible to apply for relevant open roles within McCain, including any which were part of the rotational period.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Responsible for assigned full time roles as part of rotational assignments
Develop a keen understanding of supply chain functions and major roles and responsibilities
Engage in all training, development and educational opportunities provided
Participate in cross-functional teams supporting supply chain process improvement projects
Lead projects and related meetings with key stakeholders and deliver impactful presentations to senior leaders
Apply creative problem-solving skills to assigned work; communicate insights and synthesize conclusions

REQUIRED EDUCATION, KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILIITIES

Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Finance, Business or related discipline
Relevant Internship or Co-op experience preferred
Strong leadership skills and a track record of achieving results
Must have exceptional analytical skills and be able to work with complex data
Detail oriented with the ability to work with speed and accuracy
Must be a self-motivated, analytical and independent thinker
Results focused. Bias towards action, able to synthesize multiple pieces of information and act decisively
Effective communication skills (both oral and written) with the ability to interact with all levels of the organization
Excellent problem solving, organization and planning skills
High proficiency in tools used for data analysis such as Excel is a must, Access a plus

CompanyMcCain Foods USA Inc.

A cut above. McCain is one of the world’s most respected companies. We are proud to be a responsible, family-owned business that has grown to become a market leader in the world of frozen food. We’re a cut above and so are our people. We know that our continued success depends on our ability to attract and develop diverse people who want to learn and grow with us and care passionately about details. If you’re a cut above the rest and want to work in a world-class company that offers great working conditions and a supportive environment, then we invite you to grow with us!


McCain Foods is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of any legally protected status or characteristic. Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran

Function

Supply Chain

04-Oct-2019

Title: Technical Product Manager
FullDescriptions:
Opportunity Overview
The Turner Story

Turner is a division of WarnerMedia along with our sister companies, HBO and Warner Bros., delivering brands like CNN, HLN, TNT, TBS, Adult Swim, Cartoon Network, Turner Sports and so much more! http://www.turner.com/

See what it’s like to work at Turner! Follow us on Instagram, Twitter and Facebook

The Job

Warner Media is seeking a Technical Product Manager to define and own the requirements for several applications and libraries to create a unified data analytics collection platform which supports upcoming CCPA privacy laws. This role will define holistic technology solutions for sustainable product features with solid technical architecture, efficient implementations and robust API/SDK integrations. You will work with platform/feature product managers, developers and QA to translate product requirements into technical specs, while championing the right technical strategies.

The Daily
Establishing scope and creating technical requirements
Agile story creation, backlog maintenance and grooming and issue management
Feature prioritization
Act as evangelist and SME over your suite of products
Working with both Turner and 3rd party vendor product, development, QA and other Turner stakeholder teams on feature implementation
Coordinate integration and user acceptance testing and prioritize testing results
The Essentials
5+ years experience working writing technical requirements, or working in a technical domain, such as Coder/Engineer, QA tester/Automation specialist, web/dev ops, data analyst or other technical product ownership
4+ Years experience in Product Management, Product Owner or Project Management role
3+ years working in an agile environment working directly in software development teams with proven ability to work cross-functionally
Ability to articulate product ideas or features through effective artifacts: documentation, diagrams project plans, storyboards, etc.
Ability to create detailed and thorough documentation that enables an agile development process
Use of collaboration, project management and business tools (Confluence, Jira or similar)
Demonstrable knowledge of Agile methodologies and concepts such as sprints and user stories (agile CSPO preferred)
Able to manage time effectively in a fast paced environment, with little management supervision
Bachelors Degree or commensurate work experience
Experience working with data, analytics, business intelligence tools or Big Data
Expertise in CCPA / GDPR guidelines
Certified Scrum Product owner
Demonstrable skills creating technical documentation
The Perks

Title: Technology Spring 2020 Intern
FullDescriptions:
Opportunity Overview
About Us

WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, TCM, truTV and others.

See what it’s like to work at WarnerMedia! Discover more about the program and follow us on Instagram, Twitter and Facebook.

What does our department do?

The GTO Strategic Planning team focuses on fundamental decisions and actions that shape and guide WarnerMedia's technology strategy by providing insights and analysis on how the organization is doing against priorities and future opportunities. The team's goals are to effectively articulate not only where the organization is going and the actions needed to make progress, but to also provide metrics and key performance indicators on how we are doing against those goals.

What will you be doing?

The Data Analyst Intern will collect, study, and interpret data that will provide an in-depth understanding for management and internal business partners about key performance indicators across the Global Technology & Operations division.
Responsible for the design, implementation and delivery of complex, high quality data models to produce ongoing operational reporting, program reporting, and executive-level dashboards.
Building reports and dashboards that meet business requirements.
Developing and implementing data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.
Interpreting data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provides ongoing reports.
Acquiring data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
Identifying, analyzing, and interpreting trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Performing ad hoc analyses and data extraction requests.
Ensuring data governance and data accuracy by inspecting, cleansing and performing quality checks.
What do we require from you?
Proficient with complex SQL (multi joins, subqueries, unions) and creation of database objects (tables, views, materialized views, etc.).
Experience with one or more reporting/ visualization tool and/or common reporting tools (Crystal Reports, Qlikview, Excel PowerPivot, Tableau etc.).
Ability to think critically and analyze data trends for operational risk and efficiencies.
Detail oriented with good organizational and presentation skills.
Creative problem solver with a strong sense of ownership.
Must have the ability to produce deliverables according to schedule, ability to adapt to changes in requirements and priorities, be a self-starter, and show initiative.
Outstanding written and oral communication skills
What’s so great about this internship?
An opportunity to work with a great team that is passionate about the same thing you are!
Networking opportunities to meet people that you’d like to know!
A speaker series that introduces you to cool executives and what they do for the best brands!
Internship dates are January 21, 2020 – May 8, 2020. All interns are expected to work 20 hours per week and paid competitively based on location (relocation is not provided). Participation in the internship program is reserved for students who are currently enrolled or within 6 months post-graduation. Most positions are targeted to upperclassmen and graduate students. Candidates must be qualified and available to work at the time the application is submitted. Full-time employment is not guaranteed at the end of the program.

WarnerMedia and its subsidiaries are Equal Opportunity Employers and E-Verify users. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

Title: Teradata Lead Developer
Requirement: Based on understanding of system upstream & downstream, provide feedback and inputs on gaps in requirements and technical feasibility of requirements.
FullDescriptions:
Qualification: Bachelors in science , engineering or equivalent

Responsibility:Project Planning and Setup:

Understand the project scope, identify activities/ tasks, task level estimates, schedule, dependencies, risks and provide inputs to Module Lead for review.
Provide inputs to testing strategy, configuration, deployment, hardware/software requirement etc.
Review plan and provide feedback on gaps, timeline and execution feasibility etc as required in the project.
Participate in KT sessions conducted by customer/ other business teams and provide feedback on requirements.

Requirement Understanding and Analysis: • Analyze functional/non functional requirements and seek clarifications for better understanding of requirements.

Based on understanding of system upstream & downstream, provide feedback and inputs on gaps in requirements and technical feasibility of requirements.

Design: • Prepare the LLD/ detailed design documents based on HLD and briefing from Module Lead.

Seek inputs from the developers on specific modules as applicable.
Consolidate all modules and provide to Module Lead/ Architects/ Designers for review.
Suggest changes in design on technical grounds.
Develop components inventory for the code to be developed tying it to the nonfunctional requirements.
Perform sampling of data to understand the character/ quality of the data (project dependent in the absence of data analyst or designer).
Identify tools and technologies to be used in the project as well as reusable objects that could be customized for the project.

Coding: • Follow coding standards and best practices to develop code and check code quality.

Share developed code with supervisor for review.
Rework on the code based on inputs if required.
Perform complex integration.
Guide the developers in identifying, preparing and conducting unit test cases and fixing defects based on results.
Consolidate the test results and share with supervisor.
Provide periodic status update to supervisor and highlight / recommend any changes in design based on challenges faced.
Anticipate unreported defects and raise the same to supervisor.
Conduct technical troubleshooting.
Conduct reviews for codes created by team.

Testing Management: • Develop unit test case for each module.

Conduct/ guide conducting of unit and integration testing and fix defects.
Review/ approve code to be moved to testing environment.
Provide support to the QA team and coordinate for various phases of testing.
Address queries raised by QA within defined timelines.
Investigate critical defects and establish need for fixing.
Raise issues to leads/QA.
Report defect status as per project standard process within agreed timelines.
Share revised code with supervisor for review.
Assist team lead and project manager on estimates around defect fixes.

Configuration Management: • Maintain versions of the code or consolidate version maintained by the Developers.

Provide support as required to the Administrators during configuration, code backups, deployment etc.

Deployment: • Assess and create deployment/ roll back plan.

Validate if all the components have been migrated and the right version is checked in.
Maintain deployment tracker.
Perform sanity checks post deployment to ensure smooth production.
Share activity status with supervisor and highlight concerns if any.

Project Execution Monitoring & closure (Support to Project Management activities): • Monitor work of the developers and share work achieved with them.

Provide guidance through SDLC.
Provide status of progress to leads.
In case of change requests, provide inputs on the plan.

Service Support and Maintenance:
Specific to production and maintenance support: • Provide support for 1 week and hand over to production team.

Identify if the incoming request is a service request/ defect during the warranty or an incident.
If it is code defect in the warranty, highlight to Lead and initiate defect fix process.
Post warranty, support in transition to maintenance team.

Knowledge Management: • Post release participate in project review call and discuss points on what went well and what didn't.

Create and update knowledge articles (case studies, lessons learnt) in the knowledge management repository.
Guide developers in creating such documents.
Publish white papers/ blogs/ articles (if required).

People Management: • Conduct training through academy or internally within the team.

Conduct technical, face to face interviews for internal transfer or external hiring.
Provide feedback on Developers form technical /domain standpoint to the module lead.

Technical Skills SNo Primary Skill Proficiency Level * Rqrd./Dsrd. 1 Tableau Admin PL2 Required 2 Cognos TM1 PL2 Desired 3 Teradata PL4 Required 4 Unix PL4 Desired


Proficiency Legends Proficiency Level Generic Reference PL1 The associate has basic awareness and comprehension of the skill and is in the process of acquiring this skill through various channels. PL2 The associate possesses working knowledge of the skill, and can actively and independently apply this skill in engagements and projects. PL3 The associate has comprehensive, in-depth and specialized knowledge of the skill. She / he has extensively demonstrated successful application of the skill in engagements or projects. PL4 The associate can function as a subject matter expert for this skill. The associate is capable of analyzing, evaluating and synthesizing solutions using the skill.

Title: Tumor Registrar
FullDescriptions:
Position Description
Identifies malignant and benign cases for the oncology databases in accordance to standards of the Cancer Committee, Georgia Center for Cancer Statistics, SEER, American College of Surgeons and other accrediting bodies across all Northside facilities. Coordinates physician conferences and maintains documentation as required.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Coordinates and performs a variety of case finding methods to identify reportable cases for abstracting purposes across all Northside facilities, including but limited to electronic medical record, radiation therapy transcription, and pathology report review.
2. Adheres to case finding reportability rules in accordance to regulatory agencies and accrediting bodies, including but not limited to Georgia Center for Cancer Statistics and American College of Surgeons.
3. Adheres to case finding reportability guidelines of the Cancer Committee and other oncology program committees as needed.
4. Identifies all relevant encounters pertaining to each patient and organizes the data, across all facilities in the corresponding database.
5. Performs quality control of casefinding, utilizing but not limited to edits software and audit reports.
6. Collects diagnostic information from non-hospital sources and updates information and codes in the appropriate database. Conducts phone calls and generates letters to physicians, outside facilities as needed..
7. Releases data to outside hospital registries in accordance with HIPAA and maintains HIPAA log on all data released to outside facilities and registries
8. Coordinates the cancer conferences and physician education with CME in accordance to Medical Education guidelines as well as accrediting bodies, including but not limited to American College of Surgeons.
9. Creates and maintains budgets for cancer conferences.
10. Coordinates with various departments to ensure needed conference materials and equipment are available for each meeting.
11. Maintains minutes, grids, and other documentation required by accrediting agencies.
12. Performs follow-up as needed, including coding of recurrence date, type, and subsequent treatment.
13. Performs other clerical functions as needed.
14. Practices proper safety techniques in accordance with hospital and departmental policies and procedures. Immediately reports any mechanical or electrical equipment malfunctions, unsafe conditions, or employee/patient/visitor injury accident to Manager.
Position Requirements
Required:
1. High school diploma or equivalent.
2. Two (2) years experience as Medical Records Abstractor or Health Data Analyst.
3. Experience using computer data base systems.
4. Knowledge of anatomy, physiology, and medical terminology.

Preferred:
1. B.S. degree in Health Sciences, Medical Records Administration, or related discipline.
2. Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR), Registered Record Administrator (RRA) and/or Accredited Record Technician (ART).

License/Certification Requirements: No

Work Hours: 8a-4:30p

Weekend Requirements: No

On-Call Requirements: No

Title: Undergraduate Student Accounts Specialist - Undergraduate Student Accounts
Skills:
Knowledge of general office operations and equipment.
Computer literate.
Ability to communicate effectively both in written form and verbally.
Good command of the English language and good organizational skills.
Logical problem-solving skills with the ability to make decisions within broad limitations of University policy.
Understanding of the PeopleSoft environment and interface.
Education: BA/BS degree in a related field (or equivalent combination of experience and education.)
FullDescriptions:
APU is seeking employees who desire to engage in our thriving culture by cultivating community through professional interactions, demonstrating a posture of lifelong learning, and modeling Christ-like character. Working together, employees at APU commit to establishing a university atmosphere that is pleasing to God and edifying to one another.


The primary responsibility of this position is to assist students in determining the affordability of obtaining their education through financial aid, loans, and payment options. It is the specialist’s responsibility to oversee the accounts for their alpha group and to assist students/parents who become delinquent with payment plans. They will also provide data support for the Student Financials Data Analyst.


Required Education

BA/BS degree in a related field (or equivalent combination of experience and education.)


Required Experience

Three – five years of general business experience, preferably in a related field.


Primary Duties/Essential Functions

Maintains, corrects, and collects current student accounts as assigned. Place holds on the accounts when payments are delinquent.
Counsels students/parents with complex financial aid and loan situations, professional judgments, FAFSA problems and verification issues.
Counsels students on payment plans and explains the consequences of non-payment.
Manages the CASHNet online operation for their students, which consists of counseling parents and students for usage, follow-up on rejected items and manual payments for exceptions.
Helps students/parents set up payment plans in CASHNet. Monitors compliance with the payment plans and resolves delinquent accounts.
Mediates follow-up between student and financial aid/loan officers to finalize loan applications and verifications.
Approves graduation participation, diploma release, and policy exceptions.
Identifies non-current students for the purpose of credit refund or collection.
Counsels students on Study Abroad programs
Creates and runs queries, develops letter merge processes, develops email content, analyzes data, and audits business processes as needed by staff in support of the collections process.
Lead for the uncashed checks project.
Backup support for the process to fix a break when it occurs in the module.
Backup for external file uploads between other departments and PeopleSoft system.
Works with EA on system issues for billing, statements, payment plans, (1098T), and CASHNet
Backs up the refund process.
Attends training workshops and meetings as requested to stay current with Federal Financial Aid Regulations and Programs. Assists in collating packets as needed.
Performs other duties as assigned by supervisor.


Skills

Knowledge of general office operations and equipment.
Computer literate.
Ability to communicate effectively both in written form and verbally.
Good command of the English language and good organizational skills.
Logical problem-solving skills with the ability to make decisions within broad limitations of University policy.
Understanding of the PeopleSoft environment and interface.


Mental Demands

Ability to plan details of procedures and methods to obtain definite objectives.
Ability to understand written and verbal instructions and to understand document procedure.
Ability to exercise independent judgment and discretion.
Ability to maintain accuracy in high-stress periods
In agreement with the purpose and goals of Azusa Pacific University in providing a Christian-based higher education for its students.


Physical Demands

Intermittent sitting and standing; intermittent computer keyboard work.
Repetitive wrist and finger motions with computer keyboard work.
Talking and hearing on the telephone.
Ability to conduct business at other offices on campus.
Ability to lift, pull, grasp, bend to lower file drawers, and reach to the top of 5-drawer file cabinet.
Ability to lift up to 20 lbs. occasionally.


Visual Demands

Reading, writing notes, and computer monitor.


Environment

Pleasant office, comfortable temperature.
At times multiple conversations occurring simultaneously.


Technologies

Proficient in Google Apps., MailChimp, Microsoft Office, Word, and Excel.


Compensation

Grade 8: $21.44 - $27.87/hour


Azusa Pacific University is a Christ-centered, multicultural community that values and seeks faculty and staff who are committed to diversity, work effectively with diverse populations, and engage others in ways that honor our rich cultural mosaic and biblical foundation.


You can learn more about APU by watching the stories of faculty, staff, and alumni as they carry out our mission here: http://www.apu.edu/stories/


Azusa Pacific University will conduct a background check on all final candidates.


Review of applications will begin immediately, and the position will remain open until filled unless otherwise stated. Azusa Pacific University does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, disability, or status as a veteran in any of its policies, practices, or procedures. Women and minorities are encouraged to apply.
Required Skills

Required Experience

Title: Underwriter
Responsibilities:
Underwrite and decision agency conforming and jumbo residential mortgage loans
Verify and analyze all necessary financial information and documentation; ensure that loan files contain all necessary credit and legal documents
Review appraisal reports to identify and resolve any discrepancies discovered within
Perform thorough analysis of applicant's income and expense data, asset documentation, credit reports, and property valuations in order to affirm borrower qualifies for loan
Calculate qualifying ratios, determine creditworthiness; provide risk opinions
FullDescriptions:
About Better.com:
We're one of the fastest growing homeownership companies in America. Why? Because we're building a better way to get home and our customers love it. By combining smarter technology with an award-winning team of mortgage experts, we're making homeownership so simple it feels magical.

So far, we've:

Helped more than 10,000 families get home
Financed over $3B in loans
Saved families an average of $32,000 in fees over the life of their loans
Grew our geographic coverage to 37 states, up from 15 states from a year ago

And we're not slowing down. We continue to outpace the rest of the industry at every turn.

Our backers have helped build some of the most transformative tech and finance companies in history. Kleiner Perkins, Goldman Sachs, IA Ventures, Ally Bank, American Express, and others have invested over $85MM in Better and our vision of making homeownership magical.

A Better opportunity

Better is looking for a Mortgage Loan Underwriter to join our new team, fast-growing in Oakland, California. Using established underwriting guidelines, you will evaluate borrower financial and credit information in tandem with property valuations to inform lending decisions. Our underwriters work closely with all members of the production team throughout the process to bring loans to closing.

Beyond producing high quality loans, our goal is to build a product that will ultimately reduce the cost of homeownership in America. With offices in New York, Oakland and Gurgaon, we are quickly expanding in order deliver a delightful borrower experience through a combination of technology and people. Our new office in Irvine, California is a key part of this strategy.

In joining our Oakland team, you will have the opportunity to wear many hats, ranging from a visionary redesigning the needlessly complex mortgage process; a data analyst uncovering how to make the most impact; to a problem solver working with highly skilled engineers and industry experts to resolve technical and operational challenges.

Responsibilities will include:

Underwrite and decision agency conforming and jumbo residential mortgage loans
Verify and analyze all necessary financial information and documentation; ensure that loan files contain all necessary credit and legal documents
Review appraisal reports to identify and resolve any discrepancies discovered within
Perform thorough analysis of applicant's income and expense data, asset documentation, credit reports, and property valuations in order to affirm borrower qualifies for loan
Calculate qualifying ratios, determine creditworthiness; provide risk opinions

Attributes we value


7+ years of experience underwriting FNMA, FHLMC, and Non-Conforming mortgages
Expert knowledge of Desktop Underwriter (DU) & Loan Prospector/Loan Product Advisor (LP/LPA)
Categorical understanding of the mortgage lending process
Ability to carry out requisite loan calculations (DTI, LTV, etc.)
Capable of preparing findings reports
Ability to handle multiple files simultaneously
Strong written and verbal communication
Perform well in team environments
The drive to build something new
Management experience a plus
Ability to work from the local office - this role is not available remotely.

Things we value:

Curiosity. Why? How? Repeat.
Nerdiness. Financial news and trends are fascinating. Seriously.
Relentlessness. No one here gives up. We try. We fail. We try again.
Passion. If you don't get excited about homeownership, mortgages, and real estate, it simply won't work.
Smarts: book and street. We have to use all the tools at our disposal to build Better.
Empathy and Compassion. You understand that people's biggest dreams are in your hands.
Communication. Can you ask for help or put your hand up when you don't understand?
Building. Doing. Making. Yes, we have to do a lot of thinking and talking to figure this stuff out, but you can't wait to leave the conversation and build it.

Title: UX Designer
FullDescriptions:
Job Title: UX Designer
Area: Communications
Reports to: Lead UX Architect, Web
Classification: Exempt
Organization Overview
Rotary unites people from all continents and cultures who take action to deliver real, long-term solutions to pressing issues facing our communities. Each year, Rotary members invest more than $200 million and 16 million volunteer hours to improve lives and create positive change in the world. In exchange for hard work and dedication in support of Rotary’s clubs and humanitarian initiatives, our employees receive competitive salaries, flexible schedules, comprehensive benefits, and job enrichment. To learn more, visit http://www.rotary.org.
Rotary’s Commitment to Diversity
As a global network that strives to build a world where people unite and take action to create lasting change, Rotary values diversity and celebrates the contributions of people of all backgrounds, regardless of their age, ethnicity, race, color, abilities, religion, socioeconomic status, culture, sex, sexual orientation, and gender identity.
General Overview
We are a rapidly-growing and highly-capable UX team who are tasked with building experiences for a global audience in eight languages. Our team collaborates with product groups, developers, and others to deliver intuitive and innovative solutions in an Agile environment. We endeavor to add a user centric perspective in all aspects of our process.
Our UX Designers are responsible for shaping the experiences of our users through a range of tools and services. Working in a team, and independently, they create experiences informed by user needs and business objectives.
They also help craft engaging, and interactive, layouts that transform our feature stories into memorable experiences.
The person in this position will collaborate with other UX designers, visual designers, developers, product owners, marketing, and content creators.
You Will Have
3+ years of professional experience with design and development of interactive software interfaces and/or website.
BA/BS in a relevant field or an equivalent demonstrated mix of education and experience
Flexibility of approach in providing, or creating, the best solutions based on product/team need
Ability to perform all user testing/research related tasks
Working knowledge of industry standards, protocols, and methodologies for both responsive and app design
Ability to synthesize user testing/research findings into clear guidance for team members, stakeholders, developers, and others
Proficiency in industry standard prototyping tools for static and interactive deliverables
Proficiency in industry standard visual design tools to create high-fidelity mockups
Experience working in a DSDM/Agile/Lean iterative project management/development model
Ability to articulate your concepts and design decisions
Online portfolio, ideally, with detailed examples that illustrate the challenges you were tasked with, solutions you provided, and how they performed

You Are Good At
You are a user advocate who strives to know the users better than they know themselves.
You have an entrepreneurial mindset, proactively problem-solving and innovating.
You consider yourself adept at negotiating priority vs timeline trade-offs with project stakeholders.
You often find yourself advocating the for UCD/UX best practices and understand “we are not the users”.
You have an interest in UX beyond applications and websites.
You Will Be Responsible For
Providing UX function as part of a cross-functional team
Working with Data Analyst to inform decision making and direction
Building relationships with key SMEs to gain deeper insights
Managing relationships with research related vendors
Participating in and/or leading user-experience research and usability studies
Participating in, and contributing to, regular design reviews and other team-wide design efforts

Why Work for Rotary?
Generous medical, dental, and vision benefits package
Progressive 401k matching contributions
Above market and generous paid time off package
Tuition reimbursement
Professional development opportunities
On-site cafeteria and coffee bar with special pricing for Rotary employees
Flextime-several different work schedules to choose from
Close to CTA, Metra, a variety of stores, and many food options

What you do will make a difference in the world.
Your research will help to build better tools that help our members improve lives around the world. Our team gets to be part of helping causes like eradicating polio globally or building a corner playground in our own community.
Work-life balance is more than just a phase.
Our team values your time and that you have a life outside of working with us. We offer a remote flex-day, summer hours, and off-site team-building activities.
We value your professional development.
Our team members enjoy self-directed professional development time. We also want you to stay inspired and up-to-date on industry trends. That is why we have a professional development budget for training classes, professional events, and seminars.

SUMMARY
Provides administrative support in the coordination and monitoring of activities of the customer services requests and front office activities.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Provides administrative support to Fleet Program Managers with coordinating activities associated with maintenance repair and acquisition and disposal of vehicles and equipment. Performs initial processing of vehicles and equipment in for servicing and/or repairs. Ensures that information is supplied to the Data Analyst in a timely manner. Arranges for customers to pick-up repaired vehicles, ride-share, and inspection processes for all DC Water fleet vehicles.
Ensures Share Ride and Motor Pool vehicles are available to provide transportation for DC Water representatives on business. Ensures that Share Ride and Motor Pool vehicles information is maintained as a ready and reliable source of fleet transportation services in the fleet management information system.
Assists in coordinating the inspection and preparation of all new vehicles before release to the user. Coordinates annual crane and bucket truck inspections. Coordinates service requests with the onsite contractors. Conducts limited special fleet management studies for the Director and Program Managers requiring written presentations of findings, recommendations, forecasts, and justifications.
Assists with maintaining computer-based records. Receives and reads incoming correspondence. Prepares responses where appropriate. Compiles and summarizes information and data; identifies inaccuracies or anomalies in the information; and makes written recommendations to resolve discrepancies.
Periodically operates and/or transports Authority vehicles, to include vehicles that require a Commercial Driver’s License. Complies with applicable safety rules and regulations. Performs other duties and projects as assigned at the discretion of the immediate supervisor.

Supervisory Responsibilities: N/A

Key Working Relationships: Interacts with co-workers in the Department and throughout the Authority, contractors, vendors, representatives from other organizations, etc.
•

EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE & OTHER MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:
The minimum qualifications listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and ability necessary for an individual to perform each essential function satisfactorily. Reasonable amounts of training are provided.

High School diploma or General Educational Development (GED) certificate and four (4) years of progressive experience associated with administrative activities in a fleet maintenance program.
Must possess and maintain current, or obtain six (6) months from date of hire and maintain current, a valid Motor Vehicle Operating License, Commercial Driver’s License, Class B.
An Automotive Service Excellence (ASE) certification or National Automotive Technician Education Foundation (NATEF) certification is preferred.
Skill in communicating, orally and in writing.
Utilizes personal computer and maintains a working knowledge of applicable software programs (i.e. word processing, spreadsheets, fleet management information systems, Microsoft applications e-mail, etc.).

PHYSICAL DEMANDS OF THE WORK ENVIRONMENT:
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


Subject to indoor and/or outdoor environmental conditions that include exposure to extreme cold and/or hot temperatures.
Subject to noise, vibration, and to hazards from a variety of physical conditions.
Subject to atmospheric conditions that affect the respiratory system or skin such as fumes, odors, dusts, mists, gases or poor ventilation, or to exposure to oils or other cutting fluids.

We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V.
We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

Title: Visiting Senior Research Specialist-Health Systems Science
FullDescriptions:
This position is a principle contributor in developing specific research project requirements and is responsible for all aspects of the project from development through delivery. Perform complex study and data collection methods. May coordinate and direct the work and research tasks of lower level research staff.
Duties:
Research
Develop objectives and design of research and data collection procedures. Conceptualize, initiate and execute research goals for project.
Conduct and coordinate advanced research studies. Analyze and interpret data and results and refine study design.
Develop and write advanced study protocols
Evaluate current developments and research findings to determine their potential applicability to research projects.
Replicate, refine and add/develop new research approaches based on project needs. Advise on new direction for research based on study results.
 Design tracking system for participant engagement including recruitment, enrollment, multiple phases of 3-week data collection, and payment.
Develop research protocol for complex data collection from set-up to data downloading and file storage including baseline and follow-up visits and surveys, smartphone-based ecological momentary assessment, GPS tracking, accelerometer, and dietary assessment.
Monitor all day-to-day aspects of participant data collection including scheduling and engagement, monitoring of adherence, follow-up, and payment. Advise PI of issues and refine tracking system and research protocol as the study progresses.
Communications
Monitor project developments on an ongoing basis and implement changes as needed.
Prepare, organize and communicate research results. Write papers, grants, and other documents for publication based on research findings.
Author and co-author articles for publication and present at scientific symposia and conferences.
Contribute as a first author or co-author to research presentations and publications.
Conduct some visits and follow-up telephone calls with participants to implement the research protocol.
Staff Management
May act as supervisor or team lead in directing and coordinating the work of lower level staff. Guide, train and advise lower level researchers and students on techniques, methods and procedures.
Plan, assign and review work of staff to ensure that group objectives are met. Hire, train, develop and manage staff to ensure that a qualified staff exists to meet group objectives.
Hire, train, and supervise research staff including GIS technician, data collector, data analyst, post-doctoral fellow, and research assistant.
Perform other related duties and participate in special projects as assigned.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in social science or related field required. Master’s degree in social science preferred.
A minimum of 5 years related research experience.
Possesses and applies advanced knowledge of research principles, concepts, practices and methods
To Apply:
Please include a cover letter detailing qualifications and interest, CV/resume, and list of 2-3 professional references.

Title: Web Analytics Specialist
FullDescriptions:
The web analytics specialist is part of the Digital Media Web Analytics team, responsible for driving deeper customer analytics and insights for the Creative Cloud business on Adobe.com. The team is responsible for deeper understanding of Adobe’s ability to deliver an optimal customer experience to attract, convert and retain Creative Cloud customers. The team measures all aspects of the web marketing strategy to ensure high conversion, retention and engagement rates on the site. The web analytics specialist will be an excellent Adobe Analytics and big data analyst that excels in data storytelling.
Responsibilities:
Partner with go to market teams, marketing and product teams to deliver insight and understanding of customer behavior on Adobe.com
Synthesize Adobe Analytics and Hadoop data to drive deeper understanding of site activity and customer journeys
Understand key business priorities and marketing goals for Adobe.com and create an analytics roadmap for the site to support sales and marketing goals
Identify site requirements to ensure proper tracking of new pages and experiences; work closely with the analytics enablement team to ensure requirements are implemented
Set and deliver on web goals and targets to drive improvements to web traffic, conversion, engagement, and retention
Collaborate with other marketing analytics teams and researchers and contribute to holistic funnel measurement
Work with analytics teams and technology partners to drive the next generation of analytics tools
Analytics Skill Set:
Expert with Adobe Analytics analysis and insight generation. Able to prioritize and establish analytics strategy to deliver actionable insights.
Strong analytical and quantitative orientation with advanced SQL knowledge in large, complex data environments
Expert with Hadoop/big data environments to synthesize and analyze data
Expert at the creation and use of Excel pivot tables to drive analytics . Tableau skills strongly desired.
Strong knowledge of online marketing strategies
Ability to knit together Adobe Analytics and customer attribute data to deliver robust insights into customer behavior on Adobe.com
Experience forecasting website traffic/orders desired, but not mandatory
Data management and modeling a plus
Leadership
Proactive driver of initiatives with an excellent ability to multitask
Ability to prioritize across diverse stakeholder needs
Partner with eCommerce, marketing, IT and web strategy teams to develop analytics and insights to acquire and retain customers
Collaborate across functional teams to deliver insights and observations on customers and marketing effectiveness. Strong interpersonal skills are a must.
Collaborate with IT and analytics enablement teams to ensure timely capture of analytics data and delivery of insights
Strong communication and presentation skills:
Ideal candidate can communicate clearly, concisely, effectively across multiple levels within the organization. They can tell a story from the data including recommendations that impact the business. The ability to transform data into clear PowerPoint based presentations for senior leaders – and explain the story behind the data - is critical for success.
Other:
4+ years related work experience in online e-commerce environments
MBA desirable
At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists . You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.
If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.
Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age , sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

Title: Web Developer, BI Reporting
FullDescriptions:
Job Description

As a Business Intelligence Report Developer, you will be the champion of OT reporting and intranet development. You will have the opportunity to develop a single source of truth to support then entire OT organization including senior leadership. We are looking for an enthusiastic, curious, and innovative team member with a drive to deliver quality initiatives and who is detail oriented. You will work closely with the larger Business Intelligence and Analysis team in the support of the Enterprise Data Assets team to develop web based and PowerBI reporting which will utilize a variety of data sources. In addition, you will help to support legacy reporting and research questions on all reporting originating from the Business Intelligence team.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Understand your business stakeholders’ objectives, key metrics, and how they measure their performance.
Develop adhoc reporting utilizing various tools such as SQL, Microsoft Office (Excel), Power BI, MS Visual Studio and similar tools.
Deep expertise and hands on experience with Web Applications and programming languages such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, C#, .NET and API's.
Act as the subject matter expert of business data, database structures, business rules and the owner of intranet development and support.
Utilize best practices displaying large amounts of data visually and effectively, while adequately documenting analysis, designs and results.
Deep functional knowledge or hands on design experience with Web Services is needed to be successful in this position.
Strong grasp of security principles and how they apply to E-Commerce applications is a plus.
Meet with internal customers to gather required reporting and dashboard requirements, working with them to identify and close requirement gaps.
Identify and understand the correct data sources for a given analysis.
Create technical documentation for adhoc reporting and data request on an as-needed basis.
Identify opportunities to automate regular processes, track issues, and document changes.
Coordinate code reviews with data analysts to ensure quality of data.
Train analysts and business users on report usage and interpretation.

Qualifications

5+ years of recent experience business intelligence or comparable data engineering role, including data warehousing and business intelligence tools, techniques and technologies.
Demonstrated experience in a report development, business analytics, business intelligence or comparable role, with proven experience as a report, campaign/list pull, or data analyst.
Utilize business intelligence tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Qlikview and more.
Proven ability to guide customers in refining data needs.
Ability to facilitate information and requirements gathering sessions.
Ability to write and troubleshoot new and existing SQL queries.
Ability to write and troubleshoot new and existing intranet web reports
Performance tuning/Optimization experience related to reporting queries.
Experience working with a star-schema data warehouse.
Knowledgeable of Microsoft Office with an advanced knowledge of Excel.
Experience using Jira or other workflow management tool.
Advanced experience working with SQL Server Management Studio.
Advanced experience working with Microsoft Visual Studio
Experience with Microsoft business intelligence tools, techniques and technologies a plus - SQL Server, SSRS & PowerBI.
Previous working knowledge and highly proficient in HTML, VB.NET, C#, JavaScript, jQuery and other Front-End Technologies.
Familiar with Development and Debugging tools for cross-browser issues.
Show confidence in work relationships and be responsible for making others aware of issues, delays and other needs.
Additional Information

One Technologies offers attractive compensation, 100% company-paid health and dental insurance, short term and long-term disability coverage, paid health club membership, tuition reimbursement and flexible working hours in a casual, open, creative environment.
To all recruitment agencies
One Technologies does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our careers alias, company recruiters or other One Technologies employees. One Technologies is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
